question_text: 40 year old man with recurrent glioblastoma. Diagnosed 1 year ago, underwent gross total resection with confirmation of GBM, IDH wildtype. Completed adjuvant radiation + concurrent temozolomide and then adjuvant temozolomide. Three months after completing adjuvant therapy, MRI shows recurrence. ECOG 1 and no other medical issues. What are trial options?
trial_title: Phase I/Ib Study of Sarasar and Temodar in Patients with Recurrent or Temodar-Refractory Glioblastoma Multiforme
inclusion_criteria: Histologically proven supratentorial glioblastoma multiforme or gliosarcoma | Radiographic evidence of tumor recurrence or progression by MRI/CT after radiation therapy | Imaging within 14 days prior to registration with stable or decreasing steroid dose for >=5 days | Post-resection patients: >=2 weeks from surgery, recovered with adequate wound healing | Post-resection imaging: CT/MRI within 96 hours post-op or >=4 weeks post-op (within 14 days of registration) with stable steroids for 5 days | Karnofsky performance status >=60 | Recovered from prior therapy toxicities | Washouts: >=4 weeks from prior cytotoxic therapy; >=2 weeks from vincristine; >=6 weeks from nitrosoureas; >=3 weeks from procarbazine; >=1 week from non-cytotoxic agents
exclusion_criteria: Current use of enzyme-inducing anticonvulsants (primidone, carbamazepine, phenobarbital, phenytoin) or not off them for at least 72 hours prior to treatment | History of another cancer (except non-melanoma skin cancer or cervical carcinoma in situ) unless in complete remission and off all therapy for >=3 years | Uncontrolled active infection | Serious intercurrent medical illness or conditions that could obscure toxicity or alter drug metabolism | Any prior treatment with farnesyl transferase inhibitors | Prior recurrence while receiving a farnesyl transferase inhibitor | Use of oral contraceptives or other hormonal birth control methods (e.g., depot medroxyprogesterone)
prior_therapies: Prior temozolomide required; No prior farnesyl transferase inhibitor therapy allowed; Up to 2 prior chemotherapy regimens for recurrent/progressive disease allowed; Phase 1b expansion: at least 2 cycles of adjuvant temozolomide required; Washout: >=4 weeks from prior cytotoxic therapy; Washout: >=2 weeks from vincristine; Washout: >=6 weeks from nitrosoureas; Washout: >=3 weeks from procarbazine; Washout: >=1 week from non-cytotoxic agents
reasoning: Disease and setting align (recurrent glioblastoma post-radiation/temozolomide), and prior-exposure requirements are met (prior temozolomide, no prior farnesyl transferase inhibitor). Age/sex fit eligibility, and no explicit exclusions are evident from the provided data.
patient_inclusion_criteria: Age 40 years; Male; Recurrent glioblastoma; IDH wildtype; Status post gross total resection; Completed radiation with concurrent temozolomide and adjuvant temozolomide; ECOG 1; No other medical issues
patient_prior_therapies: Gross total resection; Adjuvant radiation with concurrent temozolomide; Adjuvant temozolomide
judge_comment: No hard exclusions. Disease matches (recurrent GBM). Stage/setting matches (recurrent). Line/prior exposure matches (prior temozolomide; no prior FTI). No required biomarkers or metastatic pattern constraints. ≥2 core anchors match with no soft conflicts → A.

question_text: 36 female with stage III clear cell ovarian carcinoma, who initially received optimal debulking and adjuvant carboplatin+paclitaxel +bevacizumab. After 5 months, she had a new pleural effusion that was cytology positive for ovarian carcinoma. She was found to be BRCA1 positive. What are trial options?
trial_title: A Phase 1/2 Trial of ABT-888, an Inhibitor of Poly(ADP-ribose) Polymerase (PARP), and Topotecan (TPT) in Patients With Solid Tumors (Phase 1) and Relapsed Ovarian Cancer or Primary Peritoneal Cancer (Phase 2) After Prior Platinum Containing First-Line Chemotherapy
diseases_targeted: Solid Tumor (metastatic); Solid Tumor (unresectable); Ovarian Cancer (recurrent); Fallopian Tube Cancer (recurrent); Primary Peritoneal Cancer (recurrent)
inclusion_criteria: Phase I: Histologically confirmed solid tumor that is metastatic or unresectable and lacks standard curative or life-extending therapy | Phase II: Biopsy-proven ovarian, fallopian tube, or primary peritoneal cancer | Fewer than 3 prior lines of therapy and relapse less than 1 year from last platinum regimen | Measurable disease with at least one lesion >= 2.0 cm (conventional) or >= 1.0 cm (spiral CT) | Absolute neutrophil count >= 1500/µL | Hemoglobin >= 9.0 g/dL | Platelets >= 100,000/µL | Total bilirubin <= 1.5 x ULN | AST or ALT <= 2.5 x ULN (stricter general threshold) | Creatinine <= 1.5 x ULN | INR <= 1.4 unless on therapeutic warfarin | PTT <= 48 s | ECOG performance status 0-2 | Life expectancy >= 12 weeks | Negative pregnancy test for females of childbearing potential | Able to swallow and absorb oral medication
exclusion_criteria: Standard therapy exists that is potentially curative or capable of extending life expectancy | Prior treatment with a PARP inhibitor or topotecan | Uncontrolled intercurrent illness (e.g., active infection, symptomatic congestive heart failure, unstable angina, cardiac arrhythmia, significant psychiatric illness) | Chemotherapy within 4 weeks | Mitomycin C or nitrosoureas within 6 weeks | Immunotherapy within 4 weeks | Biologic therapy within 4 weeks | Radiation therapy within 4 weeks | Radiation to > 25% of bone marrow | Investigational therapy within 4 weeks (hormone therapy for prostate cancer allowed) | Failure to recover from acute reversible effects of prior chemotherapy | NYHA class III or IV heart failure | Known CNS metastases or seizure disorder unless treated and stable >= 6 months without steroids and without seizures | Pregnant or nursing | Men or women of childbearing potential unwilling to use adequate contraception | Significant co-morbid systemic illness that would interfere with safety assessment | Immunocompromised state or known HIV positive | Receiving another investigational agent for the primary neoplasm | Other active malignancy except non-melanoma skin cancer or carcinoma in situ of the cervix | History of myocardial infarction within 6 months | Congestive heart failure requiring ongoing maintenance therapy for life-threatening ventricular arrhythmias | More than 2 prior chemotherapy regimens for the current malignancy
prior_therapies: < 3 prior lines of therapy and relapse < 1 year from last platinum regimen; No chemotherapy within 4 weeks prior to registration; No mitomycin C or nitrosoureas within 6 weeks prior to registration; No immunotherapy within 4 weeks prior to registration; No biologic therapy within 4 weeks prior to registration; No radiation therapy within 4 weeks prior to registration; No investigational therapy within 4 weeks prior to registration
reasoning: The trial targets relapsed ovarian cancer and the patient (36-year-old female with recurrent clear cell ovarian cancer) fits the disease/setting and age/sex. She has only one prior platinum-based regimen and no prior PARP/topotecan exposure, aligning with line/prior requirements; other specifics (e.g., relapse interval, measurable disease, labs) are unspecified but not conflicting.
patient_inclusion_criteria: Stage III clear cell ovarian carcinoma; Cytology-positive pleural effusion; BRCA1 positive; Female; Age 36 years
patient_prior_therapies: Optimal debulking surgery; Adjuvant carboplatin plus paclitaxel plus bevacizumab
judge_comment: No hard exclusions. Disease and stage/setting (recurrent ovarian cancer post-platinum) match. However, a key line-of-therapy requirement—relapse <1 year from last platinum—is unknown, so the Line/prior anchor cannot be counted as a clear match. With exactly one clear anchor (stage/setting) and no soft conflicts, the correct grade is B, not A.

question_text: 40 year old man with recurrent glioblastoma. Diagnosed 1 year ago, underwent gross total resection with confirmation of GBM, IDH wildtype. Completed adjuvant radiation + concurrent temozolomide and then adjuvant temozolomide. Three months after completing adjuvant therapy, MRI shows recurrence. ECOG 1 and no other medical issues. What are trial options?
trial_title: A Phase I Study of Oral Carboxyamidotriazole Orotate (CTO) Titrated as a Single Agent in Patients With Advanced or Metastatic Solid Tumors and Titrated in Combination Therapy With Temodar® for Patients With Glioblastoma and Other Recurrent Malignant Gliomas or in Combination With Temodar® and Radiation Therapy for Patients With Newly Diagnosed Glioblastoma and Malignant Gliomas
inclusion_criteria: Histologically confirmed advanced or metastatic solid tumor refractory to or without standard therapy (Arm A) | Measurable disease per RECIST 1.1 (Arm A) | Received prior anticancer therapy or not eligible for established conventional therapy (Arm A) | Recovered from acute adverse effects of prior therapies to baseline or <= grade 1 (all applicable arms) | ECOG performance status 0–2 (all arms) | Age >= 18 years (all arms) | Adequate bone marrow, renal, and hepatic function (see labs) (Arm A) | Life expectancy >= 12 weeks (Arm A) | Histologically proven malignant glioblastoma or other recurrent malignant gliomas (Arm B) | Measurable tumor on gadolinium-enhanced MRI (Arm B) | Life expectancy >= 8 weeks (Arm B) | Unequivocal radiographic progression by MRI within 14 days; on stable steroid dose >= 5 days or new baseline MRI if dose increased (Arm B) | Postoperative eligibility if recovered from surgery and residual disease assessed by MRI within required windows (Arm B) | Prior radiation therapy with or without chemotherapy and progressed; interval >= 12 weeks from completion of radiation to registration (Arm B) | On stable dose of non–CYP3A4-inhibiting/inducing antiepileptic drugs for >= 2 weeks with no seizures at registration (Arms B and C) | Histologically proven newly diagnosed glioblastoma or other malignant gliomas (Arm C) | Life expectancy >= 8 weeks (Arm C) | MRI within 14 days prior to registration; on stable steroid dose >= 5 days or new baseline MRI if dose increased (Arm C)
exclusion_criteria: Prior chemotherapy, hormonal therapy, radiation therapy, or biologic therapy within 4 weeks (6 weeks for mitomycin C or nitrosoureas); for targeted therapy, < 5 half-lives or < 28 days (whichever is shorter) (Arms A and B) | For Arm B, shorter washouts allowed: 14 days vincristine; 21 days procarbazine; 7 days for non-cytotoxic agents (interferon, tamoxifen, thalidomide, cis-retinoic acid) | Any concomitant condition compromising study objectives/compliance or ability to tolerate therapy (e.g., CHF, uncontrolled angina, MI within 1 year, uncontrolled hypertension, dysrhythmias, active infection, unstable diabetes, psychiatric disorder) (all arms) | Pregnant or breastfeeding (all arms) | Another malignancy within 3 years except curatively treated non-melanoma skin cancer or carcinoma in situ of cervix or breast not requiring further treatment (all arms) | Known HIV, HBV, or HCV infection (all arms) | Underlying diagnosis/disease state with increased risk of bleeding (all arms) | Central nervous system metastases, leptomeningeal disease, brain involvement, or seizure disorder (Arm A) | Uncontrolled seizure activity (Arms B and C) | Treatment with known CYP3A4 inhibitors or inducers (all arms) | No prior chemotherapy, hormonal therapy, or biologic therapy for gliomas (Arm C) | Anaplastic oligodendroglioma with 1p/19q deletion or unknown 1p/19q status (Arm C)
prior_therapies: Prior anticancer therapy allowed or ineligible for standard therapy (Arm A); Washout >= 4 weeks from prior chemotherapy, hormonal therapy, radiation therapy, or biologic therapy (>= 6 weeks for mitomycin C or nitrosoureas) (Arms A and B); For prior targeted therapy, washout >= 5 half-lives or 28 days (whichever is shorter) (Arms A and B); Shorter washouts permitted in Arm B: 14 days vincristine; 21 days procarbazine; 7 days non-cytotoxic agents (interferon, tamoxifen, thalidomide, cis-retinoic acid); Prior radiation therapy required with progression; >= 12 weeks since completion of radiation (Arm B); No prior chemotherapy, hormonal therapy, or biologic therapy for gliomas (Arm C); Recovery to baseline or <= grade 1 from prior therapy adverse effects before enrollment (all arms)
reasoning: Disease and setting match Arm B (recurrent glioblastoma after prior radiation/temozolomide); age ≥18 and ECOG 1 meet criteria with no stated conflicting exclusions. Some required details (measurable MRI lesion, steroid stability, washout intervals, AED use) are unspecified but not hard mismatches.
patient_inclusion_criteria: Age 40 years; Male; Recurrent glioblastoma; IDH wildtype; Status post gross total resection; Completed radiation with concurrent temozolomide and adjuvant temozolomide; ECOG 1; No other medical issues
patient_prior_therapies: Gross total resection; Adjuvant radiation with concurrent temozolomide; Adjuvant temozolomide
judge_comment: No hard exclusions. Disease matches Arm B (recurrent glioblastoma). Stage/setting matches (recurrent) and prior-exposure compatibility matches (post-RT/TMZ, prior RT required). Other specifics (measurable MRI lesion, steroid stability, washout, AEDs) are unknown, not mismatches. Thus ≥2 core anchors match with no soft conflicts → A.

question_text: What are trial options for a 66 year old male with hx hypertension, afib, T2DM and mCRPC, now progressing on enzalutamide? He has been on Lupron+Zytiga for 3 years, with new liver and bone metastases which are all PSMA PET avid. He’s tolerated therapy well overall except for grade 2 fatigue.
trial_title: Adoptive Transfer of Autologous T Cells Targeted to Prostate Specific Membrane Antigen (PSMA) for the Treatment of Castrate Metastatic Prostate Cancer (CMPC)
inclusion_criteria: Male, age >= 18 years | Karnofsky >= 70% | Histologic confirmation of prostate cancer at MSKCC | Progressive castrate metastatic prostate cancer | Soft tissue progression per RECIST 1.0 | Bone disease progression per PCWG2 with >= 2 new lesions on bone scan | Rising PSA on >= 3 successive determinations >= 2 weeks apart meeting protocol thresholds (and evidence of metastases present) | PSA rise timing after anti-androgen discontinuation: within 2 weeks if second-line therapy | PSA rise timing after anti-androgen discontinuation: after 4 weeks if first-line therapy | Evidence of metastatic disease on imaging (bone scan, CT, and/or MRI) at any time after initial diagnosis | Castrate serum testosterone < 50 ng/mL achieved by prior orchiectomy or LHRH agonist with or without anti-androgen | WBC >= 3000/µL | Absolute neutrophil count >= 1500/µL | Platelets >= 100000/µL | Hemoglobin >= 10 g/dL | Bilirubin < 1.5 x ULN (Gilbert's permitted) | ALT < 2.5 x ULN | AST < 2.5 x ULN | Creatinine < 1.5 x ULN | Negative screening for HIV, HBV antigen, and HCV
exclusion_criteria: History of non-prostate primary malignant cancer (except non-melanoma skin cancer) within 5 years | History of splenectomy | Autoimmune or antibody-mediated disease (e.g., SLE, rheumatoid arthritis, ulcerative colitis, Crohn's disease, temporal arteritis, thyroiditis) | Clinically significant cardiac disease (NYHA Class III/IV) or severe debilitating pulmonary disease | Radiation therapy within 4 weeks prior to Day -1 | More than one prior chemotherapy regimen | Use within 4 weeks before Week 1: systemic radiopharmaceuticals (e.g., samarium-153), hematopoietic growth factors other than erythropoietin, medroxyprogesterone as appetite stimulant, or alternative prostate cancer treatments (e.g., Prostasol, saw palmetto, Zyflamend) | Active CNS or symptomatic epidural metastatic disease | Infection requiring antibiotics within 7 days of Day -1 | Requirement for daily systemic corticosteroids or other immunosuppressive/immunomodulatory agents (topical/nasal/physiologic steroids permitted) | Live attenuated vaccines within 8 weeks prior to Day -1 and throughout the study | Subunit or killed vaccines within 2 weeks prior to Day -1 and throughout the study (influenza vaccination permitted between Week 12–16 and after Week 20) | Positive stool guaiac (excluding hemorrhoids or documented radiation-induced proctitis if tested) | Participation in a therapeutic study or receipt of an investigational drug within 4 weeks of leukapheresis | Allergy to ganciclovir or acyclovir
prior_therapies: Prior orchiectomy or LHRH agonist to achieve castrate testosterone required; If anti-androgen discontinued: document PSA rise within 2 weeks (second-line) or after 4 weeks (first-line) before enrollment; Washout: radiation therapy >= 4 weeks before Day -1; Washout: systemic radiopharmaceuticals, non-erythropoietin hematopoietic growth factors, medroxyprogesterone as appetite stimulant, and alternative prostate cancer treatments >= 4 weeks before Week 1; Washout: live attenuated vaccines >= 8 weeks before Day -1; subunit/killed vaccines >= 2 weeks before Day -1; Washout: investigational drug >= 4 weeks before leukapheresis
reasoning: Disease and stage match mCRPC; the patient is a 66-year-old male with prior LHRH therapy and progression on AR-targeted therapy, fitting the trial’s progressive castrate metastatic setting. Metastatic pattern (bone/liver) is allowed, and no explicit exclusion is triggered based on provided data.
patient_inclusion_criteria: Age 66 years; Male sex; Metastatic castration-resistant prostate cancer; Progression on enzalutamide; PSMA PET avid liver and bone metastases
patient_prior_therapies: Progression on enzalutamide; Prior abiraterone (Zytiga) with leuprolide (Lupron) for 3 years
judge_comment: No hard exclusions. Disease matches mCRPC. Stage/setting matches (progressive castrate metastatic). Line/prior exposure compatible (prior LHRH and AR-targeted therapy; no disallowed chemo). Metastatic pattern acceptable (no CNS). Required biomarkers not specified; none contradicted. ≥2 core anchors match with no soft conflicts, so A is appropriate.

question_text: 55 year old male with metastatic urothelial carcinoma, now progressing after second line therapy. Initially diagnosed with MIBC 3 years ago. He received neoadjuvant gemcitabine/cisplatin x 4 cycles and then cystectomy with pCR. 6 months later he presented with new bone metastases. Biopsy confirmed metastatic urothelial cancer. He was started on EV+pembrolizumab and after 6 cycles, scans showed worsening osseous mets and now new liver lesions. He has a hx of T2DM, COPD, and CKD with eGFR 35. What are trial options?
trial_title: An Early Phase 1 Study of ABT-888 in Combination With Carboplatin and Paclitaxel in Patients With Hepatic or Renal Dysfunction and Solid Tumors
diseases_targeted: Breast Cancer; Carcinoma of Unknown Primary; Endometrial Cancer; Esophageal Cancer; Lung Cancer; Head and Neck Cancer; Testicular Cancer; Melanoma; Ovarian Cancer; Urothelial Carcinoma
inclusion_criteria: Histologically confirmed metastatic or unresectable malignancy with expected responsiveness to carboplatin/paclitaxel | ECOG <=2 | Life expectancy >12 weeks | Absolute neutrophil count >= 1,500/µL | Platelets >= 100,000/µL | Hemoglobin >= 8.0 g/dL | All degrees of renal dysfunction allowed, including hemodialysis | Mild to severe hepatic dysfunction allowed | Total bilirubin <= 5 x ULN | AST and ALT <= 10 x ULN | For patients with biliary stent: stable labs within hepatic group from two readings 3 days apart, taken >=10 days after stent placement; no obstruction within last 2 months if stent placed >2 months ago
exclusion_criteria: Chemotherapy or radiotherapy within 4 weeks (6 weeks for nitrosoureas or mitomycin C) or unresolved toxicities from prior therapy | Concurrent treatment with other investigational agents | Allergy to veliparib or compounds of similar chemical/biologic composition or to study agents | Peripheral neuropathy > grade 1 | Inability to take oral medications continuously | Bleeding diathesis | Active or unstable CNS metastases or requirement for steroid treatment | Uncontrolled intercurrent illness (e.g., active infection, symptomatic congestive heart failure, unstable angina, significant arrhythmia, psychiatric illness limiting compliance) | Pregnant or breastfeeding | HIV-positive on combination antiretroviral therapy with potential for PK interactions | Concurrent hepatic and renal dysfunction | Progressed on prior carboplatin plus paclitaxel therapy | Active seizure or history of seizure disorder
prior_therapies: Prior chemotherapy or radiotherapy allowed with washout >=4 weeks (>=6 weeks for nitrosoureas or mitomycin C); Prior veliparib permitted
reasoning: Urothelial carcinoma is included, and the patient’s metastatic setting aligns with the trial’s metastatic/unresectable population; prior therapies are permitted with washout, and age/sex fit. No known exclusion is triggered, though prior progression on carboplatin+paclitaxel would exclude if present (unknown here).
patient_inclusion_criteria: (none)
judge_comment: No hard exclusions are confirmed. Disease matches and the metastatic setting matches (1 anchor). Line/prior-exposure compatibility is uncertain due to the trial’s explicit exclusion for prior progression on carboplatin+paclitaxel; the patient’s prior exposure is unknown, so this anchor cannot be counted as a match. With exactly one anchor matched and no soft conflicts, the correct grade is B, not A.

trial_title: A Phase I Trial of Bevacizumab, Temsirolimus Alone and in Combination With Valproic Acid, or Cetuximab in Patients With Advanced Malignancy and Other Indications
diseases_targeted: Advanced Malignant Neoplasm; Metastatic Malignant Neoplasm; Recurrent Malignant Neoplasm; Refractory Malignant Neoplasm; Lymphangioleiomyomatosis; Neurofibromatosis Type 2; Erdheim-Chester Disease; Castleman Disease
inclusion_criteria: Advanced or metastatic cancer refractory to standard therapy, relapsed after standard therapy, or without effective standard therapy | Relentlessly progressive benign diseases eligible: lymphangioleiomyomatosis, neurofibromatosis type 2, Erdheim-Chester disease, Castleman disease | >= 4 weeks since last therapeutic radiation or cytotoxic chemotherapy or antibody therapy | >= 5 half-lives since last non-cytotoxic targeted or biologic therapy | Palliative radiation allowed if not to the only target lesion | ECOG performance status <=2 | Karnofsky >= 60% | Lansky >= 60% (for participants <=16 years) | Absolute neutrophil count >= 1,000/µL | Platelets >= 50,000/µL | Creatinine <= 3 x ULN | Total bilirubin <= 3.0 mg/dL | AST <= 5 x ULN | ALT <= 5 x ULN | Fasting total cholesterol <= 350 mg/dL | Triglycerides <= 400 mg/dL
exclusion_criteria: Clinically significant unexplained bleeding within 28 days prior to enrollment | Uncontrolled hypertension (systolic blood pressure > 140 mmHg or diastolic blood pressure > 90 mmHg on medication) | History of cerebrovascular accident within 6 months | Myocardial infarction within 6 months | Unstable angina or unstable angina pectoris | Pregnant or breast-feeding | Hypersensitivity to bevacizumab or murine products or any component of its formulation | Hypersensitivity to temsirolimus, sirolimus, polysorbate 80, or any component of its formulation | Hypersensitivity to cetuximab, murine products, or any component of its formulation | Concurrent use of CYP3A4 inducers or inhibitors | Colorectal cancer with known KRAS mutation (for cetuximab-containing arm) | Major surgery within 6 weeks of enrollment | Receiving other investigational agents or other concurrent anticancer agents or therapies
prior_therapies: >= 4-week washout from therapeutic radiation, cytotoxic chemotherapy, or antibody therapy; >= 5 half-life washout from non-cytotoxic targeted or biologic therapy; Palliative radiation permitted if not to the only target lesion

question_text: 40 year old man with recurrent glioblastoma. Diagnosed 1 year ago, underwent gross total resection with confirmation of GBM, IDH wildtype. question_text: 40 year old man with recurrent glioblastoma. Diagnosed 1 year ago, underwent gross total resection with confirmation of GBM, IDH wildtype. Completed adjuvant radiation + concurrent temozolomide and then adjuvant temozolomide. Three months after completing adjuvant therapy, MRI shows recurrence. ECOG 1 and no other medical issues. What are trial options?
trial_title: A Phase 1 Study of M032 (NSC 733972), a Genetically Engineered HSV-1 Expressing IL-12, in Patients With Recurrent/Progressive Glioblastoma Multiforme, Anaplastic Astrocytoma, or Gliosarcoma
inclusion_criteria: Histologically or cytologically confirmed glioblastoma multiforme, anaplastic astrocytoma, or gliosarcoma | Failed external beam radiotherapy to the brain | If eligible and tolerated, prior temozolomide chemotherapy | All radiation and additional chemotherapies completed >=4 weeks before enrollment | Prior nitrosoureas completed >=6 weeks before enrollment | Age >=18 years | Karnofsky Performance Status >=70% | Life expectancy >4 weeks | Leukocytes >3000/µL | Absolute neutrophil count >1500/µL | Platelets >100000/µL | Total bilirubin within normal limits | AST/ALT <2.5 x ULN | Creatinine within normal limits or creatinine clearance >60 mL/min | Residual lesion >=1.0 cm and <5.5 cm in diameter without bilateral corpus callosum extension, suitable for local catheter-based delivery by MRI | Women of childbearing potential: negative serum pregnancy test within 14 days prior to treatment | Use of adequate contraception; barrier method required for 6 months after M032 | Steroid use allowed if dose not increased within 2 weeks; preferably <=2 mg dexamethasone daily at treatment
exclusion_criteria: Chemotherapy, cytotoxic therapy, or immunotherapy within 4 weeks (6 weeks for nitrosoureas) prior to enrollment | Surgical resection within 4 weeks prior to enrollment | Any prior experimental viral therapy or gene therapy (e.g., adenovirus, retrovirus, herpes virus) | Not recovered from adverse events from prior therapy administered >4 weeks earlier | Receiving other investigational agents | History of allergic reactions to compounds similar to M032 or to interleukin-12 | Tumor location requiring ventricular, brainstem, basal ganglia, or posterior fossa inoculation, or requiring ventricular access for delivery | Bilateral extension through the corpus callosum, actively growing multifocal disease by MRI, or CSF/leptomeningeal dissemination | Prior history of encephalitis, multiple sclerosis, or other CNS infection | Required steroid dose increase within 2 weeks of scheduled M032 administration | Active oral herpes lesion | Concurrent therapy with anti-HSV drugs (e.g., acyclovir, valacyclovir, penciclovir, famciclovir, ganciclovir, foscarnet, cidofovir) | Uncontrolled intercurrent illness (e.g., active infection, symptomatic heart failure, unstable angina, cardiac arrhythmia) or any condition precluding surgery | Psychiatric illness or social situation limiting compliance | Pregnant or breastfeeding | HIV-seropositive | Allergy to IV contrast not amenable to premedication | MRI contraindications (e.g., pacemaker, ferromagnetic aneurysm clips, metal infusion pumps, metal/shrapnel fragments, certain stents) | Receipt of Gliadel therapy | Receipt of bevacizumab within 4 weeks of scheduled M032 administration | Any other reason deemed unfit by investigator
prior_therapies: Must have failed external beam radiotherapy to the brain; If eligible and tolerated, prior temozolomide chemotherapy required; Washout: radiation and additional chemotherapies completed >=4 weeks before enrollment; Washout: prior nitrosoureas completed >=6 weeks before enrollment; Washout: surgical resection completed >=4 weeks before enrollment; Washout: bevacizumab >=4 weeks before M032 administration

Some procedural details (lesion size/location, washout intervals, steroid dose) are not provided but are not hard exclusions.
patient_inclusion_criteria: Age 40 years; Male; Recurrent glioblastoma; IDH wildtype; Status post gross total resection; Completed radiation with concurrent temozolomide and adjuvant temozolomide; ECOG 1; No other medical issues
patient_prior_therapies: Gross total resection; Adjuvant radiation with concurrent temozolomide; Adjuvant temozolomide

Age/sex compatible. Other requirements (lesion size/location, washouts, steroids) are unknown, not soft mismatches. Thus ≥2 core anchors match with no soft conflicts → A.

question_text: I have a 40 year old patient with non-smallcell lung cancer. Diagnosed de novo metastatic disease (bone, liver) with EGFR exon 19 deletion. He has been on Osimertinib for 2 years with complete response. Unfortunately, began having headaches and recent MRI shows numerous lesions. Otherwise no past medical issues and ECOG 0. Are there any trial options?
trial_title: A Multicenter, Phase 1/1b, Open-Label, Dose-Escalation Study of ABBV-399, an Antibody Drug Conjugate, in Subjects With Advanced Solid Tumors
inclusion_criteria: Advanced non-small cell lung cancer not amenable to surgery or other approved therapy with clinical benefit | ECOG performance status 0–2 (Monotherapy Expansion Cohort: ECOG 0–1) | Measurable disease per RECIST v1.1 | Archived FFPE tumor tissue available for analyses | Adequate bone marrow, renal, and hepatic function | Women of childbearing potential have a negative serum pregnancy test at baseline | Eligible to receive erlotinib or nivolumab per local labeling (for Arms A and D) | Arm E: Metastatic/locally advanced nonsquamous NSCLC with EGFR del19 or L858R (with or without T790M) and no EGFR mutations known to be resistant to osimertinib | Arm E: Received 1–2 prior regimens, one containing osimertinib, with progression on osimertinib (only 1 prior regimen may have contained chemotherapy; consecutive EGFR TKIs count as 1) | Arm E: Post-progression tumor tissue available for central c-MET IHC testing | Monotherapy Expansion: Locally advanced or metastatic, nonsquamous, EGFR wild-type, c-MET positive NSCLC (no adenosquamous histology) | Monotherapy Expansion: No more than 2 prior systemic therapies in advanced setting (no more than 1 line of cytotoxic chemotherapy) | Monotherapy Expansion: Progressed on cytotoxic chemotherapy (or ineligible) and on an immune checkpoint inhibitor (or ineligible), and prior targeted therapy for driver alterations if applicable
exclusion_criteria: Radiation therapy to the lung within 6 months before first dose | Anticancer therapy (chemotherapy, immunotherapy, biologic, investigational) within 21 days before first dose | Herbal therapy within 7 days before first dose | Uncontrolled CNS metastases; eligible 2–4 weeks after definitive therapy if asymptomatic and steroid dose stable/not increasing and not on anticonvulsants for progressive CNS metastases | History of interstitial lung disease or pneumonitis requiring systemic steroids | Pulmonary fibrosis on imaging or any history of pneumonitis/ILD within 3 months of first dose | Unresolved clinically significant adverse events >= Grade 2 from prior anticancer therapy (except alopecia or anemia) | Major surgery within 21 days before first dose | History of major immunologic reaction to any IgG-containing agent | Pregnant or lactating female | Known active COVID-19 infection or recent exposure/signs within 14 days prior to screening | Combination arms: Any condition placing participant at unacceptably high risk for toxicities from the combination | Nivolumab: Active autoimmune disease (except vitiligo, type 1 diabetes, hypothyroidism, psoriasis) | Nivolumab: Systemic corticosteroids >10 mg prednisone equivalent or other immunosuppressants within 14 days (except inhaled/locally injected/topical) | Nivolumab: Known immunosuppressive disease (e.g., HIV infection, history of bone marrow transplant, chronic lymphocytic leukemia) | Osimertinib: Hypersensitivity to osimertinib or excipients | Osimertinib: History of osimertinib dose reduction | Osimertinib: Conditions interfering with absorption (refractory nausea/vomiting, chronic GI disease, inability to swallow, prior significant bowel resection) | Osimertinib: QTc >470 ms, significant ECG conduction abnormalities (e.g., LBBB, 2nd/3rd degree block, PR >250 ms), or risk factors for QT prolongation/arrhythmia (e.g., heart failure, hypokalemia, congenital long QT, QT-prolonging meds) | Monotherapy Expansion: Prior c-MET–targeted antibody-based therapies
prior_therapies: Arm E: 1–2 prior regimens with mandatory prior osimertinib and progression on osimertinib; only 1 prior chemotherapy-containing regimen allowed; Monotherapy Expansion: <=2 prior systemic therapies in advanced setting with <=1 cytotoxic chemotherapy line; Monotherapy Expansion: Progression on cytotoxic chemotherapy and on an immune checkpoint inhibitor or ineligible for these therapies; Washout: No anticancer therapy within 21 days before first dose; Washout: No herbal therapy within 7 days before first dose; Washout: No major surgery within 21 days before first dose
reasoning: Metastatic NSCLC with EGFR exon 19 deletion matches the Arm E cohort, and the patient meets general eligibility (age ≥18, ECOG 0). Prior osimertinib exposure aligns with arm requirements; progression status and tissue/testing availability are unknown but not conflicting.
patient_inclusion_criteria: Non-small cell lung cancer; De novo metastatic disease (bone, liver); EGFR exon 19 deletion; ECOG 0; Age 40 years
judge_comment: Disease and metastatic setting match. However, Arm E requires nonsquamous histology and progression on prior osimertinib—both are unknown. Thus only one clear CORE ANCHOR (stage/setting) can be counted; biomarker/subtype anchor is uncertain due to unknown histology, and line/prior is unknown due to progression requirement. No soft mismatches or hard exclusions. Correct grade is B, not A.

question_text: What are trial options for a 66 year old male with hx hypertension, afib, T2DM and mCRPC, now progressing on enzalutamide? He has been on Lupron+Zytiga for 3 years, with new liver and bone metastases which are all PSMA PET avid. He’s tolerated therapy well overall except for grade 2 fatigue.
trial_title: A Drug-Drug Interaction, Safety and Efficacy Study With JNJ-56021927 (ARN-509) and Abiraterone Acetate in Subjects With Metastatic Castration-Resistant Prostate Cancer
inclusion_criteria: ECOG performance status <= 2 | Histologically or cytologically confirmed adenocarcinoma of the prostate | Documented metastatic disease | Evidence of prostate cancer progression | Surgically or medically castrated with testosterone < 50 ng/dL | Adequate bone marrow and organ function
exclusion_criteria: Known brain metastases | Pathology consistent with small cell carcinoma of the prostate | Investigational agent within 4 weeks prior to Cycle 1 Day 1 | Chemotherapy or immunotherapy for prostate cancer within 4 weeks prior to Cycle 1 Day 1 | Concomitant medications that lower the seizure threshold | Use of herbal or non-herbal products that may decrease PSA levels (e.g., saw palmetto, pomegranate products) | Use of strong enzyme inducers (e.g., rifampin, carbamazepine, phenytoin, phenobarbital, St. John's wort) or dexamethasone | Use of potent inhibitors of CYP3A4 or CYP2C8
prior_therapies: Surgical or medical castration required (testosterone < 50 ng/dL); Washout >= 4 weeks since last investigational agent; Washout >= 4 weeks since last chemotherapy or immunotherapy for prostate cancer
reasoning: Disease and stage match (mCRPC), and the patient’s age/sex fit the trial window; prior AR-targeted therapy is not prohibited in the listed criteria and the metastatic pattern (liver/bone, no brain mets reported) is acceptable. No explicit exclusion is triggered based on available data.
patient_inclusion_criteria: Age 66 years; Male sex; Metastatic castration-resistant prostate cancer; Progression on enzalutamide; PSMA PET avid liver and bone metastases
patient_prior_therapies: Progression on enzalutamide; Prior abiraterone (Zytiga) with leuprolide (Lupron) for 3 years
judge_comment: No hard exclusions. Disease and stage (mCRPC) match. Line/prior exposure is compatible (trial does not prohibit prior AR-targeted therapy; only washouts/chemo-immuno noted). No identified soft mismatches; other anchors (biomarker, brain mets) are neutral/unknown. Thus ≥2 anchors (stage and line/prior) → A.

question_text: 36 female with stage III clear cell ovarian carcinoma, who initially received optimal debulking and adjuvant carboplatin+paclitaxel +bevacizumab. diseases_targeted: Glioblastoma; Endometrial Clear Cell Carcinoma; Endometrial Serous Carcinoma; Ovarian Clear Cell Carcinoma; Ovarian Endometrioid Carcinoma; Ovarian Mucinous Carcinoma; Ovarian Serous Carcinoma; Fallopian Tube Carcinoma; Ovarian Carcinoma; Primary Peritoneal Carcinoma; Malignant Uterine Corpus Neoplasm

RANO for GBM) | Prior therapy: Stage 1 and Stage 2 endometrial/ovarian cohorts allow unlimited prior therapy; Stage 2 GBM: no more than 2 prior relapses (intent: no more than 3 prior therapies total) | Recovery from prior therapy toxicities to grade <= 1 or baseline | Washouts before day 1: 12 weeks from completion of radiation for recurrent GBM (unless surgical diagnosis of recurrence or new non-irradiated lesion) | Washouts before day 1: 6 weeks from nitrosourea chemotherapy | Washouts before day 1: 3 weeks from non-nitrosourea chemotherapy | Washouts before day 1: 4 weeks from an investigational (non-FDA-approved) agent or 5 half-lives (whichever is shorter) | Washouts before day 1: 2 weeks from a non-cytotoxic FDA-approved agent or 5 half-lives (whichever is shorter) | ECOG performance status <= 2 (Karnofsky >= 60%) | Absolute neutrophil count >= 1,500/µL | Platelets >= 100,000/µL | Hemoglobin >= 9.0 g/dL | Total bilirubin < 1.5 x ULN (direct bilirubin normal; exception: Gilbert's disease) | AST <= 2.5 x ULN (<= 5 x ULN with liver metastases) | ALT <= 2.5 x ULN (<= 5 x ULN with liver metastases) | Creatinine < 1.5 x ULN or creatinine clearance >= 50 mL/min | Fasting serum glucose <= 130 mg/dL | Fasting triglycerides <= 300 mg/dL | Solid tumor patients off corticosteroids prior to registration; GBM: on stable or decreasing corticosteroid dose >= 5 days before baseline imaging; new/increased steroids require new baseline imaging | Able to swallow whole capsules | Stage 2 GBM: archival tissue (block or 30 unstained slides) available | Stage 2 endometrial/ovarian: at least one lesion amenable to biopsy | Stage 2 solid tumor histologies limited to specified endometrial (papillary serous, endometrioid, clear cell) and ovarian/fallopian/primary peritoneal (high-grade serous, clear cell, endometrioid, mucinous) carcinoma
exclusion_criteria: Concurrent investigational agents | Allergy to compounds similar to sapanisertib or bevacizumab | Stage 2: prior mTOR/PI3K/Akt inhibitors not allowed (allowed in Stage 1 only) | Stage 2 GBM: prior bevacizumab/VEGFR inhibitors not allowed (allowed in Stage 1 and Stage 2 endometrial/ovarian) | Stage 1 solid tumor and Stage 2 endometrial/ovarian: symptomatic or progressing CNS metastases (treated, asymptomatic, stable >= 1 month allowed) | Concurrent enzyme-inducing antiepileptic drugs (must be off >= 10 days); non-enzyme–inducing AEDs allowed | Strong CYP3A4/CYP2C19 inhibitors/inducers require caution; avoid if possible | Concurrent herbal supplements or non-traditional medications (must stop before registration) | Concurrent anticoagulants other than LMWH (must stop before registration); if recently on warfarin, INR <= 2 required | Significant intracranial hemorrhage within 6 weeks or on screening MRI | Uncontrolled intercurrent illness (active infection, symptomatic CHF, unstable angina, significant arrhythmia, psychiatric illness limiting compliance) | Cardiac exclusions within 6 months: LVEF <= 55%, NYHA class >= 3 heart failure, significant ischemic changes, complete LBBB, bifascicular block, congenital long QT, QTcF > 450 ms, inotropic support (excluding digoxin), clinically significant tachyarrhythmias or cardiac arrest, clinically significant bradycardia, unstable atrial fibrillation (>100 bpm), arrhythmia requiring ICD, angina within 12 months, acute MI within 12 months, significant valvular disease, ischemic events requiring therapy or revascularization, pacemaker placement, pulmonary embolism, ischemic cerebrovascular events or revascularization | GI impairment that may alter absorption (e.g., active ulcerative disease, uncontrolled N/V/D, malabsorption, small bowel resection requiring nutritional support) | Use of hematopoietic growth factors <= 2 weeks before start (ESAs allowed if started >= 2 weeks prior) | Pregnant or nursing women | HIV-positive on combination antiretroviral therapy with strong CYP inhibitors are ineligible (eligible if CD4 adequate and ART without strong CYP inhibitors) | Uncontrolled hypertension (SBP >= 160 mmHg or DBP >= 90 mmHg) | Pulmonary hypertension | Uncontrolled asthma or O2 saturation < 90% on room air | Poorly controlled diabetes (HbA1c > 7%) | Proteinuria: if urine dipstick >= 2+, 24-hour urine protein must be < 1000 mg for enrollment | Serious or non-healing wound, ulcer, or bone fracture | History of abdominal fistula, GI perforation, or intra-abdominal abscess within 6 months | Recent invasive procedures: major surgery/open biopsy/significant trauma within 28 days; anticipated major surgery; core biopsy within 7 days | Significant vascular disease within 6 months (e.g., aortic aneurysm requiring repair, recent peripheral arterial thrombosis) | Bleeding diathesis or coagulopathy | Hypersensitivity to Chinese hamster ovary cell products or other recombinant human antibodies
prior_therapies: Stage 1 and Stage 2 endometrial/ovarian: unlimited prior therapy allowed; Stage 2 GBM: no more than 2 prior relapses (no more than 3 prior therapies total including initial); Recovery from prior therapy toxicities to grade <= 1 required before enrollment; Washout: >= 12 weeks since radiation for recurrent GBM (unless surgical diagnosis of recurrence or new non-irradiated lesion); Washout: >= 6 weeks since nitrosourea chemotherapy; Washout: >= 3 weeks since non-nitrosourea chemotherapy; Washout: >= 4 weeks or 5 half-lives (whichever shorter) since investigational non-FDA-approved agent; Washout: >= 2 weeks or 5 half-lives (whichever shorter) since non-cytotoxic FDA-approved agent

question_text: 40 year old man with recurrent glioblastoma. Diagnosed 1 year ago, underwent gross total resection with confirmation of GBM, IDH wildtype. Completed adjuvant radiation + concurrent temozolomide and then adjuvant temozolomide. Three months after completing adjuvant therapy, MRI shows recurrence. ECOG 1 and no other medical issues. What are trial options?

diseases_targeted: Anaplastic Astrocytoma (recurrent); Anaplastic Oligoastrocytoma (recurrent); Anaplastic Oligodendroglioma (recurrent); Glioblastoma (recurrent); Gliosarcoma (recurrent)
inclusion_criteria: Karnofsky performance status >= 70% | Life expectancy >= 3 months | Histologically confirmed grade III or IV glioma or prior grade II glioma now with radiographic high-grade (grade III or IV) | Radiographic evidence of recurrent tumor | Recurrent or progressive high-grade glioma after prior brain radiation and temozolomide | Requires craniotomy for tumor resection or stereotactic brain biopsy | No anticipated connection between post-resection cavity and cerebral ventricles | Medically able to undergo neurosurgery | Any number of prior therapies permitted with washouts: >= 6 weeks from nitrosoureas; >= 4 weeks from non-nitrosourea cytotoxic chemotherapy (23 days from last daily temozolomide in 5/28 regimen); >= 2 weeks from last targeted agent (>= 4 weeks for bevacizumab) | Toxicities from prior therapy improved to grade 0 or 1 | ANC >= 1,500/µL | Platelets > 100,000/µL | Total bilirubin <= 2.0 mg/dL | AST <= 4 x ULN | Serum creatinine <= 1.5 x ULN | Homozygous negative for UGT1A1*28 | Absence of anti-HLA class I antibodies specific for the NSCs | Negative pregnancy test (women of childbearing potential) | Effective contraception during study (women of childbearing potential and sexually active men) | For enrollment at dose level >= 2: presence of supratentorial disease amenable to resection or biopsy for Rickham reservoir/catheter placement
exclusion_criteria: Prior therapy with neural stem cells | Use of CYP3A4 inducers (including enzyme-inducing anticonvulsants) within 2 weeks prior to start of study treatment | Use of moderate to strong CYP3A4 inhibitors within 2 weeks prior to start of study treatment | Use of drugs that inhibit UGT1A1 (e.g., atazanavir, gemfibrozil, indinavir, ketoconazole) within 2 weeks prior to start of study treatment | Use of systemic immunosuppressive agents other than corticosteroids (e.g., cyclosporine, tacrolimus) | Flucytosine within 2 weeks prior to start of study treatment | Use of herbal medications | Concurrent use or planned use of other investigational agents or anti-tumor therapy (biologic, chemotherapy, or radiation) | Known HIV infection or hepatitis C infection | Unable to undergo MRI with contrast | Known chronic or active CNS viral infections | Clinically significant uncontrolled illness | Active infection requiring antibiotics | Diagnosis of Gilbert's disease | History of allergic reactions to compounds similar to irinotecan | Known sensitivity to any study products | Any other active malignancy | Pregnant or breastfeeding | Serious medical or psychiatric illness that may interfere with safety monitoring or treatment completion | Investigator deems participant may be unable to comply with study procedures
prior_therapies: Prior brain radiation and temozolomide required; Any number of prior therapies permitted; Washout: >= 6 weeks from nitrosoureas; Washout: >= 4 weeks from non-nitrosourea cytotoxic chemotherapy (23 days from last daily temozolomide in 5/28 regimen); Washout: >= 2 weeks from last targeted agent (>= 4 weeks for bevacizumab)

Key eligibility details (e.g., need for planned craniotomy/biopsy, UGT1A1*28 homozygous negative, and anti-HLA antibody status) are unknown but not conflicting.

patient_prior_therapies: Gross total resection; Adjuvant radiation with concurrent temozolomide; Adjuvant temozolomide

Biomarker requirements (UGT1A1*28 negative, anti-HLA antibodies) and surgical requirement (planned craniotomy/biopsy) are unknown, not mismatches. exclusion_criteria: Receipt of other investigational agents or additional anti-cancer agents | Endometrial carcinosarcoma | Ovarian cancer histology other than high-grade serous without a deleterious BRCA mutation | Recurrences amenable to potentially curative radiation therapy or surgery | History of other malignancy within 5 years except adequately treated basal/squamous skin cancer or in situ cervical cancer (dual primaries of endometrial, ovarian, or breast cancer allowed) | History of myelodysplastic syndrome | Symptomatic, uncontrolled spinal cord compression and/or brain metastases | Prior chemotherapy, biologic therapy, radiation therapy, androgens, thalidomide, immunotherapy, other anticancer agents, or investigational agents within 28 days before starting study treatment (palliative focal RT excepted as noted) | Prohibited corticosteroids within 14 days prior to starting study treatment | Major surgery within 28 days or minor surgery within 2 weeks prior to study entry, or not recovered from surgery | QTcF >= 470 ms at 2 or more time points within 24 hours or family history of long QT syndrome | Blood transfusion required within 28 days prior to study start | Receipt of hematopoietic growth factors (e.g., G-CSF, GM-CSF) within 2 weeks prior to study start | Concomitant prohibited medications/substances within specified washout periods | Known hypersensitivity to olaparib, capivasertib (AZD5363), vistusertib (AZD2014), or their excipients; question_text: What are trial options for a 66 year old male with hx hypertension, afib, T2DM and mCRPC, now progressing on enzalutamide? exclusion_criteria: Participation in another investigational study or use of an investigational device within 4 weeks before first dose | Immunodeficiency or systemic steroid/immunosuppressive therapy within 7 days before first dose (physiologic corticosteroid doses may be permitted) | Prior monoclonal antibody within 4 weeks before day 1 or unresolved toxicities > grade 1 from prior therapies; denosumab prohibited within 4 weeks before day 1 and on study | Prior chemotherapy for castration-resistant disease | Prior chemotherapy, targeted small molecule therapy, or radiation within 2 weeks before day 1 or unresolved toxicities > grade 1 (<= grade 2 neuropathy allowed) | Major surgery without adequate recovery before starting therapy | Another active malignancy requiring treatment (except certain skin cancers or in situ bladder cancer after curative therapy) | Known brain metastases or carcinomatous meningitis | History of seizure | Allergy to enzalutamide | Active autoimmune disease requiring systemic treatment within the past 3 months or history of clinically severe autoimmune disease requiring systemic therapy (exceptions: vitiligo, resolved childhood asthma/atopy, stable hypothyroidism on replacement, Sjogren's syndrome) | History of non-infectious pneumonitis requiring steroids or current pneumonitis | Active infection requiring systemic therapy | Prior therapy with PD-1, PD-L1, PD-L2, CD137, or CTLA-4 inhibitors | Plans to receive cytotoxic chemotherapy, immune checkpoint inhibitors, sipuleucel-T, radiopharmaceuticals, abiraterone, or other experimental therapy during the study | Known HIV infection | Active hepatitis B or active hepatitis C infection | Receipt of a live vaccine within 30 days before first dose | Rapidly progressive visceral disease making the patient a candidate for docetaxel per treating physician judgment
