He received neoadjuvant gemcitabine/cisplatin x 4 cycles and then cystectomy with pCR. 6 months later he presented with new bone metastases. Biopsy confirmed metastatic urothelial cancer. He was started on EV+pembrolizumab and after 6 cycles, scans showed worsening osseous mets and now new liver lesions. He has a hx of T2DM, COPD, and CKD with eGFR 35. What are trial options?
trial_title: A Phase I Two-Dimensional Dose-Finding Study of Ixazomib in Combination With Gemcitabine and Doxorubicin, Followed by a Phase II Extension to Assess the Efficacy of This Combination in Metastatic, Surgically Unresectable Urothelial Cancer
inclusion_criteria: Histologically confirmed metastatic or locally unresectable urothelial (transitional cell) carcinoma; variant histology allowed with urothelial component | Measurable or evaluable disease | At least one prior therapy unless not candidates for or refuse cisplatin-based therapy | Phase I: any number of prior regimens allowed | Phase II: no prior proteasome inhibitor (e.g., bortezomib, carfilzomib) and no prior gemcitabine >= 800 mg/m^2 plus doxorubicin >= 30 mg/m^2 in the same regimen | Prior neoadjuvant chemotherapy failure eligible | If prior ischemic heart disease or >= 200 mg/m^2 prior doxorubicin, left ventricular ejection fraction >= 45% | ALT <= 3 x ULN | AST <= 3 x ULN | ECOG performance status <= 2; PS 3 allowed if due to malignancy
exclusion_criteria: Platelet count < 100 x 10^9/L | Absolute neutrophil count < 1.0 x 10^9/L | Creatinine clearance < 30 mL/min | Peripheral neuropathy >= grade 3 or grade 2 with pain | Total bilirubin >= 1.5 x ULN | Allergy to study drugs or excipients | Pregnant or breastfeeding | Participation in other investigational trials within 30 days | Myocardial infarction within 6 months, NYHA class III/IV heart failure, uncontrolled angina, severe uncontrolled ventricular arrhythmias, acute ischemia or active conduction abnormalities | Symptomatic congestive heart failure | Claudication limiting activity | Cerebrovascular event within the last year (including TIA) | Unstable angina | Active brain metastases (previously treated and stable allowed) | Radiotherapy within 28 days (14 days if small field) | Another malignancy within 2 years unless meeting specified exceptions | Strong CYP1A2/3A inhibitors or strong CYP3A inducers within 14 days of first ixazomib dose; use of Ginkgo biloba or St. John's wort | Not recovered to <= grade 1 from prior chemotherapy toxicities | Major surgery within 14 days | Infection requiring current IV antibiotics | Active systemic infection, active hepatitis B or C, or HIV positive | Serious medical or psychiatric illness interfering with protocol treatment | GI disease or procedure interfering with oral absorption of ixazomib
prior_therapies: At least one prior systemic therapy required unless cisplatin-ineligible or refuse cisplatin-based therapy; Phase I: any number of prior regimens permitted, including prior bortezomib or gemcitabine+doxorubicin; Phase II: exclude prior proteasome inhibitor therapy and exclude prior combination gemcitabine >= 800 mg/m^2 plus doxorubicin >= 30 mg/m^2; Prior neoadjuvant chemotherapy allowed; Radiotherapy washout: >= 28 days (>= 14 days if small field); Other investigational agents washout: >= 30 days; Major surgery washout: >= 14 days; Recovered to <= grade 1 from prior chemotherapy toxicities before enrollment
reasoning: Disease and stage match (metastatic urothelial carcinoma), and the patient has the required prior therapy history (after second line), which is allowed (Phase I permits any number of prior regimens). Age/sex fit; unknown labs/comorbidities and prior-exposure specifics for Phase II do not create explicit exclusions.
patient_inclusion_criteria: (none)
judge_comment: No hard exclusions. Disease and stage match (metastatic urothelial carcinoma). Line/prior exposure compatible (≥1 prior line required; Phase I allows any number, patient is post-2L). No required biomarker. Metastatic pattern constraints unknown. ≥2 core anchors match with no soft conflicts, so A is appropriate.

question_text: 40 year old man with recurrent glioblastoma. Diagnosed 1 year ago, underwent gross total resection with confirmation of GBM, IDH wildtype. Completed adjuvant radiation + concurrent temozolomide and then adjuvant temozolomide. Three months after completing adjuvant therapy, MRI shows recurrence. ECOG 1 and no other medical issues. What are trial options?
trial_title: Phase I Study of Intracranial Injection of T Cells Expressing HER2-specific Chimeric Antigen Receptors (CAR) in Subjects With HER2-Positive Tumors of the Central Nervous System (iCAR)
inclusion_criteria: Recurrent or refractory HER2-positive primary CNS tumor or HER2-positive tumor metastatic to the CNS (procurement) | Karnofsky/Lansky score >= 60 (procurement) | Recurrent or refractory HER2-positive primary CNS tumor or HER2-positive solid tumor metastatic to the CNS (treatment) | HER2 positivity by IHC or RT-PCR; IHC >= grade 1 and >= 1+ intensity | Intracranial catheter in place | Age >= 3 years | Life expectancy >= 6 weeks | Karnofsky/Lansky score >= 60 | Bilirubin <= 3 x ULN | AST <= 5 x ULN | ALT <= 5 x ULN | Serum creatinine <= 2 x ULN (age-adjusted) | Hemoglobin >= 7.0 g/dL | Oxygen saturation >= 90% on room air | Available autologous transduced T lymphocytes with >= 15% HER2 CAR expression and >= 20% killing of HER2-positive targets | Recovered from tumor resection with stable neurological deficits for >= 1 week prior to treatment | Off other investigational antineoplastic therapy for 2 weeks prior to CAR T-cell infusion | Temozolomide allowed up to 48 hours pre-infusion | Dexamethasone allowed up to 2 mg/day if medically indicated
exclusion_criteria: Diagnosis of diffuse intrinsic pontine glioma (DIPG) (procurement) | Bulky tumors causing midline shift and/or signs of impending herniation (procurement) | Known HIV positivity (procurement) | Severe intercurrent infection (treatment) | Known HIV positivity (treatment) | Pregnant or lactating (treatment) | History of hypersensitivity reactions to murine protein-containing products (treatment) | Diagnosis of diffuse intrinsic pontine glioma (DIPG) (treatment) | Dexamethasone dose > 2 mg/day or equivalent (treatment)
prior_therapies: Off other investigational antineoplastic therapy >= 2 weeks before infusion; Temozolomide permitted up to 48 hours pre-infusion; Dexamethasone <= 2 mg/day permitted if medically indicated
reasoning: Recurrent glioblastoma fits the trial’s recurrent/refractory CNS tumor setting, and prior standard RT/TMZ is allowed; age/sex are within range. HER2 positivity is required but currently unknown, so eligibility depends on confirming HER2 expression and meeting procedural requirements.
patient_inclusion_criteria: Age 40 years; Male; Recurrent glioblastoma; IDH wildtype; Status post gross total resection; Completed radiation with concurrent temozolomide and adjuvant temozolomide; ECOG 1; No other medical issues
patient_prior_therapies: Gross total resection; Adjuvant radiation with concurrent temozolomide; Adjuvant temozolomide
judge_comment: HER2-positivity is a required biomarker for this trial and is unknown for the patient. Per rubric, an A requires required biomarkers satisfied when applicable, so A is not allowed. No hard exclusions apply; stage/setting matches and prior-therapy compatibility likely matches, but with the key required biomarker unknown there is insufficient information to award A. This fits C (relevant/uncertain) rather than A.

question_text: 36 female with stage III clear cell ovarian carcinoma, who initially received optimal debulking and adjuvant carboplatin+paclitaxel +bevacizumab. After 5 months, she had a new pleural effusion that was cytology positive for ovarian carcinoma. She was found to be BRCA1 positive. What are trial options?
trial_title: A Phase III Study Comparing Single-Agent Olaparib or the Combination of Cediranib and Olaparib to Standard Platinum-Based Chemotherapy in Women With Recurrent Platinum-Sensitive Ovarian, Fallopian Tube, or Primary Peritoneal Cancer
diseases_targeted: Fallopian Tube Clear Cell Adenocarcinoma; Fallopian Tube Transitional Cell Carcinoma; Fallopian Tube Undifferentiated Carcinoma; Ovarian Clear Cell Adenocarcinoma; Ovarian Endometrioid Tumor; Ovarian Seromucinous Carcinoma; Ovarian Serous Tumor; Ovarian Transitional Cell Carcinoma; Ovarian Undifferentiated Carcinoma; Recurrent Fallopian Tube Carcinoma; Recurrent Ovarian Carcinoma; Recurrent Ovarian Endometrioid Adenocarcinoma; Recurrent Primary Peritoneal Carcinoma
inclusion_criteria: Platinum-sensitive recurrent high-grade serous or high-grade endometrioid ovarian, primary peritoneal, or fallopian tube cancer; other high-risk histologies (clear cell, mixed epithelial, undifferentiated, or transitional cell) allowed if deleterious germline BRCA1 or BRCA2 mutation is present | Platinum-sensitive disease: > 6 months since last platinum and complete clinical response to prior platinum; no progression through prior platinum therapy | Measurable disease by RECIST 1.1 OR evaluable disease with CA-125 doubled from nadir and > 2 x ULN | Prior chemotherapy must have included a first-line platinum-based regimen; unlimited prior platinum-based regimens in the recurrent setting allowed | Up to 1 prior non-platinum-based line in the recurrent setting allowed; prior hormonal therapy does not count toward this limit | ECOG performance status 0–2 (Karnofsky >= 60%) | Able to swallow and retain oral medications; no gastrointestinal illness precluding absorption | Blood pressure <= 140/90 mmHg on up to three antihypertensive medications; able and willing to record daily BP | Toxicities from prior therapy resolved to <= grade 1 (except alopecia); long-standing stable grade 2 neuropathy may be allowed (will not receive carboplatin/paclitaxel if randomized to that arm) | Adequately controlled thyroid function; TSH within normal limits without symptoms of thyroid dysfunction | Women of childbearing potential: negative pregnancy test and agreement to use two reliable forms of contraception | Age >= 18 years
exclusion_criteria: Chemotherapy or radiotherapy within 4 weeks (6 weeks for nitrosoureas or mitomycin C) prior to starting treatment, or unresolved toxicities from prior therapy > grade 1 | Hormonal therapy within 2 weeks prior to study entry (except raloxifene for bone health) | Concurrent investigational agents or investigational trial participation within 4 weeks | Medications that may markedly affect renal function (e.g., vancomycin, amphotericin, pentamidine) | Prior treatment affecting the VEGF pathway (e.g., thalidomide, sunitinib, pazopanib, sorafenib, nintedanib) in the recurrent setting; upfront bevacizumab allowed | Prior PARP inhibitor | CA-125–only disease without RECIST 1.1 measurable or otherwise evaluable disease | Untreated or symptomatic brain metastases, spinal cord compression, or leptomeningeal disease; treated brain metastases must be radiographically stable >= 6 months and asymptomatic | Strong CYP3A4 inhibitors or inducers; strong UGT/P-gp modulators should be used with caution | History of gastrointestinal perforation; abdominal fistula unless healed and no evidence for >= 6 months and low risk of recurrence | Intra-abdominal abscess within 3 months | Current signs/symptoms of bowel obstruction or within 3 months prior to starting study drugs | Dependency on IV hydration or total parenteral nutrition | Other invasive malignancy unless meeting specified curatively treated exceptions and disease-free >= 3 years | Myocardial infarction within 6 months, unstable angina, clinically significant ECG abnormalities, or NYHA class III/IV heart failure | Left ventricular ejection fraction below institutional normal or < 55% if no institutional threshold | History of stroke or transient ischemic attack within 6 months | Any prior hypertensive crisis or hypertensive encephalopathy | Clinically significant peripheral or other vascular disease (including aortic aneurysm or dissection) | Major surgery, open biopsy, or significant traumatic injury within 28 days prior to starting cediranib | Uncontrolled intercurrent illness (active infection, symptomatic CHF, unstable angina, significant arrhythmia other than controlled AF, or psychiatric/social conditions limiting compliance) | Pregnancy or breastfeeding | Known HIV-positive status | Use of complementary or alternative medicines (natural herbal products or folk remedies) | Features suggestive of myelodysplastic syndrome or acute myelogenous leukemia on smear or marrow (if evaluated) | Prior allogeneic bone marrow transplant or double umbilical cord blood transplantation
prior_therapies: Required prior first-line platinum-based chemotherapy (with or without IV consolidation); Unlimited prior platinum-based regimens in the recurrent setting allowed; Up to 1 prior non-platinum-based line in the recurrent setting allowed; Prior hormonal therapy allowed and does not count toward non-platinum limit; Washout: chemotherapy or radiotherapy >= 4 weeks (>= 6 weeks for nitrosoureas or mitomycin C) before study treatment; Washout: hormonal therapy >= 2 weeks before study entry
reasoning: Recurrent ovarian cancer with clear cell histology and BRCA1 positivity fits the trial (clear cell allowed with BRCA), and she meets age/sex and prior exposure requirements (received first-line platinum; upfront bevacizumab allowed). Platinum-sensitive interval and measurable/evaluable disease are not provided but no conflicts are evident.
patient_inclusion_criteria: Stage III clear cell ovarian carcinoma; Cytology-positive pleural effusion; BRCA1 positive; Female; Age 36 years
patient_prior_therapies: Optimal debulking surgery; Adjuvant carboplatin plus paclitaxel plus bevacizumab
judge_comment: No hard exclusions. Disease matches and recurrent setting matches (1 core anchor). Platinum-sensitive status and deleterious germline BRCA requirement are unknown, so Line/prior and Biomarker anchors cannot be counted as matches. No soft mismatch identified. Therefore B, not A.

question_text: What are trial options for a 66 year old male with hx hypertension, afib, T2DM and mCRPC, now progressing on enzalutamide? He has been on Lupron+Zytiga for 3 years, with new liver and bone metastases which are all PSMA PET avid. He’s tolerated therapy well overall except for grade 2 fatigue.
trial_title: Phase I/II Study of the Anti-Programmed Death Ligand-1 Antibody Durvalumab (MEDI4736) in Combination With Olaparib and/or Cediranib for Advanced Solid Tumors and Advanced or Recurrent Ovarian, Triple Negative Breast, Lung, Prostate and Colorectal Cancers
diseases_targeted: Solid Tumor; Ovarian Cancer; Non-Small Cell Lung Cancer; Small Cell Lung Cancer; Prostate Cancer (metastatic castrate-resistant); Triple Negative Breast Cancer; Colorectal Cancer
inclusion_criteria: Age >= 18 years | Adequately controlled blood pressure on <= 3 antihypertensive medications | Phase I: Advanced or recurrent solid tumor | ECOG performance status 0–2 | Adequate organ and marrow function | Off prior chemotherapy, radiation therapy, or biologic therapy >= 3 weeks | Ovarian/fallopian tube/primary peritoneal cancer: persistent or recurrent disease with >= 2 prior regimens or platinum-resistant/refractory after first platinum | Ovarian/fallopian tube/primary peritoneal cancer: at least one lesion safe to biopsy and willing to undergo mandatory baseline biopsy | Ovarian cancer: prior PARP inhibitor and/or prior anti-angiogenesis therapy allowed (but not both olaparib and cediranib previously) | Triple negative breast cancer: histologically confirmed persistent or recurrent TNBC | Triple negative breast cancer: ER/PR/HER2 status documented | Triple negative breast cancer: documentation of germline BRCA1/2 mutation status required | Triple negative breast cancer: measurable disease per RECIST v1.1 | Triple negative breast cancer: at least one lesion safe to biopsy and willing to undergo mandatory baseline biopsy | NSCLC: histologically or cytologically confirmed advanced disease with >= 1 prior line of platinum-based chemotherapy or appropriate targeted therapy for EGFR/ALK/BRAF alterations | NSCLC: measurable disease per RECIST v1.1 | NSCLC: at least one lesion safe to biopsy and willing to undergo mandatory baseline biopsy | mCRPC: metastatic, progressive, castrate-resistant prostate cancer | mCRPC: at least one lesion safe to biopsy and willing to undergo mandatory baseline biopsy | mCRPC: prior treatment with enzalutamide and/or abiraterone (exceptions for prior docetaxel with ADT in castrate-sensitive disease as specified) | mCRPC: ongoing GnRH agonist/antagonist therapy or prior bilateral orchiectomy | SCLC: advanced or recurrent disease eligible for Durvalumab + olaparib cohort | CRC: advanced or recurrent colorectal cancer eligible for Durvalumab + cediranib cohort
exclusion_criteria: Cardiac events within 1 year: myocardial infarction, pericardial effusion, or myocarditis | Cardiac arrhythmia (e.g., atrial fibrillation or flutter) or need for pro-arrhythmic drugs/biologics within 1 year | NYHA Class II or greater heart failure | Left ventricular ejection fraction < 55% or below institutional normal if assessed | QTc > 470 ms or other significant ECG abnormality within 14 days of treatment | Hypertensive crisis or hypertensive encephalopathy | Clinically significant peripheral or vascular disease, including rapidly growing aortic aneurysm, abdominal aortic aneurysm > 5 cm, or aortic dissection | Unstable angina | Cerebrovascular accident or transient ischemic attack within 1 year | History of tuberculosis | Autoimmune disease requiring steroid maintenance or primary immunodeficiency | HIV-positive on antiretroviral therapy ineligible unless long-standing (> 5 years), undetectable viral load, CD4 > 150/µL, and no anticipated drug-drug interactions per PI | HBV-positive or HCV-positive due to risk of viral reactivation | History of severe allergic reactions to MEDI4736 (durvalumab), olaparib, cediranib, other humanized monoclonal antibodies, or similar compounds; history of anaphylaxis, angioedema, laryngeal edema, serum sickness, or uncontrolled asthma | Pregnant or breastfeeding | Any other concomitant or prior invasive malignancy | NSCLC: prior treatment with cediranib (monotherapy or combination) not eligible | NSCLC: current or prior immunosuppressive medication within 28 days before first durvalumab dose (except allowed low-dose steroids and inhaled/intranasal corticosteroids) | NSCLC: prior history of pneumonitis and/or interstitial lung disease | NSCLC: prior PARP inhibitor not eligible | Triple negative breast cancer: prior PARP inhibitor not eligible | Triple negative breast cancer: CNS metastasis or leptomeningeal disease within 1 year | mCRPC: progression on prior docetaxel for castrate-sensitive disease | mCRPC: prior PARP inhibitor not eligible | mCRPC: radionuclide treatment within 6 weeks prior to first dose | Ovarian cancer: prior treatment with both olaparib and cediranib (combination or sequentially) not eligible
prior_therapies: Phase II Ovarian cancer: >= 2 prior regimens or platinum-resistant/refractory after first platinum; Ovarian cancer: prior PARP inhibitor allowed; Ovarian cancer: prior anti-angiogenesis therapy allowed; NSCLC: at least one prior line of platinum-based chemotherapy or prior EGFR/ALK/BRAF-targeted therapy when indicated by tumor genotype; mCRPC: prior treatment with enzalutamide and/or abiraterone required (with specified exceptions); mCRPC: continue GnRH agonist/antagonist therapy during study; All cohorts: washout from prior chemotherapy, radiation therapy, or biologic therapy >= 3 weeks
reasoning: Disease matches the mCRPC cohort and key anchors align: metastatic/castration-resistant setting and prior enzalutamide/abiraterone exposure meet requirements; age and sex are eligible with no explicit exclusions noted. Other criteria (e.g., ongoing GnRH therapy, biopsy willingness) are unknown but not contradicted.
patient_inclusion_criteria: Age 66 years; Male sex; Metastatic castration-resistant prostate cancer; Progression on enzalutamide; PSMA PET avid liver and bone metastases
patient_prior_therapies: Progression on enzalutamide; Prior abiraterone (Zytiga) with leuprolide (Lupron) for 3 years
judge_comment: No hard exclusions identified. Disease matches mCRPC cohort. Two core anchors match: stage/setting (metastatic, castration-resistant, progressive) and prior exposure (enzalutamide/abiraterone required and present). No soft conflicts evident; other requirements (ongoing GnRH, biopsy willingness) are unknown, which is neutral per rubric. Grade A is appropriate.

question_text: 55 year old male with metastatic urothelial carcinoma, now progressing after second line therapy. Initially diagnosed with MIBC 3 years ago. He received neoadjuvant gemcitabine/cisplatin x 4 cycles and then cystectomy with pCR. 6 months later he presented with new bone metastases. Biopsy confirmed metastatic urothelial cancer. He was started on EV+pembrolizumab and after 6 cycles, scans showed worsening osseous mets and now new liver lesions. He has a hx of T2DM, COPD, and CKD with eGFR 35. What are trial options?
trial_title: A Phase 1 Study of Cabozantinib Plus Nivolumab (CaboNivo) Alone or in Combination With Ipilimumab (CaboNivoIpi) in Patients With Advanced/Metastatic Urothelial Carcinoma and Other Genitourinary Tumors
diseases_targeted: Urothelial Carcinoma (bladder); Urethral Urothelial Carcinoma; Ureter Urothelial Carcinoma; Renal Pelvis Urothelial Carcinoma; Clear Cell Renal Cell Carcinoma; Renal Cell Carcinoma; Sarcomatoid Renal Cell Carcinoma; Sarcomatoid Urothelial Carcinoma; Plasmacytoid Urothelial Carcinoma; Renal Medullary Carcinoma; Penile Squamous Cell Carcinoma; Small Cell Neuroendocrine Carcinoma (bladder)
inclusion_criteria: Age >= 18 years | Histologically confirmed metastatic genitourinary solid tumor (phase I) | Expansion: metastatic urothelial carcinoma (bladder, urethra, ureter, renal pelvis), or clear cell renal cell carcinoma, or adenocarcinoma of the bladder, or non-resectable penile squamous cell carcinoma, or rare GU histologies (squamous or small cell bladder carcinoma, renal medullary carcinoma, sarcomatoid bladder or renal cell carcinoma, plasmacytoid bladder carcinoma, or other rare bladder/kidney histology) | Metastatic disease with at least one evaluable/measurable site or new bone lesion (per cohort definitions) | For urothelial carcinoma or renal cell carcinoma expansion: progressive metastatic disease with at least one measurable site (RECIST) or bone disease by NaF PET/CT | Progressed on >= 1 standard therapy or no standard therapy conferring survival benefit; cisplatin-ineligible urothelial carcinoma may receive protocol therapy first-line | Any number of prior cytotoxic agents permitted | Karnofsky performance status >= 70% | Tissue available for PD-L1 expression (archival or consent to pre/post-treatment biopsies)
exclusion_criteria: Cytotoxic chemotherapy or biologic therapy within 3 weeks (nitrosoureas/mitomycin C within 6 weeks) before first dose | Radiation therapy to thorax/abdomen within 3 months; to bone or brain within 3 weeks; to any other site within 28 days | Radionuclide treatment within 6 weeks | Small molecule kinase inhibitor within 14 days or 5 half-lives (whichever longer) | Hormonal therapy within 14 days or 5 half-lives (GnRH agonists/antagonists allowed) | Investigational agent within 28 days | Unresolved toxicities from prior therapy > grade 1 (except alopecia and asymptomatic lab abnormalities) | Prior MET or VEGFR inhibitors excluded from expansion cohorts (allowed in phase I) | Prior PD-1/PD-L1 or CTLA-4 therapy excluded unless enrolling in designated cohort | Active brain metastases or epidural disease unless previously treated and stable off steroids >= 2 weeks; baseline contrast brain imaging required if history present | PT/INR or PTT >= 1.5 x ULN within 7 days before first dose | Concurrent warfarin prohibited (except <= 1 mg/day); aspirin up to 325 mg/day, factor Xa/thrombin inhibitors, and LMWH permitted | Chronic treatment with strong CYP3A4 inducers not permitted | Clinically significant gastrointestinal bleeding within 6 months; hemoptysis >= 2.5 mL within 3 months; signs of pulmonary hemorrhage within 3 months | Tumor invading major blood vessels | Tumor invasion of GI tract or endotracheal/endobronchial tumor within 28 days before cabozantinib | Cardiovascular disorders: NYHA class III/IV heart failure; uncontrolled hypertension > 140/90 mmHg; QTcF > 500 ms; history of congenital long QT; within 6 months: unstable angina, clinically significant arrhythmias, stroke/TIA, myocardial infarction, or cardiomyopathy | GI disorders at high risk for perforation/fistula: unresolved mucosal invasion, active peptic ulcer disease, diverticulitis, cholecystitis, symptomatic cholangitis, appendicitis, malabsorption; within 6 months: abdominal fistula, GI perforation, bowel or gastric outlet obstruction, intra-abdominal abscess | PEG tube placement within 3 months | Severe active infection requiring systemic therapy within 14 days | Serious non-healing wound/ulcer/bone fracture within 28 days | History of organ transplant | Uncontrolled thyroid dysfunction within 7 days (replacement allowed if indicated) | Recent major surgery within 3 months (or as early as 6 weeks if completely healed and no complications); minor surgery within 1 month (or within 3 months if wound complications); complete wound healing required >= 28 days pre-cabozantinib | Unable to swallow tablets | Severe hypersensitivity to monoclonal antibodies or to cabozantinib, nivolumab, ipilimumab | Another malignancy within 2 years requiring systemic treatment (disease-specific studies) | Pregnancy or breastfeeding | Active hepatitis B (HBsAg positive) or active hepatitis C infection (HCV RNA positive) | Active autoimmune disease or history at risk for recurrence requiring systemic immunosuppression; exceptions include vitiligo, type 1 diabetes, residual hypothyroidism on replacement, psoriasis not requiring systemic therapy, and stable minor autoimmune conditions | Systemic corticosteroids > 10 mg/day prednisone equivalents or other immunosuppressives within 14 days (physiologic or topical/inhaled allowed) | Conditions predisposing to bowel perforation (e.g., active diverticulitis, intra-abdominal abscess, GI obstruction, abdominal carcinomatosis) without appropriate management
prior_therapies: Progressed on >= 1 standard therapy or no available standard therapy; cisplatin-ineligible urothelial carcinoma allowed first-line; Any number of prior cytotoxic agents allowed; Washout: cytotoxic/biologic therapy >= 3 weeks (nitrosoureas/mitomycin C >= 6 weeks); Washout: radiation therapy per site (thorax/abdomen >= 3 months; bone/brain >= 3 weeks; other sites >= 28 days); Washout: radionuclide therapy >= 6 weeks; Washout: small molecule kinase inhibitors >= 14 days or 5 half-lives (whichever longer); Washout: hormonal therapy >= 14 days or 5 half-lives (GnRH agonists/antagonists allowed); Washout: other investigational agents >= 28 days
reasoning: Disease and metastatic setting match the trial’s urothelial carcinoma cohorts, and the patient is post ≥1 line of therapy as required. Age/sex fit, and there are no known exclusions; prior PD-1 exposure is unknown and only restricts certain cohorts.
patient_inclusion_criteria: (none)
judge_comment: No hard exclusions. Disease matches. Stage/setting (metastatic) matches, and line/prior therapy requirement (≥1 prior) is satisfied. Biomarker requirements none; mets pattern constraints unknown without conflict. Prior PD-1 exposure is unknown and not an automatic exclusion due to designated cohorts. Grade A is appropriate per rubric.

question_text: What are trial options for a 66 year old male with hx hypertension, afib, T2DM and mCRPC, now progressing on enzalutamide? He has been on Lupron+Zytiga for 3 years, with new liver and bone metastases which are all PSMA PET avid. He’s tolerated therapy well overall except for grade 2 fatigue.
trial_title: INTense ExeRcise for SurviVAL Among Men with Metastatic Prostate Cancer (INTERVAL - GAP4): a Multicentre, Randomised, Controlled, Phase III Study
inclusion_criteria: Metastatic castration-resistant prostate cancer (mCRPC): adenocarcinoma with systemic metastatic disease despite castrate testosterone (<50 ng/dL). | mCRPC progression by measurable disease: >20% increase in sum of diameters or new lesion(s). | mCRPC progression by bone scan: new lesion(s) attributable to prostate cancer. | mCRPC progression by PSA: PSA >= 2 ng/mL with three rising values at least 1 week apart (PSA1 < PSA2 < PSA3). | mCRPC progression by PSMA PET/CT: new lesion(s) attributable to prostate cancer. | mCRPC treatment status category allowed: treatment-naive for mCRPC (<=4 weeks on approved therapies still considered naive). | mCRPC treatment status category allowed: on abiraterone/enzalutamide/apalutamide with stable or declining PSA after >=4 weeks. | mCRPC treatment status category allowed: PSA progression on abiraterone/enzalutamide/apalutamide if asymptomatic and no intent to start chemotherapy within 6 months. | mCRPC treatment status category allowed: prior first-line docetaxel/cabazitaxel or other approved chemotherapy for mCRPC if asymptomatic without evidence of progression. | mCRPC treatment status category allowed: progressed after first-line docetaxel/cabazitaxel and now on abiraterone/enzalutamide/apalutamide with stable or responding PSA; life expectancy >1 year. | Metastatic hormone-sensitive prostate cancer (mHSPC): high-risk (>=2 of: Gleason score >=8; >=3 bone lesions; measurable visceral lesions) or high-volume (visceral metastases and/or >=4 bone metastases with >=1 outside vertebral column/pelvis). | On androgen deprivation therapy during study or prior bilateral orchiectomy. | >=4 weeks since last major surgery and fully recovered. | Halabi Nomogram score < 1951 (low or intermediate risk). | Age >= 18 years. | ECOG performance status 0-1. | Medical clearance to undergo symptom-limited cardiopulmonary exercise test and vigorous aerobic and resistance training; able to complete an acceptable cardiopulmonary exercise test.
exclusion_criteria: Small cell neuroendocrine prostate cancer or features of small cell disease. | Known contraindications to high-intensity exercise (e.g., brain metastases; current congestive heart failure NYHA class II–IV; serious or non-healing wound, ulcer, or bone fracture; spinal cord compromise or instrumentation due to metastatic disease; peripheral neuropathy >= grade 3). | Serious cardiovascular events within 12 months (e.g., transient ischemic attack, cerebrovascular accident, myocardial infarction). | Uncontrolled hypertension (blood pressure >=160/90). | Engaging in vigorous aerobic exercise >60 minutes/week or structured resistance exercise >=2 days/week.
prior_therapies: On androgen deprivation therapy during study or prior bilateral orchiectomy required.; Treatment-naive for mCRPC allowed (<=4 weeks on approved CRPC therapies considered naive).; On abiraterone or enzalutamide or apalutamide for mCRPC with stable or declining PSA allowed.; PSA progression on abiraterone/enzalutamide/apalutamide allowed if asymptomatic and no intent to start chemotherapy within 6 months.; Prior first-line docetaxel or cabazitaxel or other approved chemotherapy for mCRPC allowed if asymptomatic and without progression.; Progressed after first-line chemotherapy and now on abiraterone/enzalutamide/apalutamide with stable or responding PSA allowed; life expectancy >1 year.; >=4 weeks since last major surgery.
reasoning: Disease/setting matches mCRPC, and prior exposure/progression on enzalutamide is an allowed cohort; age and sex also fit. Final eligibility depends on factors not provided (e.g., being asymptomatic with no near-term chemotherapy intent, ongoing ADT/low testosterone, ECOG 0–1, Halabi risk threshold, and medical clearance for vigorous exercise).
patient_inclusion_criteria: Age 66 years; Male sex; Metastatic castration-resistant prostate cancer; Progression on enzalutamide; PSMA PET avid liver and bone metastases
patient_prior_therapies: Progression on enzalutamide; Prior abiraterone (Zytiga) with leuprolide (Lupron) for 3 years
judge_comment: No hard exclusions. Disease matches mCRPC. Stage/setting matches (metastatic CRPC). Line/prior exposure is compatible (progression on enzalutamide is an allowed cohort), though contingent factors are unknown but not mismatches. No required biomarkers. No soft conflicts identified. Thus ≥2 anchors (stage and line/prior) → A. Grader’s reasoning appropriately notes conditional factors without inferring.

inclusion_criteria: Rare cancer histologically and/or biochemically confirmed (specimen submission required; GTD confirmed by quantitative serum beta-hCG) | PD-L1 amplification cohort: solid tumors (excluding lymphoma) with PD-L1 amplification defined as DNA copy number >= 6 by CLIA-approved assay performed in advanced disease | Cancer of unknown primary: metastatic malignancy with no discernible primary after standard evaluation | Progressed after at least one line of standard systemic therapy or no standard therapy exists that prolongs overall survival | Measurable disease by RECIST v1.1 on CT or MRI within 28 days (cohorts except GTD) | Age >= 18 years | Zubrod performance status 0-2 | Prior malignancy allowed if stage I-II in complete remission, or any cancer disease-free >= 1 year; stage I-II follicular thyroid or prostate cancer eligible without complete remission requirement | Prior anti-CTLA-4 or prior anti-PD-1/PD-L1 allowed (but not both); must be completed >= 4 weeks before registration (except PD-L1 amplified cohort must be PD-1/PD-L1 naive; prior CTLA-4 allowed >= 4 weeks) | Adequate thyroid function (TSH or free T4 within normal range) or on stable replacement | Adequate adrenal axis function (cortisol within normal range or ACTH within normal range) | Brain metastases or primary brain tumors treated and stable; local therapy completed >= 28 days before registration; off steroids >= 7 days | Off other systemic anti-cancer therapy >= 7 days before registration with toxicities recovered to <= grade 1 (except alopecia and <= grade 2 neuropathy) | Hormonal/endocrine blockade permitted if progressed on prior therapy; long-acting somatostatin analogs and androgen deprivation therapy permitted during protocol therapy
exclusion_criteria: Prior grade >= 3 immune-related adverse event with prior immunotherapy | History of or planned solid organ transplant | Active autoimmune disease requiring systemic treatment in the past 2 years (except replacement therapy); autoimmune patients must not have received steroids or immunosuppressives within 28 days prior to registration | Currently receiving investigational agents or systemic anti-cancer therapy (including radiation); planned radiation must be completed before registration | Known hypersensitivity or allergy to nivolumab or ipilimumab | Pregnant or nursing | Active hepatitis B or C infection (allowed if viral load undetectable and no residual hepatic impairment) | HIV-positive patients ineligible if CD4+ < 250 cells/mm^3 or history of non-malignancy AIDS-defining conditions (other than historical low CD4) | Uncontrolled intercurrent illness including symptomatic CHF (NYHA III/IV), unstable angina or coronary angioplasty/stenting within 24 weeks, unstable cardiac arrhythmia (CTCAE v4 grade >= 2), known cardiac metastases, abnormal cardiac valve morphology (>= grade 3), or psychiatric illness limiting compliance | Symptomatic interstitial lung disease or pneumonitis | Not fully recovered from major surgery to <= grade 1 within 14 days before registration
prior_therapies: Progressed after >= 1 prior line of standard systemic therapy or no standard OS-prolonging therapy exists; Prior anti-CTLA-4 or prior anti-PD-1/PD-L1 allowed, but not both; must be completed >= 4 weeks before registration; PD-L1 amplified cohort: no prior anti-PD-1/PD-L1; prior anti-CTLA-4 allowed if completed >= 4 weeks; Off other systemic anti-cancer therapy >= 7 days before registration with toxicities recovered to <= grade 1 (except alopecia and <= grade 2 neuropathy); Brain metastases local therapy completed >= 28 days before registration; off steroids >= 7 days; Major surgery recovered to <= grade 1 at least 14 days before registration; Planned radiation must be completed before registration; Hormonal/endocrine therapy may continue if progressed on prior therapy (e.g., GnRH, somatostatin analogs, androgen deprivation)
reasoning: Disease matches the trial’s ovarian adenocarcinoma cohort, and the patient has recurrent disease after at least one prior standard systemic therapy, aligning with the stage/setting and prior-therapy requirements. Age and sex fit, and no explicit exclusions are triggered by the available data.
patient_inclusion_criteria: Stage III clear cell ovarian carcinoma; Cytology-positive pleural effusion; BRCA1 positive; Female; Age 36 years
patient_prior_therapies: Optimal debulking surgery; Adjuvant carboplatin plus paclitaxel plus bevacizumab
judge_comment: No hard exclusions. Disease reasonably matches the trial’s ovarian adenocarcinoma cohort. Stage/setting (recurrent/advanced) and line/prior therapy (progressed after standard systemic therapy) both match, satisfying ≥2 core anchors. Biomarker not required; other requirements (e.g., measurable disease, rare designation) are unknown and not disqualifying per rubric. Grade A is appropriate.

question_text: 55 year old male with metastatic urothelial carcinoma, now progressing after second line therapy. Initially diagnosed with MIBC 3 years ago. He received neoadjuvant gemcitabine/cisplatin x 4 cycles and then cystectomy with pCR. 6 months later he presented with new bone metastases. Biopsy confirmed metastatic urothelial cancer. He was started on EV+pembrolizumab and after 6 cycles, scans showed worsening osseous mets and now new liver lesions. He has a hx of T2DM, COPD, and CKD with eGFR 35. What are trial options?
trial_title: A Randomized, Phase 2 Trial to Evaluate the Safety and Efficacy of Eribulin Mesylate in Combination With Atezolizumab Compared to Atezolizumab Alone in Subjects With Locally Advanced or Metastatic Transitional Cell Urothelial Cancer Where Cisplatin-Based Treatment is Not an Option
diseases_targeted: Urothelial Carcinoma of Bladder; Urothelial Carcinoma of Renal Pelvis; Urothelial Carcinoma of Ureter; Urothelial Carcinoma of Urethra
inclusion_criteria: Age >= 18 years | Histologically or cytologically confirmed locally advanced/unresectable and/or metastatic transitional cell urothelial carcinoma of the renal pelvis, ureter, urinary bladder, or urethra | Measurable disease per RECIST 1.1 | Post-radiotherapy lesions must show progression to be targetable | Archival or newly obtained invasive tumor tissue available for biomarker analysis; sequential biopsies at baseline and 6 weeks if safe | PD-L1 status determined centrally (SP142) available before randomization | New, progressive or recurrent disease during or within 12 months of platinum therapy, or first-line cisplatin-ineligible due to creatinine clearance < 60 mL/min, grade >= 2 hearing loss, and/or ECOG 2 | Up to two prior lines of chemotherapy for advanced disease allowed | Adequate recovery from prior anti-neoplastic treatment toxicities (generally <= grade 1; exceptions: any grade alopecia, grade 2 neuropathy, any grade hearing loss) | Brain metastases allowed if treated or stable, asymptomatic, and off steroids >= 28 days | Life expectancy >= 12 weeks | ECOG performance status 0-2 (Karnofsky >= 60%) | HIV-positive allowed if on stable HAART without CYP3A4 inducers/inhibitors, no need for opportunistic infection prophylaxis, CD4 > 250 cells/µL, and undetectable HIV viral load
exclusion_criteria: Prior allogeneic bone marrow transplantation or prior solid organ transplantation | Chemotherapy within 3 weeks prior to cycle 1 day 1 | Radiotherapy or targeted therapy within 2 weeks prior to cycle 1 day 1 (6 weeks for nitrosoureas or mitomycin C) | Not recovered from prior therapy adverse events beyond allowable exceptions | Prior treatment with anti-PD-1 or anti-PD-L1 agents or prior eribulin | Prior anti-CTLA-4 unless >= 12 weeks from first dose, > 6 weeks from last dose, and no history of severe immune-related adverse events | Investigational agent within 4 weeks prior to cycle 1 day 1 | Systemic immunostimulatory agents (e.g., IFN-alpha, IL-2) within 6 weeks prior to cycle 1 day 1 | Systemic immunosuppressive medications within 2 weeks prior to cycle 1 day 1 (exceptions for acute low-dose use, inhaled steroids, mineralocorticoids) | Bisphosphonate therapy for symptomatic hypercalcemia | Requirement for RANKL inhibitor (e.g., denosumab) that cannot be discontinued before atezolizumab | Primary CNS malignancy or symptomatic CNS metastases | Hypersensitivity to Chinese hamster ovary cell products, humanized antibodies, fusion proteins, or eribulin | Additional malignancy that is progressing or requires active treatment (exceptions: certain skin cancers or in situ cancers in remission >= 2 years) | Congestive heart failure > NYHA class III | Unstable angina or myocardial infarction within 6 months | Serious cardiac arrhythmia | QTcF > 450 ms or risk factors/medications predisposing to torsade de pointes | Autoimmune disease requiring systemic treatment in past 2 years | Clinically significant illness requiring medical treatment within 8 weeks or clinically significant infection within 4 weeks of dosing | History of organ allograft | Active hepatitis B (HBsAg positive) or active hepatitis C infection (PCR positive) | Clinically significant liver disease (active hepatitis, cirrhosis, fatty liver, inherited liver disease) | History or risk of autoimmune diseases (e.g., SLE, RA, IBD, vasculitis, multiple sclerosis) unless meeting specified exceptions | Idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis, pneumonitis (including drug-induced), organizing pneumonia, or active pneumonitis on screening CT | Active tuberculosis | Severe infections within 4 weeks prior to cycle 1 day 1 | Signs or symptoms of infection within 2 weeks prior to cycle 1 day 1 | Oral or IV antibiotics within 2 weeks prior to cycle 1 day 1 (except prophylactic use) | Major surgery within 28 days prior to cycle 1 day 1 or anticipated during the study | Live attenuated vaccine within 4 weeks before cycle 1 day 1 or planned during treatment and up to 5 months after last atezolizumab dose | Uncontrolled intercurrent illness that would limit compliance | Pregnant or breastfeeding
prior_therapies: Progression during or within 12 months of platinum-based therapy or first-line cisplatin-ineligible status; Up to two prior lines of chemotherapy for advanced disease allowed; No chemotherapy within 3 weeks before cycle 1 day 1; No radiotherapy or targeted therapy within 2 weeks before cycle 1 day 1 (6 weeks for nitrosoureas or mitomycin C); No investigational agents within 4 weeks before cycle 1 day 1; No systemic immunostimulatory agents within 6 weeks before cycle 1 day 1; No systemic immunosuppressive medications within 2 weeks before cycle 1 day 1 (with specified exceptions); Prior anti-CTLA-4 allowed with washout (>= 12 weeks from first dose and > 6 weeks from last dose) and no severe immune-related adverse events
reasoning: Disease and metastatic setting match; age/sex fit, and the trial allows up to two prior lines, consistent with being post–second line. Prior PD-1/PD-L1 exposure and platinum/cisplatin-status requirements are unspecified and could affect eligibility, but no conflicts are stated.
patient_inclusion_criteria: (none)
judge_comment: No hard exclusion is confirmed. Disease and metastatic setting match (1 anchor). Line/prior-exposure cannot be counted as a clear match because prior PD-1/PD-L1 exposure is disallowed and platinum progression/timing is required—both are unknown. With exactly one anchor match and no soft conflicts, the correct grade is B, not A.

question_text: 36 female with stage III clear cell ovarian carcinoma, who initially received optimal debulking and adjuvant carboplatin+paclitaxel +bevacizumab. After 5 months, she had a new pleural effusion that was cytology positive for ovarian carcinoma. She was found to be BRCA1 positive. What are trial options?
trial_title: BrUOG 354: A Phase II Randomized Trial of Nivolumab +/- Ipilimumab for Ovarian and Extra-renal Clear Cell Carcinomas
diseases_targeted: Ovarian Clear Cell Carcinoma; Fallopian Tube Clear Cell Carcinoma; Primary Peritoneal Clear Cell Carcinoma; Clear Cell Carcinoma (extra-renal)
inclusion_criteria: Recurrent, advanced, or metastatic pure clear cell carcinoma of ovarian, fallopian tube, primary peritoneal, or extra-renal origin | Measurable disease by RECIST: >=20 mm by conventional imaging or >=10 mm by spiral CT/MRI/clinical calipers | Progressed after >=1 prior platinum- and taxane-based regimen (ovarian/fallopian tube/primary peritoneal) | Extra-renal clear cell cancer: progressed after >=1 prior systemic regimen for advanced/metastatic disease | Age >=18 years | ECOG performance status 0-1 | Adequate organ and marrow function | Adequate thyroid function (TSH within normal range) | Resting oxygen saturation >=92% at rest
exclusion_criteria: Prior therapy with nivolumab, anti-PD-1, anti-PD-L1, anti-PD-L2, or anti-CTLA-4 | Chemotherapy or radiotherapy within 4 weeks (6 weeks for nitrosoureas or mitomycin C); endocrine therapy within 7 days | Not recovered from clinically significant adverse events to < grade 2 from prior therapies | Concurrent investigational agents | Known brain metastases | History of severe hypersensitivity reaction to any monoclonal antibody | Uncontrolled intercurrent illness (active infection requiring antibiotics, symptomatic CHF, unstable angina, serious arrhythmia, or significant psychiatric illness) | Pregnancy or breastfeeding | Other invasive malignancy within 3 years (exceptions for low-risk conditions as specified) | Prior chemotherapy within the last 3 years for cancers other than clear cell cancer | HIV infection not meeting: stable HAART, CD4 >350/µL, and undetectable viral load | Hepatitis B or C with detectable viral load or not definitively treated >=6 months | Active autoimmune disease or history likely to recur affecting vital organs or requiring immunosuppression | Systemic corticosteroids >10 mg prednisone equivalents daily or other immunosuppressive medications within 14 days prior to day 1 | Planned concomitant, non-protocol anti-cancer therapy | Grade >=2 peripheral neuropathy
prior_therapies: Prior platinum- and taxane-based chemotherapy required (ovarian/fallopian tube/primary peritoneal); At least one prior systemic regimen required (extra-renal clear cell carcinoma); Washout: chemotherapy or radiotherapy >=4 weeks (>=6 weeks for nitrosoureas or mitomycin C); Washout: endocrine therapy >=7 days
reasoning: Disease and setting match (recurrent ovarian clear cell carcinoma), and the patient received prior platinum/taxane therapy as required; age and sex are eligible with no conflicting exclusions noted. Measurable disease status is not provided but its absence here is not a hard exclusion.
patient_inclusion_criteria: Stage III clear cell ovarian carcinoma; Cytology-positive pleural effusion; BRCA1 positive; Female; Age 36 years
patient_prior_therapies: Optimal debulking surgery; Adjuvant carboplatin plus paclitaxel plus bevacizumab
judge_comment: No hard exclusions. Disease matches ovarian clear cell. Stage/setting matches (recurrent allowed). Prior exposure requirement met (prior platinum/taxane and recurrence). No soft mismatches on core anchors. Measurable disease is required but unknown, which per rubric remains neutral. Grade A is appropriate.

question_text: 55 year old male with metastatic urothelial carcinoma, now progressing after second line therapy. Initially diagnosed with MIBC 3 years ago. He was started on EV+pembrolizumab and after 6 cycles, scans showed worsening osseous mets and now new liver lesions. He has a hx of T2DM, COPD, and CKD with eGFR 35. What are trial options?
trial_title: A Phase 1b-2 Study to Evaluate Safety, Efficacy, Pharmacokinetics, and Pharmacodynamics of Various Regimens of Erdafitinib in Subjects With Metastatic or Locally Advanced Urothelial Cancer
inclusion_criteria: Histologic urothelial carcinoma (transitional cell); variant histologies allowed (glandular, squamous, sarcomatoid, micropapillary) | Metastatic or locally advanced disease | Measurable disease by RECIST v1.1 at baseline | Phase 1b erdafitinib + cetrelimab cohort: any number of prior therapy lines for metastatic disease allowed | Phase 1b erdafitinib + cetrelimab + platinum cohort: no prior systemic therapy for metastatic disease | Renal function to receive platinum: creatinine clearance >30 mL/min for carboplatin eligibility and >60 mL/min for cisplatin eligibility (Cockcroft-Gault) | Phase 2: no prior systemic therapy for metastatic disease and cisplatin-ineligible (ECOG 0-1 with at least one: CrCl <60 mL/min, grade >=2 neuropathy, grade >=2 hearing loss; or ECOG 2) | ECOG performance status as follows: Phase 1b erdafitinib + cetrelimab cohort ECOG 0-2; Phase 1b platinum cohort ECOG 0-1 for cisplatin and 0-2 for carboplatin; Phase 2 ECOG 0-2
exclusion_criteria: Investigational agent or therapeutic clinical study participation within 30 days prior to Cycle 1 Day 1 | Phase 1b: prior nitrosoureas or mitomycin C within 6 weeks | Phase 1b erdafitinib + cetrelimab cohort: chemotherapy within 3 weeks of Cycle 1 Day 1 | Phase 1b platinum cohort and Phase 2: prior neoadjuvant/adjuvant chemotherapy allowed only if last dose >12 months before recurrence and no discontinuation due to drug-related toxicity | Prior PD-1, PD-L1, or PD-L2 therapy (exceptions: neoadjuvant/adjuvant >12 months without toxicity leading to discontinuation; PD-1 for non–muscle-invasive bladder cancer allowed) | Active malignancy requiring concurrent therapy other than urothelial cancer | Symptomatic central nervous system metastases
prior_therapies: Phase 1b erdafitinib + cetrelimab cohort: any number of prior systemic therapy lines allowed for metastatic disease; Phase 1b erdafitinib + cetrelimab + platinum cohort: no prior systemic therapy for metastatic disease; Phase 2: no prior systemic therapy for metastatic disease (cisplatin-ineligible); Prior neoadjuvant/adjuvant chemotherapy allowed if last dose >12 months before recurrent disease and no discontinuation due to drug-related toxicity; Washout: investigational agents within 30 days prohibited; Washout: nitrosoureas or mitomycin C within 6 weeks prohibited (Phase 1b); Washout: chemotherapy within 3 weeks prohibited (Phase 1b erdafitinib + cetrelimab cohort)
reasoning: Disease and metastatic setting match, and a Phase 1b cohort allows any number of prior lines—compatible with post–second-line status. No hard exclusions are triggered based on available data (age/sex ok; biomarker not required), though prior PD-1 exposure is unknown.
patient_inclusion_criteria: (none)
judge_comment: A is appropriate: Disease and metastatic setting match, and a Phase 1b cohort allows any number of prior lines, satisfying two core anchors (stage/setting and line/prior). No hard exclusions are triggered from available data; prior PD-1 exposure is unknown and should not be inferred. Presence of other cohorts with stricter prior-therapy rules does not negate eligibility given at least one matching cohort.

question_text: 55 year old male with metastatic urothelial carcinoma, now progressing after second line therapy. Initially diagnosed with MIBC 3 years ago. He received neoadjuvant gemcitabine/cisplatin x 4 cycles and then cystectomy with pCR. 6 months later he presented with new bone metastases. Biopsy confirmed metastatic urothelial cancer. He was started on EV+pembrolizumab and after 6 cycles, scans showed worsening osseous mets and now new liver lesions. He has a hx of T2DM, COPD, and CKD with eGFR 35. What are trial options?
trial_title: Phase II Study of Radiation Therapy and Anti-PD-L1 Checkpoint Inhibitor (Durvalumab) With or Without Anti-CTLA-4 Inhibition (Tremelimumab) in Patients With Unresectable, Locally Advanced, or Metastatic Urothelial Bladder Cancer That Are Ineligible or Refusing Chemotherapy
inclusion_criteria: cT2–T4 or metastatic (N+ or M+) urothelial bladder cancer; mixed histology allowed if predominantly urothelial. | Localized disease: patient refuses cystectomy or is not an ideal cystectomy candidate. | If metastatic: intact, symptomatic bladder tumor appropriate for palliative bladder RT. | Measurable metastatic disease per RECIST v1.1 (>=1 non-irradiated lesion; longest diameter >=10 mm or lymph node short axis >=15 mm). | ECOG performance status 0–1. | Life expectancy >= 12 weeks. | Ineligible for or refusal of cisplatin-based chemotherapy (CrCl < 60 mL/min, CTCAE grade >=2 hearing loss, CTCAE grade >=2 peripheral neuropathy, NYHA class III heart failure, or other investigator-determined reason). | Provision of archived tumor tissue within 12 months or willingness to undergo pre-treatment fresh tumor biopsy; additional older archival tissue requested if available. | Hemoglobin >= 9.0 g/dL. | ANC >= 1500/µL. | Platelets >= 100000/µL. | Total bilirubin <= 1.5 x ULN (Gilbert syndrome allowed per physician). | AST/ALT <= 2.5 x ULN (<= 5 x ULN if liver metastases). | Creatinine clearance > 30 mL/min (Cockcroft-Gault or 24-hour collection). | Women of childbearing potential: negative pregnancy test; or non-reproductive potential as defined.
exclusion_criteria: ECOG performance status >=2. | Prior cystectomy or definitive radiotherapy to the bladder. | Active or prior autoimmune or inflammatory disorders (e.g., myasthenia gravis, autoimmune hepatitis, SLE, rheumatoid arthritis, IBD, sarcoidosis, vasculitis, multiple sclerosis) with specified exceptions. | HIV infection, active hepatitis B or active hepatitis C (exceptions for resolved/past HBV and HCV RNA-negative). | History of idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis, organizing pneumonia, drug-induced or idiopathic pneumonitis, or active pneumonitis on screening imaging. | Prior radiation therapy to the abdomen or pelvis, including bladder, prostate, or rectum. | Concurrent systemic chemotherapy, biologic, or hormonal therapy for cancer treatment (non-cancer hormonal therapy allowed). | Major surgery within 28 days before first dose (biopsy and TURBT allowed). | Another primary malignancy not meeting allowed exceptions. | QTcF >= 470 ms or clinically significant ECG abnormalities. | Current or prior immunosuppressive medication within 14 days before first dose (with specified corticosteroid exceptions). | History of primary immunodeficiency. | History of allogeneic organ transplant. | Hypersensitivity to durvalumab, tremelimumab, or their combination/excipients. | Uncontrolled intercurrent illness (e.g., infection, CHF, uncontrolled hypertension, unstable angina, arrhythmia, active PUD/gastritis, bleeding diathesis, psychiatric/social conditions limiting compliance). | Active infection including tuberculosis. | History of leptomeningeal carcinomatosis. | Receipt of live attenuated vaccine within 30 days before study entry or within 30 days of receiving study drugs. | Brain metastases or spinal cord compression unless stable, asymptomatic, and off steroids for >=14 days prior to treatment. | Uncontrolled seizures. | Pregnant or breastfeeding; unwilling to use effective contraception for the required period.
prior_therapies: Prior systemic therapies allowed with washout >= 45 days
reasoning: Disease and metastatic setting match, and prior systemic therapy after second line is allowed; age and sex fit. Specific requirements (cisplatin ineligibility/refusal, intact symptomatic bladder for RT, ECOG/labs) are unknown but present no explicit conflicts.
patient_inclusion_criteria: (none)
judge_comment: No hard exclusions. Disease matches and prior-therapy/line compatibility matches. However, stage/setting is uncertain because the trial requires metastatic patients to have an intact, symptomatic bladder tumor appropriate for palliative RT (and cisplatin ineligibility/refusal), which are unknown. Thus only 1 CORE ANCHOR clearly matches (Line/prior), yielding grade B, not A.

question_text: What are trial options for a 68-year-old male with a two-year history of progressive cognitive decline? His MMSE score is 19, consistent with moderate-stage dementia. An amyloid PET scan was performed and was negative. CSF analysis was also negative for amyloid plaques but showed elevated p-tau. His family is seeking disease-modifying therapies.
trial_title: Alzheimer's Autism and Cognitive Impairment Stem Cell Treatment Study
diseases_targeted: Alzheimer Disease; Autism Spectrum Disorder; CADASIL; Chronic Traumatic Encephalopathy; Mixed Dementia; Huntington's Dementia; LATE (limbic-predominant age-related TDP-43 encephalopathy); Lewy Body Dementia; Parkinson-Dementia Syndrome; Traumatic Brain Injury; Vascular Dementia; Wernicke-Korsakoff Syndrome
inclusion_criteria: Documented cognitive impairment or a diagnosis associated with cognitive impairment (e.g., Alzheimer's disease, autism spectrum disorder) | If on current medical therapy for the condition, be stable and unlikely to have reversal of impairment from ongoing treatment | Investigator judges potential for improvement with BMSC and minimal procedural risk | Age >= 18 years | Medically stable and cleared by a primary care practitioner for the procedure
exclusion_criteria: Not medically stable or at significant health risk to undergo the procedure | Pregnant or planning pregnancy within 3 months post treatment | Investigator deems BMSC collection/treatment poses significant risk to general health or neurologic function
prior_therapies: (none)
reasoning: Disease matches, as the trial enrolls adults with documented cognitive impairment/dementia, and the patient is a 68-year-old male with moderate dementia (MMSE 19). There are no biomarker or prior-therapy requirements, age/gender fit, and no exclusion criteria are triggered based on available data.
patient_biomarkers: Amyloid PET negative; CSF amyloid negative; Elevated CSF p-tau
patient_inclusion_criteria: Age 68 years; Male; Two-year history of progressive cognitive decline; MMSE score 19; Moderate-stage dementia; Amyloid PET negative; CSF amyloid negative; Elevated CSF p-tau
judge_comment: No hard exclusions. Disease broadly matches, but none of the CORE ANCHORS can be counted as matches: stage/setting not specified, line/prior not specified, no required biomarkers, and no metastatic pattern constraints. With 0 anchors matched and no soft conflicts, rubric dictates C, not A.

trial_title: A Phase II Study of Ipilimumab, Cabozantinib, and Nivolumab in Rare Genitourinary Cancers (ICONIC)
diseases_targeted: Bladder Adenocarcinoma; Bladder Clear Cell Adenocarcinoma; Bladder Squamous Cell Carcinoma; Bladder Neuroendocrine Carcinoma; Bladder Small Cell Neuroendocrine Carcinoma; Urothelial Carcinoma; Micropapillary Urothelial Carcinoma; Plasmacytoid Urothelial Carcinoma; Giant Cell Urothelial Carcinoma; Lipid-Rich Urothelial Carcinoma; Nested Variant Urothelial Carcinoma; Lymphoepithelioma-Like Carcinoma; Large Cell Neuroendocrine Carcinoma; Chromophobe Renal Cell Carcinoma; Papillary Renal Cell Carcinoma; Sarcomatoid Renal Cell Carcinoma; Collecting Duct Carcinoma; Renal Medullary Carcinoma; Urachal Adenocarcinoma; Urethral Carcinoma; Urethral Clear Cell Adenocarcinoma; Penile Carcinoma; Prostate Small Cell Neuroendocrine Carcinoma; Malignant Testicular Leydig Cell Tumor; Malignant Testicular Sertoli Cell Tumor

malignant angiomyolipoma allowed | Other variant urothelial carcinomas (e.g., micropapillary >= ~50%, giant cell, lipid-rich, clear cell, nested), large cell neuroendocrine carcinoma, lymphoepithelioma-like carcinoma, mixed patterns; treatment-naive primary prostate small cell allowed; malignant testicular Sertoli or Leydig cell tumors; papillary and chromophobe RCC | Sarcomatoid urothelial carcinoma (predominantly ~50%) | Renal medullary carcinoma | Bone-only metastatic genitourinary tumors (non-prostate) | Renal collecting duct carcinoma (WHO definition) | Urethral carcinoma (any histology; bone-only cohort must receive cisplatin-based chemotherapy if eligible | Age >= 18 years | Able to swallow oral tablets | Karnofsky performance status >= 80% | ANC >= 1,000/µL | Platelets >= 75,000/µL | Total bilirubin <= 1.5 x ULN (<= 3.0 mg/dL allowed with Gilbert syndrome) | AST/ALT <= 3 x ULN (<= 5 x ULN with liver metastases or Gilbert syndrome) | Creatinine <= 1.5 x ULN or creatinine clearance >= 40 mL/min/1.73 m2 | Hemoglobin >= 9 g/dL (PRBC transfusion allowed) | Serum albumin >= 3.2 g/dL | Lipase and amylase <= 2 x ULN and no clinical/radiologic pancreatitis | HIV-positive allowed if on stable HAART, CD4 > 350/µL, and viral load undetectable | Select stable autoimmune/rheumatologic conditions on topical therapy allowed; exclusion_criteria: Prior cabozantinib | Both prior MET/VEGF inhibitor exposure and prior PD-1/PD-L1/CTLA-4 therapy (sequentially or in combination) | Prior PD-1/PD-L1 or CTLA-4 therapy (except allowed for urothelial carcinoma cohorts D, H, J, L) | Active or acute diverticulitis, intra-abdominal abscess, or GI obstruction within 12 months | Pregnancy or breastfeeding | Cytotoxic chemotherapy or biologic agents within 2 weeks before first dose | Radiation therapy to lungs/mediastinum/abdomen within 4 weeks before first dose or with ongoing complications | Radiation to brain metastasis within 3 weeks (WBRT) or 2 weeks (SBRT) before first dose | Radiation to any other site within 2 weeks before first dose | Radionuclide treatment within 6 weeks before first dose | Small molecule kinase inhibitor within 14 days or 5 half-lives (whichever longer) before first dose | Hormonal therapy within 14 days or 5 half-lives (whichever longer) before first dose (GnRH agonists/antagonists allowed) | Other investigational agent within 14 days before first dose | Not recovered to baseline or CTCAE > grade 1 from prior therapy toxicities (except allowed conditions) | Active brain metastases or epidural disease requiring steroids within 2 weeks | Concomitant warfarin (except <= 1 mg/day); aspirin up to 325 mg/day, thrombin or factor Xa inhibitors, and LMWH permitted | Chronic concomitant strong CYP3A4 inducers or strong inhibitors | Clinically significant GI bleeding within 6 months | Hemoptysis >= 2.5 mL/day within 1 month | Signs of pulmonary hemorrhage within 3 months | Tumor invading major blood vessels | Tumor invading GI tract or endotracheal/endobronchial tumor within 28 days; question_text: What are trial options for a 66 year old male with hx hypertension, afib, T2DM and mCRPC, now progressing on enzalutamide? He has been on Lupron+Zytiga for 3 years, with new liver and bone metastases which are all PSMA PET avid. He’s tolerated therapy well overall except for grade 2 fatigue.
trial_title: Randomized Phase II Study of Platinum-Taxane-Cetrelimab Induction Followed by Niraparib Plus or Minus Cetrelimab Maintenance in Men With Aggressive Variant Prostate Cancers
diseases_targeted: Aggressive Variant Prostate Carcinoma; Castration-Resistant Prostate Carcinoma; Metastatic Prostate Carcinoma; Metastatic Prostate Neuroendocrine Carcinoma; Metastatic Prostate Small Cell Carcinoma; Stage IV Prostate Cancer
inclusion_criteria: Histologically or cytologically confirmed prostate carcinoma | Metastatic disease documented on imaging (bone scan, CT and/or MRI) | Meets at least one aggressive variant prostate carcinoma (AVPC) criterion | Histologically proven small cell (neuroendocrine) prostate carcinoma (AVPC criterion) | Exclusive visceral metastases (AVPC criterion) | Predominantly lytic bone metastases by x-ray or CT (AVPC criterion) | Bulky (>= 5 cm) lymphadenopathy or high-grade tumor mass in prostate/pelvis (AVPC criterion) | Low PSA (<= 10 ng/mL) at initial presentation or at symptomatic progression in the castrate-setting plus high-volume (>= 20) bone metastases (AVPC criterion) | Elevated LDH (>= 2 x ULN) or elevated CEA (>= 2 x ULN) without other etiologies (AVPC criterion) | Short interval (<= 180 days) to castration-resistant progression after initiation of hormonal therapy (AVPC criterion) | Loss or mutation in at least 2 of TP53, RB1, and PTEN by CLIA-certified testing, IHC and/or DNA sequencing (AVPC criterion) | Castration-resistant progression per RECIST without PSA rising to >= 1.0 ng/mL per PCWG3 (AVPC criterion) | Documented progressive disease by PSA progression (3 measurements >= 7 days apart with last >= 1.0 ng/mL), or new/increasing measurable disease (RECIST), or >= 2 new bone lesions (PCWG3), or increasing symptoms attributed to progression | Surgically or medically castrated with baseline testosterone <= 50 ng/dL | ECOG performance status <= 2 | Hemoglobin >= 10.0 g/dL (>= 8 g/dL if due to marrow infiltration) | Absolute neutrophil count (ANC) >= 1.5 x 10^9/L (>= 1.0 x 10^9/L if due to marrow infiltration) | White blood cells (WBC) > 3 x 10^9/L (> 2 x 10^9/L if due to marrow infiltration) | Platelet count >= 100 x 10^9/L (>= 50 x 10^9/L if due to marrow infiltration) | Total bilirubin <= 1.5 x ULN (except Gilbert syndrome) | AST and ALT <= 2.5 x ULN (<= 5 x ULN with liver metastases) | Calculated creatinine clearance (Cockcroft-Gault) >= 30 mL/min | No features suggestive of MDS/AML on peripheral blood smear | Able to swallow study drugs whole (tablet/capsule)
exclusion_criteria: Any prior treatment for CRPC with carboplatin, cisplatin, cabazitaxel, a PARP inhibitor, or an anti-PD-1/PD-L1 inhibitor | More than one prior line of chemotherapy | Unresolved toxicity from prior therapy > CTCAE grade 2 (except allowed ongoing LHRH therapy, bisphosphonates, or RANK ligand inhibitors) | Any unresolved CTCAE grade >= 2 toxicity from previous anti-cancer therapy (irreversible toxicities not expected to be exacerbated may be allowed) | History or current diagnosis of myelodysplastic syndrome or acute myeloid leukemia | Active uncontrolled infection | Active or symptomatic viral hepatitis or chronic liver disease | History of pneumonitis or extensive bilateral non-malignant lung disease | Another malignancy with >= 30% probability of recurrence within 24 months (except adequately treated non-melanoma skin cancer, curatively treated in-situ cervical cancer, or Ta urothelial carcinoma) | Serious underlying medical or psychiatric condition that would make study drug hazardous or confound adverse event interpretation (e.g., uncontrolled ventricular arrhythmia, recent myocardial infarction, superior vena cava syndrome, uncontrolled seizures, history of allogeneic transplant, primary immunodeficiency) | Unable to swallow oral medication or gastrointestinal disorders likely to interfere with absorption | Symptomatic uncontrolled brain metastases or spinal cord compression | Known hypersensitivity to niraparib, carboplatin, cabazitaxel, or anti-PD-1/PD-L1 inhibitors | Current or prior use of systemic immunosuppressive medication within 28 days before first cetrelimab dose (with specified corticosteroid exceptions) | Active or prior documented autoimmune or inflammatory disorders requiring systemic therapy (with specified exceptions such as vitiligo, alopecia, controlled hypothyroidism, certain inactive diseases, or celiac disease controlled by diet) | Receipt of live attenuated vaccine within 30 days prior to cetrelimab | Compulsory detention for treatment of psychiatric or physical illness
prior_therapies: (none)
reasoning: Stage/setting matches mCRPC and prior therapies (enzalutamide/abiraterone) do not violate exclusions; age and sex fit. Eligibility depends on meeting at least one aggressive-variant criterion, which is not documented here and needs confirmation but is not an explicit conflict.
patient_inclusion_criteria: Age 66 years; Male sex; Metastatic castration-resistant prostate cancer; Progression on enzalutamide; PSMA PET avid liver and bone metastases
patient_prior_therapies: Progression on enzalutamide; Prior abiraterone (Zytiga) with leuprolide (Lupron) for 3 years

question_text: I'm looking for trial options for an 8-year-old female with PMM2-CDG (Congenital Disorder of Glycosylation). She has confirmed biallelic pathogenic variants in PMM2 and exhibits moderate cerebellar dysfunction with a recent ICARS score of 35. Her family is highly motivated for research participation.
trial_title: A Prospective, Randomized, Double-Blind, Placebo-Controlled, Single-Center Study of Oral Epalrestat Therapy in Pediatric Subjects With Phosphomannomutase 2-congenital Disorder of Glycosylation (PMM2-CDG)
inclusion_criteria: Age >= 2 and < 18 years | Molecularly confirmed biallelic PMM2 pathogenic variants | Negative urine pregnancy test (females of child-bearing potential) | Agrees to effective contraception or abstinence from prior to randomization through 3 months after treatment (subjects of child-bearing potential)
exclusion_criteria: Other known congenital disorders of glycosylation | Allergy to aldose reductase inhibitors | Hypersensitivity to epalrestat | AST > 5 x ULN within 6 months prior to screening | ALT > 5 x ULN within 6 months prior to screening | Total bilirubin > 2 x ULN within 6 months prior to screening | Albumin < 2.8 mmol/L at screening | Liver fibrosis by elastography (Fibroscan > 7 kPa) at screening | Serum creatinine > 0.5 mg/dL (<= 6 years) | Serum creatinine > 0.7 mg/dL (7-10 years) | Serum creatinine > 1.24 mg/dL (>= 11 years) | Platelet count < 125 x10^9/L | Hemoglobin < 10 g/dL | Any other clinically significant laboratory abnormality per investigator | Use of an investigational drug (including acetazolamide) within 28 days | Use of an investigational biologic within 12 months | Concurrent or planned participation in another interventional protocol or use of other unapproved therapeutics | Any other medical condition that interferes with protocol compliance, compromises safety, or interferes with interpretation of results
prior_therapies: Washout from investigational drugs >= 28 days; Washout from investigational biologics >= 12 months
reasoning: Disease and required biomarker (biallelic PMM2 variants) match, and the patient’s age (8) is within the 2–<18 range. No prior investigational therapy or known exclusion criteria are present, so line/prior exposure is compatible.
patient_inclusion_criteria: Diagnosis of PMM2-CDG; Confirmed biallelic pathogenic variants in PMM2; ICARS score 35 (moderate cerebellar dysfunction); Age 8 years
judge_comment: No hard exclusions. Disease and required biomarker match; age within window; prior exposure/washout compatible. At least two core anchors match (biomarker and line/prior), with no soft conflicts, so A is appropriate.

exclusion_criteria: Prior systemic anti-cancer therapy within 4 weeks before start of treatment | Prior radiotherapy within 2 weeks before start of treatment | History of radiation pneumonitis | Radiation therapy to the lung > 30 Gy within 6 months before start of treatment | Participation in an investigational agent/device study within 4 weeks before start of treatment | Active central nervous system metastases or carcinomatous meningitis | Active malignancy other than the disease under treatment within the previous 3 years (except curable cancers) | Requirement for systemic corticosteroids > 10 mg prednisone equivalent daily or other immunosuppressive therapy within 7 days prior to treatment | Clinically significant active, known or suspected autoimmune disease or conditions exacerbated by immunotherapy | Severe pulmonary, cardiac, or other systemic disease | Known hepatitis B or hepatitis C virus infection | Pregnant or lactating or planning to become pregnant during the study | History of allogeneic tissue/solid organ transplant | Active infection requiring systemic therapy | Severe hypersensitivity to components of study drugs

question_text: 40 year old man with recurrent glioblastoma. Diagnosed 1 year ago, underwent gross total resection with confirmation of GBM, IDH wildtype. What are trial options?

inclusion_criteria: Histologically confirmed glioblastoma, IDH wild-type (IHC R132H negative or sequencing); astrocytoma with molecular features of GBM eligible | Newly diagnosed glioblastoma with prior surgical resection or biopsy; cohort-specific requirements per Group 1-3 | Group 2: Documented MGMT-unmethylated glioblastoma | Group S: Newly suspected or recurrent glioblastoma and scheduled for standard-of-care surgical resection or biopsy | Stable or decreasing corticosteroids at <= 8 mg dexamethasone daily for >= 7 days prior to registration | Age >= 18 years | Karnofsky performance status >= 70% | WBC >= 3,000/µL (within 14 days) | ANC >= 1,500/µL (within 14 days) | Hemoglobin >= 8 g/dL (within 14 days) | Platelets >= 100,000/µL (within 14 days) | Total bilirubin <= 2 x ULN (within 14 days) | AST/ALT <= 3 x ULN (within 14 days) | Creatinine <= 1.5 x ULN (within 14 days) | INR <= 1.5 x ULN (within 14 days) | PT/PTT <= 1.5 x ULN (within 14 days) | Females of childbearing potential: negative pregnancy test within 14 days prior to registration
exclusion_criteria: Receiving other investigational agents (COVID-19 vaccine or treatment allowed) | Prior or concurrent malignancy that may interfere with study treatment or safety (per investigator discretion) | History of allergic reactions to temozolomide or mycophenolate mofetil or similar compounds | Spinal cord and diffuse leptomeningeal disease glioblastoma | Live vaccination within 2 weeks before initiation of MMF and/or TMZ | Current viral-vector based therapy | Uncontrolled epilepsy | Uncontrolled intercurrent illness | Concurrent malignancy outside of glioblastoma requiring tumor-directed treatment | Known hypoxanthine-guanine phosphoribosyltransferase (HGPRT) deficiency (e.g., Lesch-Nyhan or Kelley-Seegmiller syndromes) | Known concurrent shingles, herpes, or cytomegalovirus (CMV) infection | Known concurrent opportunistic fungal infection | Known concurrent or history of unexplained opportunistic infection | Known immunodeficiency that could predispose to opportunistic infections | Psychiatric illness or social conditions limiting compliance or compromising safety | Pregnant or nursing | Unable to swallow oral medication or conditions affecting absorption of oral medication | Known history of HIV, HBV, or HCV infection
prior_therapies: Prior surgical resection or biopsy required for Groups 1-3; Group 1: Prior chemoradiation completed; Group 2: Surgical resection or biopsy only (no prior chemoradiation); Group 3: Surgical resection or biopsy only; Group S: Planned standard-of-care surgical resection or biopsy

question_text: A 32-year-old male has moderate-to-severe fistulizing Crohn's disease, refractory to both infliximab and ustekinumab, with a CDAI score of 350. He recently completed IV antibiotic treatment for a perianal abscess and still has an active, draining seton in place. What are his clinical trial options?

inclusion_criteria: Diagnosis of Crohn's disease for >= 3 months | At least one active draining perianal fistula confirmed by screening MRI | Previously had inadequate initial response, loss of response, or intolerance to therapy from up to 2 classes of advanced drug therapies approved for Crohn's disease (e.g., infliximab, adalimumab, certolizumab pegol, vedolizumab or approved biosimilars) or a JAK inhibitor licensed for Crohn's disease (e.g., upadacitinib)
exclusion_criteria: Very severe luminal Crohn's disease activity | History of rectovaginal fistulas, rectal and/or anal stenosis, stoma or functioning ostomy, undrained abscess/collections, colonic mucosal dysplasia or pre-cancerous lesions not removed, demyelinating disease, or systemic lupus erythematosus | Complications of Crohn's disease anticipated to require surgery or preclude fistula evaluation (e.g., symptomatic strictures/stenoses, short gut syndrome) | Any medical contraindications preventing study participation | History of ongoing, chronic, or recurrent enteral or systemic infectious disease
prior_therapies: Prior exposure to up to 2 classes of advanced therapies for Crohn's disease (anti-TNF agents, vedolizumab, or JAK inhibitor such as upadacitinib); Documented inadequate response, loss of response, or intolerance to the above therapies
reasoning: The trial targets fistulizing perianal Crohn's disease, which matches the patient's active perianal fistula, and the patient has prior inadequate response to an anti-TNF (infliximab) as required. Age/sex are eligible and no explicit exclusion is evident.
patient_inclusion_criteria: Moderate-to-severe Crohn's disease; Fistulizing disease; CDAI score 350; Active perianal fistula with draining seton in place
patient_prior_therapies: Refractory to infliximab; Refractory to ustekinumab

MRI confirmation is unknown but not a hard exclusion. ≥2 anchors (line/prior and required phenotype) → A. Grader’s reasoning aligns with rubric.

question_text: I have a 40 year old patient with non-smallcell lung cancer. Diagnosed de novo metastatic disease (bone, liver) with EGFR exon 19 deletion. exclusion_criteria: NSCLC with mixed squamous histology or histologic transformation (e.g., transition to small cell lung cancer or epithelial–mesenchymal transition) | For Part A/B and Part C Cohort 4: uncontrolled CNS metastases, leptomeningeal disease, or need for steroid escalation within 28 days (unless stable after local CNS therapy per protocol timeframe) | EGFR-TKI treatment within 7 days before first dose | Systemic anticancer therapy within 14 days or 5 half-lives (whichever is shorter) before first dose | Limited field radiotherapy within 7 days or extended field chest radiotherapy within 14 days before first dose | Immunotherapy or other antibody therapy within 28 days before first dose | Not recovered from major surgery or its side effects within 28 days before first dose (excluding vascular access placement) | QTcF > 470 ms | Clinically significant and uncontrolled cardiac arrhythmia (e.g., type II second-degree or third-degree heart block) | Risk factors for QT prolongation or torsades de pointes (e.g., hypokalemia, congenital long QT, pertinent family history, or concomitant QT-prolonging drugs) | Uncontrolled hypertension: systolic blood pressure > 180 mmHg or diastolic blood pressure > 100 mmHg | Congestive heart failure NYHA class III–IV or hospitalization for heart failure within 6 months | Acute myocardial infarction or unstable angina within 6 months | Active second malignancy within 2 years (except adequately treated basal/squamous skin cancer or carcinoma in situ) | History/evidence of interstitial lung disease or steroid-requiring pneumonitis (COVID-19-related prior ILD may be eligible with approval) | Inability to swallow oral medication or significant gastrointestinal disorder causing malabsorption | Uncontrolled active infections including HIV, HBV, HCV, or tuberculosis | Known hypersensitivity to JIN-A02 or its components | History of drug abuse or unstable medical, mental, or social conditions interfering with study participation | Unable to comply with study procedures
prior_therapies: Progression after an approved EGFR-TKI; Up to one prior line of platinum-based chemotherapy; For Part C: prior osimertinib (or another T790M-active EGFR-TKI) required

Line/prior exposure has unknown progression status but prior osimertinib aligns with Part C requirement; unknown does not create a soft conflict.
