question_text: I have a 40 year old patient with non-smallcell lung cancer. Diagnosed de novo metastatic disease (bone, liver) with EGFR exon 19 deletion. He has been on Osimertinib for 2 years with complete response. Unfortunately, began having headaches and recent MRI shows numerous lesions. Otherwise no past medical issues and ECOG 0. Are there any trial options?
trial_title: Clinical Trial of CD40L-augmented Tumor Infiltrating Lymphocytes (CD40L TIL) for Patients With Oncogene-Driven Advanced Non-Small Cell Lung Cancer (NSCLC)
inclusion_criteria: Age >= 18 years | Stage IV or recurrent non-small cell lung cancer | Activating genomic alteration in EGFR, ALK, ROS1, or ERBB2 | ECOG performance status 0–1 | Expected survival >= 4 months | Progression after >= 1 prior line of systemic therapy for NSCLC | Prior appropriate targeted therapy for the relevant genomic alteration | Measurable disease (excluding lesion used for TIL harvest) prior to nivolumab start | Safely accessible tumor for TIL harvest by excisional biopsy expected to yield >= 1.5 cm3 of tissue (aggregate) | Brain metastases allowed if treated or clinically stable <= 10 mm or not requiring immediate CNS-specific therapy | Adequate organ and marrow function | DLCO >= 45% predicted within past 4 months | HIV: on effective ART >= 6 months with undetectable viral load and normal CD4 count | Chronic HBV: undetectable viral load on suppressive therapy if indicated and no overt cirrhosis | HCV: treated and cured, or on treatment with undetectable viral load and no overt cirrhosis | Prior or concurrent malignancy allowed if it will not interfere with safety or efficacy assessment
exclusion_criteria: More than six prior lines of systemic therapy for NSCLC | Any prior PD-1 or PD-L1 inhibitor for metastatic NSCLC | Rapidly progressing tumors per investigator judgment | Active or prior documented autoimmune disease within the past 2 years (except allowed limited conditions with approval) | Active leptomeningeal or pachymeningeal metastases, or carcinomatous meningitis | Primary immunodeficiency | Chronic systemic steroid therapy or other immunosuppressive therapy within 7 days prior to enrollment (except allowed physiologic or topical/inhaled steroids) | Uncontrolled intercurrent illness (e.g., symptomatic congestive heart failure, unstable angina, significant arrhythmia other than AF/SVT, >= 85% carotid artery stenosis) | Unresolved >= grade 2 toxicity from prior anticancer therapy (unless irreversible and not expected to be exacerbated) | QTc >= 480 ms (Bazett) | Active systemic infection requiring intravenous antibiotics within 1 week prior to nivolumab | History of allogeneic organ transplant | Psychiatric illness or social situation limiting compliance | History of anaphylaxis to beta-lactam antibiotics
prior_therapies: At least one prior line of systemic therapy for NSCLC required; Appropriate prior targeted therapy required for the relevant genomic alteration
reasoning: Metastatic NSCLC with activating EGFR exon 19 deletion matches the trial’s disease and biomarker requirements; the patient is age-eligible with ECOG 0 and has received appropriate prior targeted therapy (osimertinib) without prior PD-1 exposure. Some procedural/response details (progression status, measurable disease, accessible tumor for TIL harvest) are unspecified but not contradictory.
patient_inclusion_criteria: Non-small cell lung cancer; De novo metastatic disease (bone, liver); EGFR exon 19 deletion; ECOG 0; Age 40 years
judge_comment: No hard exclusions. Disease and stage/setting match; required biomarker (EGFR exon 19) matches. Line/prior exposure partially unknown regarding progression, but prior appropriate targeted therapy and no PD-1 exposure are compatible; no soft conflicts identified. diseases_targeted: Ovarian Carcinoma (recurrent); Ovarian Clear Cell Adenocarcinoma (recurrent); Ovarian Endometrioid Adenocarcinoma (recurrent); Ovarian High Grade Serous Adenocarcinoma (recurrent); Ovarian Carcinosarcoma (recurrent); Fallopian Tube Carcinoma (recurrent); Fallopian Tube Clear Cell Adenocarcinoma (recurrent); Fallopian Tube Endometrioid Adenocarcinoma (recurrent); Fallopian Tube High Grade Serous Adenocarcinoma (recurrent); Fallopian Tube Carcinosarcoma; Primary Peritoneal Carcinoma (recurrent); Primary Peritoneal Clear Cell Adenocarcinoma (recurrent); Primary Peritoneal Endometrioid Adenocarcinoma (recurrent); Primary Peritoneal High Grade Serous Adenocarcinoma (recurrent); Primary Peritoneal Carcinosarcoma (recurrent)
inclusion_criteria: Age >= 18 years | Histologically confirmed recurrent epithelial ovarian, fallopian tube, or primary peritoneal cancer (high grade serous, endometrioid, or clear cell; mixed carcinomas/carcinosarcomas eligible if >= 50% high grade serous and/or endometrioid and/or clear cell) | Platinum-refractory, platinum-resistant, or platinum-sensitive recurrence | Measurable disease per RECIST v1.1 and/or CA-125-evaluable disease by GCIG | ECOG performance status 0-1 | Hemoglobin >= 8.5 g/dL | Absolute neutrophil count >= 1000/µL | Platelet count >= 75000/µL | Lymphocytes >= 300/µL | Monocytes >= 250/µL | Total bilirubin <= 1.5 x ULN (if Gilbert's, direct bilirubin <= ULN) | AST <= 3 x ULN | Creatinine clearance >= 30 mL/min
exclusion_criteria: Pregnant or nursing | Persons of childbearing potential or able to father a child unwilling to use adequate contraception | Prior anti-PD-1 or anti-PD-L1 therapy for ovarian cancer | IV anti-cancer therapy <= 3 weeks or oral anti-cancer therapy <= 1 week prior to registration | Grade >= 2 ovarian cancer-related symptoms, or lesion > 5 cm (non-nodal long axis or nodal short axis), or disease likely to become symptomatic within 8 weeks | Significant comorbid illness that would interfere with study treatment or assessments | Uncontrolled HIV infection; HIV must be well controlled on ART with CD4 >= 350/µL and suppressed HIV RNA | Ongoing or active serious infection requiring systemic therapy | Current or prior immune-related pneumonitis or interstitial lung disease requiring steroids | Active autoimmune disease requiring systemic treatment within 2 years (except replacement therapy) | Active hepatitis B (unless on antivirals with undetectable HBV DNA) or active hepatitis C (unless successfully treated with undetectable HCV RNA) | Other active malignancy requiring palliative systemic therapy within 3 years or likely to require treatment in next 2 years (except non-melanoma skin cancer, papillary thyroid cancer not requiring therapy, or carcinoma in situ) | Myocardial infarction within 6 months or congestive heart failure requiring ongoing maintenance therapy for life-threatening ventricular arrhythmias | Systemic immunosuppressive medication within 7 days prior to registration (except permitted low-dose or inhaled steroids) | History of allogeneic stem cell transplant

question_text: 40 year old man with recurrent glioblastoma. Diagnosed 1 year ago, underwent gross total resection with confirmation of GBM, IDH wildtype. trial_title: Randomized Phase 2 Clinical Trial of Repeated Intratumoral and Cervical Perilymphatic Lerapolturev Injections Versus Lomustine in Recurrent Glioblastoma (GBM)
inclusion_criteria: Age >= 18 years | Histopathologically confirmed recurrent supratentorial glioblastoma (WHO grade 4) | Karnofsky Performance Score >= 70% | Hemoglobin >= 9 g/dL prior to biopsy | Platelet count >= 100,000/µL prior to biopsy (unsupported) | Neutrophil count >= 1000/µL prior to biopsy | Creatinine <= 1.5 x ULN prior to biopsy | Total bilirubin <= 1.5 x ULN prior to biopsy (Gilbert's syndrome exception) | AST/ALT <= 2.5 x ULN | Prothrombin time and partial thromboplastin time <= 1.2 x ULN prior to biopsy | If on warfarin, INR < 2.0 prior to biopsy | Recurrent tumor presence confirmed by histopathology at time of biopsy prior to first lerapolturev infusion | Able to undergo brain MRI with and without contrast | Completed CDC-recommended poliovirus vaccination series and received IPV booster 1–6 weeks before lerapolturev (or evidence of anti-poliovirus immunity)
exclusion_criteria: Pregnant or breastfeeding | Impending, life-threatening cerebral herniation syndrome | Active infection requiring IV therapy or unexplained febrile illness (Tmax > 99.5°F/37.5°C) | Known immunosuppressive disease or HIV infection | Severe heart disease (NYHA class III or IV) | Known lung disease (FEV1 < 50%) or uncontrolled diabetes mellitus | Known albumin allergy | History of agammaglobulinemia | Chemotherapy or bevacizumab within 4 weeks (nitrosourea within 6 weeks; metronomic daily etoposide or cyclophosphamide within 1 week) prior to study drug unless recovered from toxicities | Immunotherapy within 4 weeks prior to study drug unless recovered from toxicities | Tumor treating fields within 1 week prior to study drug | Less than 12 weeks from radiation therapy unless progression outside field, two progressive scans >= 4 weeks apart, or histopathologic confirmation | Failure to complete standard-of-care treatments including surgery and radiation (age-adjusted dosing) | If MGMT promoter methylated or unknown, lack of at least one prior chemotherapy regimen | Neoplastic lesions in brainstem, cerebellum, or spinal cord | Active multifocal disease, extensive subependymal disease, tumor crossing midline, or leptomeningeal disease | Dexamethasone > 4 mg/day within 2 weeks prior to first lerapolturev infusion | Worsening steroid myopathy | Prior unrelated malignancy requiring current active treatment (except cervical carcinoma in situ and adequately treated basal cell or squamous cell skin cancer) | Active autoimmune disease requiring systemic immunomodulatory treatment within the past 3 months | Known hypersensitivity to lomustine, dacarbazine, or components of lomustine
prior_therapies: Maximal safe resection of recurrent tumor prior to study treatment; Completion of standard-of-care radiation therapy (age-adjusted dosing) prior to enrollment; If MGMT promoter methylated or unknown, at least one prior chemotherapy regimen required; Washout: chemotherapy or bevacizumab > 4 weeks (nitrosourea > 6 weeks; metronomic daily etoposide or cyclophosphamide > 1 week) before study drug; Washout: immunotherapy > 4 weeks before study drug; Washout: tumor treating fields > 1 week before study drug; Radiation therapy >= 12 weeks before study drug unless specified progression criteria met; Prior poliovirus vaccination series and IPV booster 1–6 weeks before lerapolturev

inclusion_criteria: Age 18-75 years | Crohn's Disease diagnosed for >= 6 months prior to Day 1 | Single and/or multi-tract perianal fistula(s) with 2 or fewer openings that are actively draining | Failed at least one medical therapy within the last year (e.g., antibiotics, immunomodulators, monoclonal antibodies, or small molecule inhibitors) | Previous failed surgical intervention (including seton placement >= 2 weeks prior to screening) or not a candidate for/willing to undergo surgical intervention | Medical therapy for Crohn's Disease stable for >= 2 months prior to Day 1
exclusion_criteria: Pregnant or breastfeeding | Woman of childbearing potential without a documented negative urine or serum pregnancy test | Active perianal abscess or infection at screening or Day 1 | Clinically significant medical conditions within 6 months before Day 1 that could compromise safety | Confirmed HIV infection | Confirmed Hepatitis B infection | Confirmed Hepatitis C infection | History of cancer, including melanoma, within 1 year of screening (except localized non-melanoma skin cancers) | History of colorectal cancer within 2 years of screening | Use of investigational therapy or treatment within 30 days prior to Day 1 | Unwilling to use medically acceptable contraception during the study
prior_therapies: Failed at least one prior medical therapy for Crohn's Disease within the last year; Previous failed surgical intervention for perianal fistula or not a candidate/willing; Current Crohn's Disease medical therapy stable for >= 2 months prior to Day 1; No investigational therapy within 30 days prior to Day 1
reasoning: Strong disease/setting match: perianal fistulizing Crohn’s with an active draining seton, and the patient’s age/sex fit. Prior failure of biologics aligns with the requirement for failed medical therapy; other specifics (number of openings, timing within 1 year, stable meds) are unspecified but no explicit exclusions are evident.
patient_inclusion_criteria: Moderate-to-severe Crohn's disease; Fistulizing disease; CDAI score 350; Active perianal fistula with draining seton in place
patient_prior_therapies: Refractory to infliximab; Refractory to ustekinumab
judge_comment: No hard exclusions. Disease and setting (perianal fistulizing Crohn’s with active drainage/seton) match. Prior failures align with the trial’s requirement for failed medical therapy; timing and other specifics (<=2 openings, med stability) are unknown but not conflicting. At least two core anchors (stage/setting and line/prior) match, so A is appropriate.

question_text: 40 year old man with recurrent glioblastoma. Diagnosed 1 year ago, underwent gross total resection with confirmation of GBM, IDH wildtype. Completed adjuvant radiation + concurrent temozolomide and then adjuvant temozolomide. Three months after completing adjuvant therapy, MRI shows recurrence. ECOG 1 and no other medical issues. What are trial options?
trial_title: A Phase I Study of Vorinostat (Suberoylanilide Hydroxamic Acid [SAHA]) in Combination With Temozolomide in Patients With Malignant Gliomas
diseases_targeted: Anaplastic Astrocytoma; Anaplastic Oligodendroglioma; Giant Cell Glioblastoma; Glioblastoma; Gliosarcoma; Mixed Glioma; Brain Neoplasm (recurrent)
inclusion_criteria: Histologically proven intracranial malignant glioma (glioblastoma, gliosarcoma, anaplastic astrocytoma, anaplastic oligodendroglioma, anaplastic mixed oligoastrocytoma, or malignant astrocytoma NOS); prior low-grade glioma allowed if subsequently malignant | Life expectancy > 8 weeks | Karnofsky performance status >= 60 | WBC >= 3,000/µL | ANC >= 1,500/µL | Platelet count >= 100,000/µL | Hemoglobin >= 10 g/dL (transfusion permitted to meet threshold) | AST (SGOT) < 2 x ULN | Bilirubin < 2 x ULN | Creatinine < 1.5 mg/dL | Baseline MRI or CT within 14 days on stable steroid dose >= 5 days; same modality used for follow-up; if steroids increased before registration, new baseline imaging required | Interval >= 3 weeks from completion of radiation therapy to study entry | Women of childbearing potential: negative pregnancy test within 7 days prior to registration | Women of childbearing potential and men agree to use adequate contraception during study | Willing to participate in pharmacokinetic studies | Part I: Stable disease after radiation therapy or progression eligible (unless progressed on temozolomide); prior relapses allowed | Recovered from prior therapy toxicities with required washouts (see prior therapies) | Post-resection eligibility: recovered from surgery; imaging within 96 hours post-op or >= 4 weeks post-op (within 14 days of registration) on stable steroids >= 5 days | Prior brachytherapy or stereotactic radiosurgery requires confirmation of true progression (PET or thallium scan, MR spectroscopy, or surgical documentation) | Part II: Only patients with stable disease after radiation therapy; no recurrent disease | Part II: Only prior therapy allowed is radiation alone or radiation with concomitant temozolomide; patients stable on adjuvant temozolomide may participate
exclusion_criteria: Progressed on temozolomide | Significant uncontrolled medical illness that would compromise therapy tolerance | History of other cancer within 3 years (except non-melanoma skin cancer or carcinoma in situ of the cervix) unless in complete remission and off therapy >= 3 years | Active infection | Pregnant | Breastfeeding (if treated with vorinostat; potential risks may also apply to temozolomide) | Any disease that would obscure toxicity assessment or dangerously alter drug metabolism | HIV positive receiving combination antiretroviral therapy | Receiving other investigational agents | Allergic reactions to vorinostat or compounds of similar chemical or biologic composition | Use of valproic acid within 2 weeks prior to enrollment
prior_therapies: >= 3 weeks since completion of radiation therapy; >= 28 days since any investigational agent; >= 28 days since prior cytotoxic therapy (>= 23 days since last standard 5/28 temozolomide); >= 14 days since vincristine; >= 42 days since nitrosoureas; >= 21 days since procarbazine; >= 7 days since non-cytotoxic agents (e.g., interferon, tamoxifen, thalidomide, cis-retinoic acid); Recent resection allowed if recovered from surgery and imaging criteria met; Prior interstitial brachytherapy or stereotactic radiosurgery allowed with confirmation of true progression; Part I: Prior relapses and prior temozolomide with stable disease allowed; progression on temozolomide not allowed; Part II: Only prior therapy permitted is radiation with or without concomitant temozolomide; adjuvant temozolomide allowed if stable; no other prior chemotherapies
reasoning: Disease and recurrent setting match, and age/sex are within trial parameters. Prior temozolomide is allowed in Part I unless the patient progressed on temozolomide, which is unknown here, so line/prior-exposure compatibility is uncertain.
patient_inclusion_criteria: Age 40 years; Male; Recurrent glioblastoma; IDH wildtype; Status post gross total resection; Completed radiation with concurrent temozolomide and adjuvant temozolomide; ECOG 1; No other medical issues
patient_prior_therapies: Gross total resection; Adjuvant radiation with concurrent temozolomide; Adjuvant temozolomide
judge_comment: No hard exclusions apply. Disease matches and the recurrent setting is allowed (Part I), giving one clear CORE ANCHOR match. Line/prior-exposure is uncertain due to the “no progression on temozolomide” requirement and unknown progression status. With exactly one anchor match and no soft conflicts, B is correct.

question_text: 55 year old male with metastatic urothelial carcinoma, now progressing after second line therapy. Initially diagnosed with MIBC 3 years ago. He received neoadjuvant gemcitabine/cisplatin x 4 cycles and then cystectomy with pCR. 6 months later he presented with new bone metastases. Biopsy confirmed metastatic urothelial cancer. He was started on EV+pembrolizumab and after 6 cycles, scans showed worsening osseous mets and now new liver lesions. He has a hx of T2DM, COPD, and CKD with eGFR 35. What are trial options?
trial_title: A Phase I/II Study of E7389 Halichondrin B Analog (NSC # 707389) in Metastatic Urothelial Tract Cancer and Renal Insufficiency
inclusion_criteria: Locally advanced or metastatic urothelial cancer not amenable to surgical treatment | Histologically or cytologically confirmed urothelial tract carcinoma | Measurable disease (>= 20 mm by conventional imaging or >= 10 mm by spiral CT) | Up to two prior lines of chemotherapy for recurrent/advanced disease allowed | Received at least one platinum-based chemotherapy for recurrent/advanced disease | For a specified cohort, prior tubulin inhibitor therapy required (e.g., paclitaxel, docetaxel, or vinblastine) | Women with or without prior therapy eligible | Life expectancy > 6 months | ECOG performance status 0-2 or Karnofsky >= 60% | Absolute neutrophil count >= 1,000/µL | Platelets >= 100,000/µL | Hemoglobin >= 9 g/dL | Total bilirubin <= 1.5 x ULN | AST/ALT <= 2.5 x ULN | Renal function: creatinine <= 1.5 x ULN or creatinine clearance >= 60 mL/min, or moderate/severe renal dysfunction with creatinine clearance >= 20 mL/min
exclusion_criteria: Concurrent treatment with other investigational agents | Unstable or untreated brain metastases | Uncontrolled intercurrent illness (including active infection, symptomatic congestive heart failure, unstable angina, clinically significant arrhythmia, or psychiatric illness/social conditions limiting compliance) | Pregnant or breastfeeding | HIV-positive on combination antiretroviral therapy | HIV-positive with CD4+ <= 500/mm3 | Prior therapy with eribulin | Symptomatic uremia, uncontrolled edema, or unstable serum electrolytes not stabilized prior to enrollment
prior_therapies: Prior platinum-based chemotherapy for recurrent/advanced disease required; Up to two prior lines of chemotherapy for recurrent/advanced disease allowed; Prior tubulin inhibitor required for a specified cohort (e.g., paclitaxel, docetaxel, vinblastine)
reasoning: Disease and metastatic setting match, and age/sex fit; the allowance of up to two prior lines is compatible with being after second-line therapy. However, required prior platinum-based therapy for recurrent/advanced disease and measurable disease status are unknown, preventing confirmation of full eligibility.
patient_inclusion_criteria: (none)
judge_comment: No hard exclusions. Stage/setting clearly matches (metastatic), and line-of-therapy is compatible (post-2L with trial allowing up to two prior lines). Unknown prior platinum and measurable disease should not downgrade per rubric (unknowns are neutral). Thus ≥2 core anchors match, yielding A. The grader’s B incorrectly penalized unknowns.

question_text: 36 female with stage III clear cell ovarian carcinoma, who initially received optimal debulking and adjuvant carboplatin+paclitaxel +bevacizumab. After 5 months, she had a new pleural effusion that was cytology positive for ovarian carcinoma. She was found to be BRCA1 positive. What are trial options?
trial_title: A Phase III Randomized Controlled Clinical Trial of Carboplatin and Paclitaxel (or Gemcitabine) Alone or in Combination With Bevacizumab (NSC #704865) Followed by Bevacizumab and Secondary Cytoreductive Surgery in Platinum-Sensitive, Recurrent Ovarian, Peritoneal Primary and Fallopian Tube Cancer. NCI-Supplied Agents: Bevacizumab (NSC #704865)
diseases_targeted: Ovarian Carcinoma (recurrent); Fallopian Tube Carcinoma (recurrent); Primary Peritoneal Carcinoma (recurrent)
inclusion_criteria: Candidate for cytoreductive surgery when applicable per protocol/randomization plan | Histologic epithelial ovarian, primary peritoneal, or fallopian tube carcinoma, recurrent | Eligible epithelial histologies include serous, endometrioid, mucinous, clear cell, transitional cell, undifferentiated, malignant Brenner tumor, mixed epithelial, or adenocarcinoma NOS | Complete response to front-line platinum-taxane therapy (>=3 cycles) | Treatment-free interval without progression >=6 months after completion of front-line chemotherapy (platinum and taxane) | Maintenance biologic or hormonal therapy allowed if recurrence >6 months and >=4 weeks since last biologic infusion | Clinically evident recurrent disease | Measurable disease per RECIST with at least one lesion: >=20 mm by conventional imaging/MRI/CT or >=10 mm by spiral CT | ANC >=1500/µL | Platelets >=100000/µL | Creatinine <=1.5 x ULN | Total bilirubin <=1.5 x ULN | AST <=2.5 x ULN | Alkaline phosphatase <=2.5 x ULN | Urine protein-to-creatinine ratio <1.0 mg/dL (if receiving bevacizumab) | ECOG 0–2
exclusion_criteria: More than one prior chemotherapy regimen (maintenance not counted as a separate regimen) | Concurrent immunotherapy or radiotherapy | Prior radiotherapy to any portion of the abdominal cavity or pelvis | Prior secondary cytoreductive surgery for recurrent disease | Requirement for parenteral hydration or nutrition with evidence of partial bowel obstruction or perforation | Prior chemotherapy for other abdominal or pelvic tumors (except ovarian, fallopian tube, primary peritoneal) | Synchronous or prior primary endometrial cancer unless all met: stage <= IB; no more than superficial myometrial invasion without vascular/lymphatic invasion; no poorly differentiated subtypes (papillary serous, clear cell, FIGO grade 3) | Uncontrolled infection | Severe uncontrolled comorbid medical conditions limiting compliance or increasing risk | Peripheral neuropathy >= grade 2 | History of hypersensitivity to carboplatin and/or paclitaxel unless successfully desensitized | Hypersensitivity to CHO cell products or other recombinant antibodies (applies to bevacizumab recipients) | Pregnant or breastfeeding; inadequate contraception | Other invasive malignancy within 5 years (except non-melanoma skin cancer) or prior cancer therapy contraindicating protocol therapy | Active bleeding or high-risk bleeding conditions/coagulopathy (applies to bevacizumab recipients) | CNS disease (including brain metastases), uncontrolled seizures, or stroke within 5 years (applies to bevacizumab recipients) | Significant cardiovascular disease, including conduction abnormalities (PR >0.24 s or 2nd/3rd-degree AV block), uncontrolled hypertension (systolic >150 mmHg or diastolic >90 mmHg), myocardial infarction/cardiac arrhythmia/unstable angina within 6 months, NYHA class >= II heart failure, serious arrhythmia requiring medication, peripheral vascular disease grade >= II, or cerebrovascular accident within 6 months (applies to bevacizumab recipients) | Major surgery, open biopsy, dental extractions/procedures resulting in open wound, or significant traumatic injury within 28 days before treatment; vascular access device placement or core biopsy within 7 days before treatment
prior_therapies: Complete response to front-line platinum-taxane therapy (>=3 cycles) required; Treatment-free interval >=6 months from completion of front-line platinum and taxane chemotherapy; Front-line therapy may have included bevacizumab; Maintenance cytotoxic chemotherapy must be discontinued >=6 months before documentation of recurrence; Maintenance biological or hormonal therapy allowed if recurrence >6 months and >=4 weeks since last biologic infusion
reasoning: Disease and setting match (recurrent epithelial ovarian carcinoma with clear cell histology; female age 36), and prior front-line platinum-taxane ± bevacizumab is allowed. However, platinum-sensitive status (≥6-month interval and prior complete response) and other required eligibility details (measurable disease/ECOG/labs) are unknown, so only one core anchor is clearly satisfied.
patient_inclusion_criteria: Stage III clear cell ovarian carcinoma; Cytology-positive pleural effusion; BRCA1 positive; Female; Age 36 years
patient_prior_therapies: Optimal debulking surgery; Adjuvant carboplatin plus paclitaxel plus bevacizumab
judge_comment: No hard exclusions. Disease matches (recurrent epithelial ovarian, clear cell allowed). Core anchors: (1) Stage/setting matches (recurrent). (2) Line/prior exposure aligns (post front-line platinum–taxane ± bevacizumab is required/allowed and patient had it). Platinum-sensitive interval and CR status are unknown and should be treated as neutral, not preventing counting the line/prior anchor as a match. With ≥2 anchors matched and no soft conflicts, the correct grade is A, not B.

question_text: A 32-year-old male has moderate-to-severe fistulizing Crohn's disease, refractory to both infliximab and ustekinumab, with a CDAI score of 350. He recently completed IV antibiotic treatment for a perianal abscess and still has an active, draining seton in place. What are his clinical trial options?
trial_title: Autologous Stem Cell Transplantation with CD34-Selected Peripheral Blood Stem Cells (PBSC) in Pediatric and Adult Patients with Severe Crohn's Disease
inclusion_criteria: Age 10–60 years | Severe, refractory Crohn's Disease appropriate for stem cell transplant therapy | Prior surgery with severe recurrent disease despite aggressive maintenance therapy | Diffuse small bowel and colonic disease refractory to aggressive medical treatment and not eligible for surgery without high risk of short bowel syndrome or other contraindications to surgery | Persistently high disease activity: HBI > 6 or CDAI > 250 or PCDAI > 45, or moderate disease (HBI <= 6, CDAI < 250, PCDAI 30–45) requiring daily corticosteroids and aggressive medical treatment to maintain status | Resistant complications unresponsive to medical management (e.g., multiple enteric fistulas, enterovesicular or enterovaginal fistulas, severe perianal disease, debilitating arthritis, severe skin lesions such as pyoderma, severe bony complications such as aseptic necrosis or pathologic fractures) | Severe complications from medical therapy (e.g., pancreatitis from 6-mercaptopurine, colitis from 5-ASA, severe hypersensitivity to TNF-alpha inhibitors, anti-integrin agents, or anti-IL12/23 agents) | Stoma present is allowed | No surgical therapeutic option due to risk of short bowel syndrome or patient refusal | Harvey Bradshaw Index > 5, or CDAI > 250, or PCDAI > 30 | Platelet count > 100,000/µL | Absolute neutrophil count > 1500/µL | Creatinine <= 2.0 mg/dL | No history of coronary artery disease; LVEF >= 40% or shortening fraction >= 26% | FEV1/FVC >= 60% predicted; DLCO >= 60% predicted | Negative pregnancy test for females of childbearing potential | Agreement to use effective contraception during treatment and for up to 24 months after PBSC transplant or while on any medication that may harm a pregnancy
exclusion_criteria: No prior adequate dosing of 6-mercaptopurine, 5-ASA products, and metronidazole | Sustained corticosteroid-free response to anti-TNF-alpha, anti-integrin, or anti-IL12/23 therapy after a 4-month course | Toxic megacolon | Intestinal perforation | Conjugated bilirubin > 2.0 mg/dL | Pregnancy or nursing | HIV seropositive, HTLV seropositive, HBsAg positive, or HCV RNA positive by PCR | Active infection within two weeks of mobilization and high-dose chemotherapy | Other significant medical problems or abnormal findings that increase risk, interfere with compliance, or impact data quality in the investigator's opinion
prior_therapies: Prior adequate dosing of 6-mercaptopurine, 5-ASA products, and metronidazole required; Prior surgery allowed
reasoning: Disease and severity match (CDAI > 250, fistulizing perianal disease) and age is within range; refractory to biologics is compatible with the trial’s refractory setting. However, prior adequate dosing of 6‑MP, 5‑ASA, and metronidazole—explicitly required—is not documented, so line/prior-therapy eligibility cannot be confirmed.
patient_inclusion_criteria: Moderate-to-severe Crohn's disease; Fistulizing disease; CDAI score 350; Active perianal fistula with draining seton in place
patient_prior_therapies: Refractory to infliximab; Refractory to ustekinumab
judge_comment: No hard exclusions. Disease matches. Stage/setting matches (severe, refractory Crohn’s with high CDAI and fistulizing perianal disease). Line/prior-exposure cannot be confirmed because required prior 6-MP/5-ASA/metronidazole exposure is unknown. Other anchors not applicable. Exactly one core anchor match → B per rubric. The grader’s reasoning aligns with this.

question_text: A 32-year-old male has moderate-to-severe fistulizing Crohn's disease, refractory to both infliximab and ustekinumab, with a CDAI score of 350. He recently completed IV antibiotic treatment for a perianal abscess and still has an active, draining seton in place. What are his clinical trial options?
trial_title: A Phase II Study of Reduced Intensity Conditioning in Pediatric Patients and Young Adults ≤55 Years of Age With Non-Malignant Disorders Undergoing Umbilical Cord Blood, Bone Marrow, or Peripheral Blood Stem Cell Transplantation
diseases_targeted: Primary Immunodeficiency; Congenital Bone Marrow Failure Syndrome; Inherited Metabolic Disorder; Hereditary Anemia; Crohn's Disease; Inflammatory Bowel Disease; Juvenile Rheumatoid Arthritis; Systemic Juvenile Idiopathic Arthritis
inclusion_criteria: Availability of a suitable graft: 4/6–6/6 HLA matched related or unrelated UCB unit with total nucleated cells >= 3 x 10^7/kg (or double units each >= 2 x 10^7/kg) or 8/8 or 7/8 HLA allele-matched unrelated donor bone marrow or peripheral blood progenitor graft | Serum creatinine <= 2.0 mg/dL | Creatinine clearance >= 50 mL/min | ALT <= 4 x ULN | AST <= 4 x ULN | Cardiac function adequate: shortening fraction > 26% or ejection fraction > 40% or > 80% of normal for age | Pulmonary function: FEV1/FVC >= 50% predicted for age | Pulmonary function: DLCO (hemoglobin-corrected) >= 50% predicted (adults, if obtainable) | Resting pulse oximetry >= 92% on room air | HIV negative | Negative pregnancy test if pubertal and/or menstruating | Non-malignant disorder amenable to HSCT, including primary immunodeficiency syndromes (e.g., SCID with NK activity, Omenn, BLS, CID, CVID, Wiskott-Aldrich, leukocyte adhesion deficiency, CGD, X-linked hyper IgM, IPEX, Chediak-Higashi, ALPS, HLH, lymphocyte signaling defects) | Congenital bone marrow failure syndromes (e.g., dyskeratosis congenita, congenital amegakaryocytic thrombocytopenia, osteopetrosis) | Inherited metabolic disorders (e.g., mucopolysaccharidoses [Hurler, Hunter], leukodystrophies [Krabbe, metachromatic leukodystrophy, X-linked adrenoleukodystrophy, HDLS], alpha mannosidosis, Gaucher disease) | Hereditary anemias (e.g., thalassemia major, sickle cell disease with qualifying complications, Diamond-Blackfan anemia, other congenital transfusion-dependent anemias) | Inflammatory conditions (e.g., Crohn's disease/Inflammatory Bowel Disease)
exclusion_criteria: Allogeneic hematopoietic stem cell transplant within the previous 6 months | Active malignancy or myelodysplastic syndrome | Severe acquired aplastic anemia | Uncontrolled bacterial, viral, or fungal infection with progression of clinical symptoms despite therapy | Pregnancy or nursing | Poorly controlled pulmonary hypertension | Any condition that precludes serial follow-up

patient_inclusion_criteria: Moderate-to-severe Crohn's disease; Fistulizing disease; CDAI score 350; Active perianal fistula with draining seton in place
patient_prior_therapies: Refractory to infliximab; Refractory to ustekinumab

question_text: 40 year old man with recurrent glioblastoma. Diagnosed 1 year ago, underwent gross total resection with confirmation of GBM, IDH wildtype. Completed adjuvant radiation + concurrent temozolomide and then adjuvant temozolomide. Three months after completing adjuvant therapy, MRI shows recurrence. ECOG 1 and no other medical issues. What are trial options?
trial_title: Phase I Study of Cellular ImmunoTx Using Memory Enriched T Cells Lentivirally Transduced to Express an IL13Rα2-Specific, Hinge-Optimized, 41BB-Costimulatory Chimeric Receptor and a Truncated CD19 for Pts With Rec/Ref MaligGlioma
diseases_targeted: Glioblastoma (recurrent/refractory); Malignant Glioma (recurrent/refractory); WHO Grade II Glioma (recurrent/refractory); WHO Grade III Glioma (recurrent/refractory)
inclusion_criteria: Histologically confirmed grade III or IV glioma, or prior grade II glioma with radiographic progression consistent with grade III or IV after standard therapy | Radiographic progression/recurrence of measurable disease >12 weeks after completion of initial radiation therapy | Karnofsky performance status >=60% | Life expectancy >4 weeks | Tumor IL13RA2 expression by immunohistochemistry >=20% (>=1+) | Dexamethasone requirement <=2 mg TID at PBMC collection | Creatinine <1.6 mg/dL (for Rickham placement eligibility) | White blood cell count >2000/µL (for Rickham placement eligibility) | Absolute neutrophil count >1000/µL (for Rickham placement eligibility) | Platelets >=100000/µL (for Rickham placement eligibility) | INR <1.3 (for Rickham placement eligibility) | Total bilirubin <1.5 mg/dL (for Rickham placement eligibility) | ALT and AST <=2.5 x ULN (for Rickham placement eligibility) | Released cryopreserved T cell product available | No supplemental oxygen required to maintain O2 saturation >95% and no progressive chest radiographic abnormalities prior to infusion | No pressor support required and no symptomatic cardiac arrhythmias prior to infusion | Afebrile (<=38.5 C) with no positive blood cultures or signs of meningitis within 48 hours prior to infusion | Total bilirubin <=2 x ULN prior to infusion | Transaminases <=2 x ULN prior to infusion | Serum creatinine <=1.8 mg/dL prior to infusion | No uncontrolled seizure activity following surgery prior to first T cell dose | Platelets >=100000/µL prior to infusion (or transfuse to >=100000/µL) | Dexamethasone requirement <=2 mg TID during T cell therapy
exclusion_criteria: Requires supplemental oxygen to keep saturation >95% with no expected resolution within 2 weeks | Requires pressor support and/or has symptomatic cardiac arrhythmias | Requires dialysis | Uncontrolled seizure activity and/or clinically evident progressive encephalopathy | Non-malignant intercurrent illness that is poorly controlled or severe enough to preclude participation | Any other active malignancy | Severe infection under treatment or recovering from major surgery until recovery is complete | Uncontrolled illness including ongoing or active infection | Known active hepatitis B infection | Known active hepatitis C infection | Signs or symptoms of active infection, positive blood cultures, or radiologic evidence of infection | Confirmed human immunodeficiency virus (HIV) infection within 4 weeks of screening
prior_therapies: At least 12 weeks since completion of initial radiation therapy; At least 2 weeks since last chemotherapy or radiation before PBMC collection; At least 6 weeks since completion of nitrosourea-containing chemotherapy; At least 23 days since completion of temozolomide; At least 4 weeks since completion of other non-nitrosourea cytotoxic chemotherapy; At least 2 weeks since last targeted agent if recovered from toxicity (except bevacizumab); At least 4 weeks since last dose of bevacizumab
reasoning: Disease and setting match (recurrent glioblastoma), and age/sex fit the trial; prior standard chemoradiation is consistent. However, the required tumor IL13RA2 expression and specific timing/performance details (e.g., >12 weeks post-RT, intervals since temozolomide, KPS) are not provided, so full eligibility cannot be confirmed.
patient_inclusion_criteria: Age 40 years; Male; Recurrent glioblastoma; IDH wildtype; Status post gross total resection; Completed radiation with concurrent temozolomide and adjuvant temozolomide; ECOG 1; No other medical issues
patient_prior_therapies: Gross total resection; Adjuvant radiation with concurrent temozolomide; Adjuvant temozolomide
judge_comment: No hard exclusions. Stage/setting matches (recurrent GBM). Line/prior-exposure compatibility is uncertain due to required timing (>12 weeks post-RT, intervals since temozolomide) not provided. Required IL13RA2 biomarker is unknown, so A cannot be awarded. With exactly one clear anchor (stage/setting) and no soft mismatches, B is appropriate.

question_text: 55 year old male with metastatic urothelial carcinoma, now progressing after second line therapy. Initially diagnosed with MIBC 3 years ago. He received neoadjuvant gemcitabine/cisplatin x 4 cycles and then cystectomy with pCR. 6 months later he presented with new bone metastases. Biopsy confirmed metastatic urothelial cancer. He was started on EV+pembrolizumab and after 6 cycles, scans showed worsening osseous mets and now new liver lesions. He has a hx of T2DM, COPD, and CKD with eGFR 35. What are trial options?
trial_title: A Phase 2, Two-arm Multicenter, Open-Label Study to Determine the Efficacy and the Safety of Two Different Dose Regimens of a Pan-FGFR Tyrosine Kinase Inhibitor JNJ-42756493 in Subjects With Metastatic or Surgically Unresectable Urothelial Cancer With FGFR Genomic Alterations
inclusion_criteria: Histologic metastatic or surgically unresectable urothelial cancer; minor variant histology allowed | Measurable disease per RECIST v1.1 | ECOG performance status 0–2 | Adequate bone marrow, liver, and renal function | Negative pregnancy test for women of childbearing potential | Disease progression per RECIST v1.1 after prior chemotherapy for metastatic or unresectable disease | Neoadjuvant or adjuvant chemotherapy with recurrence/progression within 12 months of last dose counts as metastatic setting | Prior anti-PD-1/PD-L1 therapy with progression also eligible

question_text: I have a 40 year old patient with non-smallcell lung cancer. Diagnosed de novo metastatic disease (bone, liver) with EGFR exon 19 deletion. He has been on Osimertinib for 2 years with complete response. Unfortunately, began having headaches and recent MRI shows numerous lesions. Otherwise no past medical issues and ECOG 0. Are there any trial options?
trial_title: A Phase I Study of a p53MVA Vaccine in Combination With Pembrolizumab
diseases_targeted: Non-Small Cell Lung Carcinoma; Head and Neck Squamous Cell Carcinoma; Hepatocellular Carcinoma; Renal Cell Carcinoma; Melanoma; Bladder Carcinoma; Soft Tissue Sarcoma; Triple-Negative Breast Carcinoma; Colorectal Carcinoma; Pancreatic Carcinoma
inclusion_criteria: Advanced (unresectable) solid tumors from predefined histologies (NSCLC, head and neck squamous cell carcinoma, hepatocellular carcinoma, renal cell carcinoma, melanoma, bladder carcinoma, soft tissue sarcoma, triple-negative breast cancer, colorectal carcinoma displaying microsatellite instability, or pancreatic cancer) | Failed or intolerant to at least one line of standard therapy or refusal of standard treatment | ECOG performance status <= 2 (Karnofsky >= 60%) | Absolute neutrophil count >= 1500/µL | Platelets >= 100000/µL | Hemoglobin > 9 g/dL | Creatinine clearance >= 50 mL/min or serum creatinine <= 1.6 mg/dL | Total bilirubin <= 1.5 x ULN | AST <= 3 x ULN (<= 5 x ULN with liver metastasis) | ALT <= 3 x ULN (<= 5 x ULN with liver metastasis) | Confirmed TP53 involvement: TP53 overexpression by IHC (>= 10% tumor cells) or TP53 mutation by tumor mutational analysis
exclusion_criteria: Concurrent investigational agents or radiation therapy | Pregnant or breastfeeding | Known brain metastasis | Radiotherapy within 4 weeks prior to study entry | Prior exposure to anti-PD-1 or anti-PD-L1 therapy | History of allergy to egg proteins | Unresolved adverse events from prior therapy > 4 weeks | Concurrent use of systemic corticosteroids (nasal, inhaled, adrenal replacement, and topical allowed) | History of immunodeficiency including organ grafts or HIV infection | Active autoimmune disease or condition requiring systemic corticosteroids (exceptions: vitiligo, type 1 diabetes mellitus) | History of severe immune-mediated adverse reactions with ipilimumab (grade 4 toxicity requiring > 10 mg/day prednisone or equivalent for > 12 weeks) | History of cardiac disease or abnormal screening ECG (excluding 1st degree bundle branch block, sinus bradycardia, sinus tachycardia, or non-specific T wave changes) or serum troponin >= grade 2 | Investigator-assessed inability to comply with safety monitoring
prior_therapies: At least one prior line of standard therapy failed or intolerant, or refusal of standard treatment
reasoning: Disease (NSCLC) and metastatic/advanced setting match. However, required TP53 involvement is not provided and it’s unclear if the patient has failed at least one prior standard therapy, so key eligibility anchors are uncertain; no explicit exclusions are met.

question_text: 40 year old man with recurrent glioblastoma. Diagnosed 1 year ago, underwent gross total resection with confirmation of GBM, IDH wildtype. Completed adjuvant radiation + concurrent temozolomide and then adjuvant temozolomide. Three months after completing adjuvant therapy, MRI shows recurrence. ECOG 1 and no other medical issues. What are trial options?
trial_title: A Proof-of-Concept, Pilot Study of Pembrolizumab (MK-3475) in Patients With Recurrent Malignant Glioma With a Hypermutator Phenotype
inclusion_criteria: Histologically confirmed malignant glioma | WHO grade IV glioblastoma or variants | WHO grade III anaplastic astrocytoma or oligodendroglial tumor | WHO grade II glioma with contrast enhancement on MRI | Recurrent tumor after prior therapy including at least radiation therapy and one cytotoxic chemotherapy | Hypermutator phenotype defined as >=30 nonsynonymous somatic mutations by CLIA-certified NGS (or per PI approval, mutation in mismatch repair gene or other hypermutator-associated genes, or presence of microsatellite instability) | Age >= 18 years | >=12 weeks since prior radiation therapy unless histopathologic confirmation of recurrence or new enhancement outside radiation field | >=4 weeks since last investigational agent or any other treatment prior to first dose of pembrolizumab | Recovered to <= Grade 1 from adverse events of prior therapy | Karnofsky performance status >= 70 | Adequate organ function | Negative pregnancy test for females of childbearing potential | Agreement to use effective contraception
exclusion_criteria: Requirement for escalating or chronic supraphysiologic corticosteroids (>10 mg/day prednisone equivalent) for disease control at registration | Prior treatment with anti-CTLA-4, anti-PD-1, anti-PD-L1, or anti-PD-L2 agents | Hypersensitivity to pembrolizumab or its excipients | Immunodeficiency including HIV/AIDS | Active hepatitis B or active hepatitis C infection | Known history of active tuberculosis | Additional malignancy that is progressing or requires active treatment (except certain skin cancers or in situ cervical cancer) | Active autoimmune disease requiring systemic treatment in the past 2 years | History or evidence of active non-infectious pneumonitis | Active infection requiring systemic therapy | Pregnant or breastfeeding | Unable to undergo brain MRI | Live vaccine within 30 days before start of study therapy | Prior treatment with bevacizumab
prior_therapies: Must have received prior radiation therapy; Must have received at least one prior cytotoxic chemotherapy; >=12 weeks since prior radiation therapy unless pathologic confirmation of recurrence or new enhancement outside radiation field; >=4 weeks since last investigational agent or any other treatment; Recovered to <= Grade 1 from prior therapy adverse events; Prior surgical resection for recurrence allowed
reasoning: Disease and setting match (recurrent glioblastoma within recurrent malignant glioma), and prior radiation plus temozolomide meets prior-therapy requirements. However, the trial requires a hypermutator phenotype, which is not reported for this patient, making eligibility uncertain.
patient_inclusion_criteria: Age 40 years; Male; Recurrent glioblastoma; IDH wildtype; Status post gross total resection; Completed radiation with concurrent temozolomide and adjuvant temozolomide; ECOG 1; No other medical issues
patient_prior_therapies: Gross total resection; Adjuvant radiation with concurrent temozolomide; Adjuvant temozolomide
judge_comment: No hard exclusions. Disease and recurrent setting match, and prior radiation plus temozolomide satisfies line/prior requirements, giving ≥2 core anchor matches. The required hypermutator biomarker is unknown (not a soft mismatch), so per the decision procedure this should be graded A, not downgraded to B.

question_text: What are trial options for a 68-year-old male with a two-year history of progressive cognitive decline? His MMSE score is 19, consistent with moderate-stage dementia. An amyloid PET scan was performed and was negative. CSF analysis was also negative for amyloid plaques but showed elevated p-tau. His family is seeking disease-modifying therapies.
trial_title: Neurologic Bone Marrow Derived Stem Cell Treatment Study
diseases_targeted: Amyotrophic Lateral Sclerosis; Alzheimer Disease; CADASIL; Cerebral Hemorrhage; Cerebral Infarction; Cerebral Ischemia; Chronic Traumatic Encephalopathy; Cognitive Impairment; Dementia; Diabetic Neuropathy; Frontotemporal Dementia; Lewy Body Disease; Lewy Body Variant of Alzheimer Disease; Multiple System Atrophy; Neuropathy; Parkinson Disease; Progressive Supranuclear Palsy; Stroke; Traumatic Brain Injury
inclusion_criteria: Documented functional damage to the central or peripheral nervous system unlikely to improve with current standard of care | >= 6 months since disease onset | If on pharmacologic or surgical therapy, clinically stable and unlikely to have reversal of neurologic damage from that therapy | Investigator assessment that there is potential for improvement with BMSC and minimal risk from the procedure | Age > 18 years | Medically stable and able to be cleared by a primary care practitioner for the procedure
exclusion_criteria: Not medically stable or at significant risk to health from undergoing the procedure | Pregnant at the time of treatment or planning pregnancy within 3 months post-treatment
prior_therapies: Current pharmacologic or surgical therapy allowed if stable
reasoning: Disease matches (dementia), age is eligible, and prior therapy/line requirements are compatible. Stage/setting specifics and investigator/medical stability criteria are not specified, so only one core anchor clearly matches.
patient_biomarkers: Amyloid PET negative; CSF amyloid negative; Elevated CSF p-tau
patient_inclusion_criteria: Age 68 years; Male; Two-year history of progressive cognitive decline; MMSE score 19; Moderate-stage dementia; Amyloid PET negative; CSF amyloid negative; Elevated CSF p-tau
judge_comment: No hard exclusions. Disease matches. Line/prior-exposure is compatible (allowed if stable; patient has none). Stage/setting, biomarker, and mets pattern are not applicable/unknown. Exactly one core anchor match → B per rubric.

question_text: 36 female with stage III clear cell ovarian carcinoma, who initially received optimal debulking and adjuvant carboplatin+paclitaxel +bevacizumab. After 5 months, she had a new pleural effusion that was cytology positive for ovarian carcinoma. She was found to be BRCA1 positive. What are trial options?
trial_title: P53MVA and Pembrolizumab in Treating Patients With Recurrent Ovarian, Primary Peritoneal, or Fallopian Tube Cancer
diseases_targeted: Ovarian Carcinoma (platinum-resistant, recurrent); Primary Peritoneal Carcinoma (platinum-resistant, recurrent); Fallopian Tube Carcinoma (platinum-resistant, recurrent)
inclusion_criteria: Histologically or cytologically confirmed epithelial ovarian, primary peritoneal, or fallopian tube cancer | Recurrent or progressive disease within 6 months after completion of platinum-based chemotherapy (platinum-resistant or refractory) | Measurable disease per RECIST 1.1 or detectable disease | CA-125 >= 2 x ULN if no measurable disease | Ascites and/or pleural effusion attributed to tumor if no measurable disease | Non-measurable solid and/or cystic abnormalities on imaging not meeting target lesion criteria if no measurable disease | TP53 mutation and/or p53 overexpression by IHC (>= 10% tumor cells) | ECOG <=2 | Life expectancy >= 3 months | Up to 4 prior chemotherapy regimens for recurrent disease allowed
exclusion_criteria: Positive pregnancy test or pregnant/breastfeeding | Prior therapy with anti-PD-1, anti-PD-L1, anti-PD-L2, or other T-cell checkpoint agents (e.g., CTLA-4, OX-40, CD137) | Systemic anti-cancer therapy within 4 weeks before start | Radiotherapy within 3 weeks before start (1-week washout allowed for short palliative non-CNS RT) | Live vaccine within 30 days before first dose | Participation in another investigational agent or device study within 4 weeks before start | Immunodeficiency (including organ grafts or HIV) or systemic immunosuppression >10 mg prednisone equivalent within 7 days before start | Another malignancy requiring active treatment within the past 3 years (except certain in situ and non-melanoma skin cancers) | Active CNS metastases or carcinomatous meningitis (previously treated, stable brain metastases allowed off steroids >=14 days) | Severe hypersensitivity (>= grade 3) to pembrolizumab or excipients | Active autoimmune disease requiring systemic treatment in the past 2 years | History of non-infectious pneumonitis requiring steroids or current pneumonitis | Active infection requiring systemic therapy | Known HIV infection | Active hepatitis A, hepatitis B surface antigen positive, or active hepatitis C (HCV RNA detectable) | Active tuberculosis infection | Significant cardiac disease: myocardial infarction or arterial thromboembolic event within 6 months, severe/unstable angina, NYHA class III/IV heart failure, QTcB > 470 ms, uncontrolled hypertension (>150/100 mm Hg), abnormal EKG/echo/troponin (>= grade 2) | Li-Fraumeni syndrome (family history or confirmed) | Severe environmental allergies or allergy to egg proteins | Psychiatric or substance use disorders interfering with study requirements
prior_therapies: Up to 4 prior chemotherapy regimens for recurrent disease allowed; Adjuvant chemotherapy and maintenance paclitaxel not counted toward regimen limit; Prior targeted agents or hormone therapy not counted as systemic chemotherapy regimens; No prior anti-PD-1/PD-L1/PD-L2 or other T-cell checkpoint therapy; No systemic anti-cancer therapy within 4 weeks before start (toxicities recovered to <= grade 1 except <= grade 2 neuropathy); No radiotherapy within 3 weeks before start (1-week washout allowed for short palliative non-CNS RT); No investigational agents or devices within 4 weeks before start; No live vaccines within 30 days before first dose; No non-oncology viral vaccines within 30 days before start
reasoning: Disease category and prior therapy exposure are compatible (female, age ≥18; epithelial ovarian cancer; no prior PD-1; adjuvant platinum allowed). However, the trial specifically requires platinum-resistant recurrence and TP53 mutation or p53 overexpression, both of which are unknown for this patient, making eligibility uncertain.
patient_inclusion_criteria: Stage III clear cell ovarian carcinoma; Cytology-positive pleural effusion; BRCA1 positive; Female; Age 36 years
patient_prior_therapies: Optimal debulking surgery; Adjuvant carboplatin plus paclitaxel plus bevacizumab
judge_comment: No hard exclusions. Disease matches; patient is PD-1–naïve and prior therapy exposure is compatible (one anchor). Stage/setting requires platinum-resistant recurrence, which is unknown, and required TP53/p53 biomarker is unknown. No soft mismatches identified. Thus exactly one core anchor match → B. Grader’s reasoning aligns with the rubric.

question_text: What are trial options for a 66 year old male with hx hypertension, afib, T2DM and mCRPC, now progressing on enzalutamide? He has been on Lupron+Zytiga for 3 years, with new liver and bone metastases which are all PSMA PET avid. He’s tolerated therapy well overall except for grade 2 fatigue.
trial_title: A Phase 1b Dose-Escalation Study of Cabozantinib (XL184) Administered Alone or in Combination With Atezolizumab to Subjects With Locally Advanced or Metastatic Solid Tumors

prior_therapies: Prior platinum-based chemotherapy for urothelial carcinoma (specific cohorts); Up to one prior VEGFR-targeting TKI allowed for non–clear cell RCC (Expansion Cohort 10); No prior systemic anticancer therapy required for selected cohorts (e.g., clear cell RCC, HCC, PD-L1 positive NSCLC); Progression after prior immune checkpoint inhibitor required for selected UC and NSCLC cohorts; Prior EGFR-targeting TKI with subsequent progression required for EGFR-mutant NSCLC cohort; Prior systemic chemotherapy containing fluoropyrimidine with oxaliplatin or irinotecan required for CRC cohort; At least one prior systemic therapy required for TNBC cohort; Platinum-resistant or refractory OC after up to two prior lines; At least one prior systemic therapy required for EC cohort; Prior enzalutamide and/or abiraterone for metastatic CRPC (specific cohort); Exactly one prior novel hormonal therapy for mCRPC cohorts; Prior docetaxel for mCRPC required in a specific cohort

Line/prior-exposure is uncertain given trial text about mCRPC cohorts often requiring exactly one prior novel hormonal therapy while the patient had both enzalutamide and abiraterone; not a clear mismatch. Thus exactly one anchor match → B.

question_text: 55 year old male with metastatic urothelial carcinoma, now progressing after second line therapy. Initially diagnosed with MIBC 3 years ago. He received neoadjuvant gemcitabine/cisplatin x 4 cycles and then cystectomy with pCR. 6 months later he presented with new bone metastases. Biopsy confirmed metastatic urothelial cancer. trial_title: A Phase II Study of Olaparib (AZD2281) in Patients With Metastatic/Advanced Urothelial Carcinoma and Other Genitourinary Tumors With DNA-Repair Defects
inclusion_criteria: Histologically confirmed non-prostate genitourinary (GU) cancer | Presence of cancer-associated genetic mutations per FoundationOne CDx per cohort definitions or TMB >= 10 mut/Mb | Measurable disease per RECIST 1.1 | Evidence of disease progression during or after at least one platinum-based chemotherapy regimen and/or an immune-checkpoint inhibitor | Age >= 18 years | ECOG performance status <= 1 (or Karnofsky >= 70%) | Able to tolerate oral medications; no gastrointestinal condition precluding absorption of olaparib | Negative pregnancy test for women of childbearing potential at screening and within 3 days prior to day 1 | Use of effective contraception during treatment and for required period after last dose | Provision of archival tumor sample or willingness to undergo mandatory screening biopsy (or liquid biopsy if tissue unavailable)
exclusion_criteria: Prior treatment with olaparib or any PARP inhibitor | Myelodysplastic syndrome or acute myeloid leukemia, or baseline features suggestive of MDS/AML | Persistent toxicities >= CTCAE grade 2 from prior therapy (except alopecia or peripheral neuropathy) | Concurrent treatment with other investigational agents (per protocol during treatment phase) | Known brain metastases or spinal cord compression unless definitively treated and clinically stable for >= 28 days | Allergic reactions to compounds of similar chemical or biologic composition to olaparib | Current use of strong or moderate CYP3A inhibitors or inducers without adequate washout (>= 5 half-lives or 3 weeks, whichever is shorter) | Pregnancy or breastfeeding | Any chronic or concurrent acute liver disease | History of stroke, transient ischemic attack, or myocardial infarction within 6 months | Uncontrolled infection | Symptomatic congestive heart failure, unstable angina, or clinically significant cardiac arrhythmia | Unstable or untreated cardiac conditions or left ventricular ejection fraction < 50% | Uncontrolled diabetes mellitus | Psychiatric illness or social situation limiting compliance | Other severe medical or psychiatric condition or laboratory abnormality increasing risk or interfering with study | Immunocompromised state (e.g., HIV with detectable virus not on HAART) | Active hepatitis B or C infection | Other malignancy within 2 years except allowed low-risk cancers as specified | Systemic chemotherapy or radiotherapy (except palliative) within 2 weeks prior to study treatment | Major surgery within 2 weeks prior to starting study treatment without adequate recovery | Previous allogeneic bone marrow transplant or double umbilical cord blood transplantation
prior_therapies: Progression during or after at least one platinum-based chemotherapy regimen required; Prior treatment with an immune-checkpoint inhibitor (atezolizumab, pembrolizumab, nivolumab, avelumab, or durvalumab) allowed and may qualify; Washout from chemotherapy >= 2 weeks before study treatment; Washout from monoclonal antibody therapy >= 4 weeks before study treatment
reasoning: Disease and metastatic setting match the trial. However, required biomarker status (DNA-repair mutation or TMB ≥10) and confirmation of prior platinum/ICI exposure are unknown, preventing a higher confidence match.
patient_inclusion_criteria: (none)
judge_comment: No hard exclusions. Disease and metastatic setting match (1 anchor). Biomarker requirement (DNA repair defect or TMB ≥10) and required prior exposure to platinum and/or ICI are unknown, so no additional anchors can be counted. No soft mismatches identified. Grade B is appropriate per rubric.

prior_therapies: Cohort 1 requires prior anti–PD-(L)1 therapy; Cohort 1 allows up to 2 prior lines of systemic therapy; Cohort 2 prohibits prior anti–PD-(L)1 therapy; Cohort 2 allows only 1 prior line of systemic therapy; Neoadjuvant/adjuvant chemotherapy within 12 months of last dose counts as prior systemic therapy

question_text: 55 year old male with metastatic urothelial carcinoma, now progressing after second line therapy. Initially diagnosed with MIBC 3 years ago. trial_title: An Open-Label, Randomized Phase 3 Study to Evaluate Enfortumab Vedotin vs Chemotherapy in Subjects With Previously Treated Locally Advanced or Metastatic Urothelial Cancer (EV-301)
inclusion_criteria: Histologically or cytologically confirmed urothelial carcinoma of the bladder, renal pelvis, ureter, or urethra (including squamous differentiation or mixed types). | Radiographic progression or relapse during or after PD-1/PD-L1 checkpoint inhibitor for locally advanced or metastatic disease (progression after discontinuation due to toxicity allowed). | Received a platinum-containing regimen (cisplatin or carboplatin) in metastatic/locally advanced, neoadjuvant, or adjuvant setting; if adjuvant/neoadjuvant, progression within 12 months of completion. | Radiologically documented metastatic or locally advanced disease at baseline not amenable to curative resection. | ECOG 0–1. | ANC >= 1500/µL. | Platelet count >= 100000/µL. | Hemoglobin >= 9 g/dL. | Total bilirubin <= 1.5 x ULN (<= 3 x ULN with Gilbert's disease). | ALT <= 2.5 x ULN. | AST <= 2.5 x ULN. | Creatinine clearance >= 30 mL/min.
exclusion_criteria: Preexisting sensory or motor neuropathy grade >= 2. | Active central nervous system metastases (allowed if treated and clinically stable >= 6 weeks, no new or enlarged lesions, no leptomeningeal disease, and on <= 20 mg/day prednisone equivalent if steroids required). | Ongoing clinically significant toxicity grade >= 2 from prior therapy (except alopecia; <= grade 2 hypothyroidism or panhypopituitarism on replacement allowed). | Ongoing immunotherapy-related colitis, uveitis, or pneumonitis, or requirement for high-dose steroids > 20 mg/day prednisone equivalent. | Prior treatment with enfortumab vedotin or other MMAE-based antibody-drug conjugates. | Prior chemotherapy for urothelial cancer including all available control-arm agents (docetaxel and paclitaxel ± vinflunine depending on region). | More than 1 prior chemotherapy regimen for locally advanced or metastatic urothelial cancer (including adjuvant or neoadjuvant if recurrence within 12 months). | History of another malignancy within 3 years (exceptions include nonmelanoma skin cancer, certain localized prostate cancer, and carcinoma in situ completely resected). | Active systemic infection requiring antimicrobial therapy. | Active hepatitis B or active hepatitis C infection. | Known HIV infection. | Cerebrovascular event (stroke or TIA), unstable angina, myocardial infarction, or NYHA class III–IV heart failure within 6 months. | Radiotherapy or major surgery within 4 weeks before first dose. | Chemotherapy, biologics, investigational agents, or immunotherapy not completed >= 2 weeks before first dose. | Hypersensitivity to enfortumab vedotin or to biopharmaceuticals produced in CHO cells. | Hypersensitivity to docetaxel (including polysorbate 80), paclitaxel (including macrogolglycerol ricinoleate 35), or vinflunine (including other vinca alkaloids). | Active keratitis or corneal ulceration. | Other underlying medical condition that would impair ability to receive or tolerate treatment and follow-up. | Uncontrolled diabetes mellitus within 3 months (HbA1c >= 8% or HbA1c 7% to < 8% with polyuria or polydipsia).
prior_therapies: Prior PD-1/PD-L1 checkpoint inhibitor required for locally advanced or metastatic disease.; Prior platinum-containing regimen (cisplatin or carboplatin) required in metastatic/locally advanced, neoadjuvant, or adjuvant setting.; No more than 1 prior chemotherapy regimen for locally advanced or metastatic urothelial cancer.; Washout: radiotherapy or major surgery completed >= 4 weeks before first dose.; Washout: chemotherapy, biologics, investigational agents, or immunotherapy completed >= 2 weeks before first dose.
