trial_title: A Phase II Open-Label Study of Sacituzumab Govitecan in Unresectable Locally Advanced/Metastatic Urothelial Cancer
inclusion_criteria: Age >= 18 years | ECOG performance status 0–1 | Adequate renal and hepatic function | Adequate hematologic parameters without transfusional support | Life expectancy >= 3 months | Cohorts 4 and 6: Measurable disease by RECIST 1.1 | Cohorts 1, 2, 3, 5: Creatinine clearance >= 30 mL/min | Cohort 4: No prior platinum-based chemotherapy in the metastatic or unresectable locally advanced setting | Cohort 4: Creatinine clearance >= 50 mL/min; if receiving cisplatin 70 mg/m2 Day 1 q21d, creatinine clearance >= 60 mL/min; if creatinine clearance 50–59 mL/min, receive split-dose cisplatin | Cohorts 4, 5, 6, 7: Archival tumor tissue (muscle-invasive or metastatic urothelial carcinoma) or biopsy of metastatic urothelial carcinoma | Cohort 5: Completed 4–6 cycles of gemcitabine + cisplatin with CR/PR/SD and treatment-free interval of 4–10 weeks | Cohort 6: Cisplatin-ineligible; no prior therapy for metastatic or unresectable locally advanced disease; CPI-naive or >12 months from completion of adjuvant therapy | Cohort 7: No prior systemic therapy for locally advanced or metastatic urothelial cancer (recurrence >12 months after curative therapy allowed) | Cohort 7: Measurable disease by RECIST 1.1
exclusion_criteria: Pregnant or lactating | Active second malignancy | Known active hepatitis B or hepatitis C | Known active central nervous system metastases and/or carcinomatous meningitis | Other concurrent medical or psychiatric conditions that would preclude study participation | Prior anti-cancer monoclonal antibody within 4 weeks before Day 1 or unresolved > Grade 1 toxicities from prior therapy | Cohorts 3–6: Active autoimmune disease requiring systemic treatment in past 2 years | Cohorts 3–6: Receipt of a live vaccine within 30 days prior to first dose | Cohorts 3–6: History or evidence of interstitial lung disease or non-infectious pneumonitis | Cohort 3: Prior anti-PD-1/PD-L1 therapy | Cohort 4: Refractory to platinum in neoadjuvant/adjuvant setting (relapse <= 12 months after completion) | Cohorts 4, 5, 6: If prior checkpoint inhibitor, treatment-free interval must be >12 months between last dose and date of recurrence | Cohort 7: Prior anticancer therapy within 12 months before C1D1 or prior radiation within 2 weeks before C1D1 | Cohort 7: History of idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis, organizing pneumonia, drug-induced or idiopathic pneumonitis, or active pneumonitis on screening CT | Cohort 7: Child-Pugh class B or C hepatic impairment | Cohort 7: Uncontrolled diabetes | Cohort 7: Active keratitis or corneal ulcerations | Cohort 7: Ongoing sensory or motor neuropathy Grade >= 2
prior_therapies: Cohort 1: Prior platinum-containing therapy and prior anti-PD-1/PD-L1 therapy with progression/recurrence; Cohort 2: Platinum-ineligible for first-line metastatic disease and progression after first-line anti-PD-1/PD-L1 therapy; no prior platinum for recurrent/metastatic/advanced disease; Cohort 3: Prior platinum-containing therapy with progression/recurrence; Cohort 4: No prior platinum-based chemotherapy in the metastatic or unresectable locally advanced setting; Cohort 5: Completed 4–6 cycles of gemcitabine + cisplatin without progressive disease; Cohort 6: No prior therapy for metastatic or unresectable locally advanced disease; CPI-naive or >12 months since completion of adjuvant therapy; Cohort 7: No prior systemic therapy for locally advanced or metastatic disease (curative-intent therapy allowed if recurrence >12 months)
reasoning: Disease and metastatic setting match, and age/sex fit. However, cohort eligibility hinges on specific prior therapies (e.g., prior platinum and PD-1/PD-L1 for Cohort 1), which are not provided, so line-of-therapy/prior-exposure compatibility is uncertain.
patient_inclusion_criteria: (none)
judge_comment: No hard exclusions. Disease and metastatic setting match (1 core anchor). Line/prior-exposure compatibility is unknown due to missing prior therapy details; no soft conflicts identified. Therefore B per rubric.

question_text: 40 year old man with recurrent glioblastoma. Diagnosed 1 year ago, underwent gross total resection with confirmation of GBM, IDH wildtype. Completed adjuvant radiation + concurrent temozolomide and then adjuvant temozolomide. Three months after completing adjuvant therapy, MRI shows recurrence. ECOG 1 and no other medical issues. What are trial options?
trial_title: A Phase 1 Study to Evaluate IL13Rα2-Targeted Chimeric Antigen Receptor (CAR) T Cells Combined With Checkpoint Inhibition for Patients With Resectable Recurrent Glioblastoma
inclusion_criteria: Age >= 18 years | ECOG <= 2 | Karnofsky >= 60% | Life expectancy >= 4 weeks | Histologically confirmed WHO grade IV glioblastoma or prior grade II/III glioma with progression consistent with grade IV glioblastoma after standard therapy | Relapsed/refractory measurable disease after standard therapy | >= 12 weeks after completion of front-line radiation therapy | IL13Ralpha2-positive tumor by IHC (H-score > 50) | WBC > 2000/µL or ANC >= 1000/µL (within 14 days prior to leukapheresis) | Platelets >= 75000/µL | Fasting blood glucose within ULN | Total bilirubin <= 1.5 x ULN | AST <= 2.5 x ULN | ALT <= 2.5 x ULN | Serum creatinine <= 1.6 mg/dL | Oxygen saturation >= 95% on room air | Seronegative for HIV Ag/Ab combo | Hepatitis C antibody negative or, if positive, HCV RNA negative | Hepatitis B surface antigen negative | Hepatitis A virus IgM antibody negative | Women of childbearing potential: negative pregnancy test | Agreement to use effective contraception during study and for at least 5 months after last nivolumab dose and/or 3 months after last CAR T cell cycle
exclusion_criteria: Prior CTLA-4, PD-1, or PD-L1 inhibitor therapy | Steroid-dependent requiring > 6 mg dexamethasone per day at enrollment | Unresolved toxicities from prior therapy | History of or active autoimmune disease | Uncontrolled seizure activity or clinically evident progressive encephalopathy | History of allergic reactions to compounds similar to study agents | Active diarrhea | Clinically significant uncontrolled illness | Active infection requiring antibiotics | Known HIV, hepatitis B, or hepatitis C infection | Other active malignancy | Pregnant or breastfeeding | Any condition that contraindicates participation due to safety concerns per investigator | Inability to comply with study procedures
prior_therapies: Completed standard therapy for glioblastoma; Radiographic progression after standard therapy; At least 12 weeks since completion of front-line radiation therapy
reasoning: Disease and post-standard therapy setting match (recurrent GBM, PD-1–naïve), but the trial requires IL13Rα2-positive tumor and resectable recurrence (and ≥12 weeks since frontline RT), which are not documented, preventing a higher grade.
patient_inclusion_criteria: Age 40 years; Male; Recurrent glioblastoma; IDH wildtype; Status post gross total resection; Completed radiation with concurrent temozolomide and adjuvant temozolomide; ECOG 1; No other medical issues
patient_prior_therapies: Gross total resection; Adjuvant radiation with concurrent temozolomide; Adjuvant temozolomide
judge_comment: No hard exclusions. Disease matches. Line/prior-exposure fits (post-standard therapy, PD-1–naïve). Stage/setting resectability is unknown, and required IL13Rα2 biomarker is unknown, so only one core anchor clearly matches. That supports a B. Grader’s reasoning aligns with the rubric.

question_text: 55 year old male with metastatic urothelial carcinoma, now progressing after second line therapy. Initially diagnosed with MIBC 3 years ago. He received neoadjuvant gemcitabine/cisplatin x 4 cycles and then cystectomy with pCR. 6 months later he presented with new bone metastases. Biopsy confirmed metastatic urothelial cancer. He was started on EV+pembrolizumab and after 6 cycles, scans showed worsening osseous mets and now new liver lesions. He has a hx of T2DM, COPD, and CKD with eGFR 35. What are trial options?
trial_title: DS3201 With Ipilimumab in Patients With Metastatic Aggressive Variant Prostate (AVPC), Urothelial (UC), and Renal Cell (RCC) Carcinomas
diseases_targeted: Aggressive Variant Prostate Carcinoma; Castration-Resistant Prostate Carcinoma; Metastatic Urothelial Carcinoma; Metastatic Clear Cell Renal Cell Carcinoma
inclusion_criteria: ECOG performance status 0-1 | Histologically or cytologically confirmed prostate carcinoma, urothelial carcinoma, or clear cell renal cell carcinoma; variant prostate histologies (small cell/neuroendocrine) permitted | Metastatic disease by CT/MRI and/or bone scan, or locally advanced not amenable to locoregional therapy | Prostate carcinoma: castration-resistant disease and maintain castrate testosterone (<= 50 ng/dL or <= 2.0 nM) throughout the study; small cell histology exempt from progression on prior ADT but must maintain castrate levels | Aggressive variant prostate carcinoma requires molecular signature: loss or mutation in at least 2 of TP53, RB1, PTEN by CLIA-certified testing | Renal cell carcinoma: progressive disease during or after at least one anti-angiogenic agent and one PD-1 or PD-L1 inhibitor | Urothelial carcinoma: progressive disease during or after at least one PD-1 or PD-L1 inhibitor and prior platinum chemotherapy or platinum-ineligible | AVPC patients may have received prior PD-1 or PD-L1 inhibitor but not required | Evidence of disease progression by RECIST; for AVPC, rising PSA per PCWG3 may qualify if AVPC molecular criteria met | Known brain metastases allowed if stable >= 4 weeks after local therapy, off steroids or on stable/decreasing dose <= 10 mg prednisone equivalent daily, and without confounding neurologic dysfunction | Recovery from prior surgery, radiotherapy, chemotherapy, or other anti-cancer therapy to baseline or <= grade 1 (other low-grade toxicities may be allowed if clinically insignificant) | Ability to swallow and retain oral medications | Disease site accessible for serial biopsies
exclusion_criteria: Pregnant or lactating | Carcinomatous meningitis | Prior treatment with an EZH2 inhibitor | PD-1, PD-L1, PD-L2, or CTLA-4 inhibitor within 4 weeks prior to day 1 | Monoclonal antibody within 4 weeks prior to day 1 | Investigational drug within 2 weeks prior to day 1 | Chemotherapy within 2 weeks prior to day 1 | Radiation therapy or radionuclide therapy within 2 weeks prior to day 1 | Receipt of live virus vaccine within 30 days prior to day 1 | Untreated symptomatic spinal cord compression or brain metastases | History of immune-related adverse event leading to permanent discontinuation of prior immunotherapy | History of >= grade 3 immune-related adverse event within past 16 weeks, any grade 4 life-threatening irAE, or neurologic/ocular irAE of any grade with prior immunotherapy (endocrine AEs allowed if on stable replacement, no adrenal crisis, asymptomatic) | Active, known, or suspected autoimmune disease (exceptions: vitiligo, type 1 diabetes, residual hypothyroidism on replacement, psoriasis/eczema not requiring systemic treatment, or conditions not expected to recur) | Requires chronic systemic corticosteroids > 10 mg prednisone equivalents daily or other immunosuppressive medications (physiologic adrenal replacement > 10 mg allowed without active autoimmune disease; inhaled/intranasal/intra-articular/topical allowed) | History of interstitial lung disease, idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis, or active pneumonitis on screening CT | Clinically significant cardiovascular disease: MI or stroke within 6 months; unstable angina within 3 months; CHF NYHA class 3-4; clinically significant ventricular arrhythmias; uncontrolled hypertension (SBP >= 140 mmHg or DBP >= 90 mmHg); baseline ECG abnormalities including QTc > 470 msec, complete LBBB, ischemic ST-T changes, second- or third-degree AV block, or serious brady-/tachyarrhythmias | Active hepatitis B (positive HBsAg) or active hepatitis C (detectable HCV RNA) | Known HIV infection | Gastrointestinal disorder that negatively affects absorption (e.g., short bowel syndrome, severe diarrhea, TPN requirement) | Additional malignancy that is progressing, requires active treatment, or has >= 30% probability of recurrence within 24 months (exceptions: non-melanoma skin cancer after curative therapy, Ta urothelial carcinoma, stage 0 CLL) | Any other severe/uncontrolled medical condition that could compromise participation | Unwilling or unable to comply with the study protocol
prior_therapies: Renal cell carcinoma: prior treatment with at least one anti-angiogenic agent; Renal cell carcinoma: prior treatment with a PD-1 or PD-L1 inhibitor; Urothelial carcinoma: prior treatment with a PD-1 or PD-L1 inhibitor; Urothelial carcinoma: prior platinum-based chemotherapy or platinum-ineligible; Prostate cancer: maintain castrate testosterone during study; Washout: PD-1/PD-L1/PD-L2 or CTLA-4 inhibitors within 4 weeks prior to day 1 not allowed; Washout: monoclonal antibody within 4 weeks prior to day 1 not allowed; Washout: investigational drug within 2 weeks prior to day 1 not allowed; Washout: chemotherapy within 2 weeks prior to day 1 not allowed; Washout: radiation or radionuclide therapy within 2 weeks prior to day 1 not allowed
reasoning: Disease and metastatic setting match, and age/sex fit. However, the trial requires prior PD-1/PD-L1 therapy and prior platinum chemotherapy or platinum-ineligible status for urothelial carcinoma, which are not specified for the patient, so prior-exposure compatibility is uncertain.
patient_inclusion_criteria: (none)
judge_comment: No hard exclusions apply. Disease and metastatic setting match (1 core anchor). Prior-exposure requirements (PD-1 and platinum/platinum-ineligible) are unknown, not a mismatch. Other anchors are not applicable/unknown. Exactly one anchor match with no soft conflicts → Grade B. Grader’s reasoning aligns with the rubric.

question_text: What are trial options for a 66 year old male with hx hypertension, afib, T2DM and mCRPC, now progressing on enzalutamide? He has been on Lupron+Zytiga for 3 years, with new liver and bone metastases which are all PSMA PET avid. He’s tolerated therapy well overall except for grade 2 fatigue.
trial_title: DS3201 With Ipilimumab in Patients With Metastatic Aggressive Variant Prostate (AVPC), Urothelial (UC), and Renal Cell (RCC) Carcinomas
diseases_targeted: Aggressive Variant Prostate Carcinoma; Castration-Resistant Prostate Carcinoma; Metastatic Urothelial Carcinoma; Metastatic Clear Cell Renal Cell Carcinoma
inclusion_criteria: ECOG performance status 0-1 | Histologically or cytologically confirmed prostate carcinoma, urothelial carcinoma, or clear cell renal cell carcinoma; variant prostate histologies (small cell/neuroendocrine) permitted | Metastatic disease by CT/MRI and/or bone scan, or locally advanced not amenable to locoregional therapy | Prostate carcinoma: castration-resistant disease and maintain castrate testosterone (<= 50 ng/dL or <= 2.0 nM) throughout the study; small cell histology exempt from progression on prior ADT but must maintain castrate levels | Aggressive variant prostate carcinoma requires molecular signature: loss or mutation in at least 2 of TP53, RB1, PTEN by CLIA-certified testing | Renal cell carcinoma: progressive disease during or after at least one anti-angiogenic agent and one PD-1 or PD-L1 inhibitor | Urothelial carcinoma: progressive disease during or after at least one PD-1 or PD-L1 inhibitor and prior platinum chemotherapy or platinum-ineligible | AVPC patients may have received prior PD-1 or PD-L1 inhibitor but not required | Evidence of disease progression by RECIST; for AVPC, rising PSA per PCWG3 may qualify if AVPC molecular criteria met | Known brain metastases allowed if stable >= 4 weeks after local therapy, off steroids or on stable/decreasing dose <= 10 mg prednisone equivalent daily, and without confounding neurologic dysfunction | Recovery from prior surgery, radiotherapy, chemotherapy, or other anti-cancer therapy to baseline or <= grade 1 (other low-grade toxicities may be allowed if clinically insignificant) | Ability to swallow and retain oral medications | Disease site accessible for serial biopsies
exclusion_criteria: Pregnant or lactating | Carcinomatous meningitis | Prior treatment with an EZH2 inhibitor | PD-1, PD-L1, PD-L2, or CTLA-4 inhibitor within 4 weeks prior to day 1 | Monoclonal antibody within 4 weeks prior to day 1 | Investigational drug within 2 weeks prior to day 1 | Chemotherapy within 2 weeks prior to day 1 | Radiation therapy or radionuclide therapy within 2 weeks prior to day 1 | Receipt of live virus vaccine within 30 days prior to day 1 | Untreated symptomatic spinal cord compression or brain metastases | History of immune-related adverse event leading to permanent discontinuation of prior immunotherapy | History of >= grade 3 immune-related adverse event within past 16 weeks, any grade 4 life-threatening irAE, or neurologic/ocular irAE of any grade with prior immunotherapy (endocrine AEs allowed if on stable replacement, no adrenal crisis, asymptomatic) | Active, known, or suspected autoimmune disease (exceptions: vitiligo, type 1 diabetes, residual hypothyroidism on replacement, psoriasis/eczema not requiring systemic treatment, or conditions not expected to recur) | Requires chronic systemic corticosteroids > 10 mg prednisone equivalents daily or other immunosuppressive medications (physiologic adrenal replacement > 10 mg allowed without active autoimmune disease; inhaled/intranasal/intra-articular/topical allowed) | History of interstitial lung disease, idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis, or active pneumonitis on screening CT | Clinically significant cardiovascular disease: MI or stroke within 6 months; unstable angina within 3 months; CHF NYHA class 3-4; clinically significant ventricular arrhythmias; uncontrolled hypertension (SBP >= 140 mmHg or DBP >= 90 mmHg); baseline ECG abnormalities including QTc > 470 msec, complete LBBB, ischemic ST-T changes, second- or third-degree AV block, or serious brady-/tachyarrhythmias | Active hepatitis B (positive HBsAg) or active hepatitis C (detectable HCV RNA) | Known HIV infection | Gastrointestinal disorder that negatively affects absorption (e.g., short bowel syndrome, severe diarrhea, TPN requirement) | Additional malignancy that is progressing, requires active treatment, or has >= 30% probability of recurrence within 24 months (exceptions: non-melanoma skin cancer after curative therapy, Ta urothelial carcinoma, stage 0 CLL) | Any other severe/uncontrolled medical condition that could compromise participation | Unwilling or unable to comply with the study protocol
prior_therapies: Renal cell carcinoma: prior treatment with at least one anti-angiogenic agent; Renal cell carcinoma: prior treatment with a PD-1 or PD-L1 inhibitor; Urothelial carcinoma: prior treatment with a PD-1 or PD-L1 inhibitor; Urothelial carcinoma: prior platinum-based chemotherapy or platinum-ineligible; Prostate cancer: maintain castrate testosterone during study; Washout: PD-1/PD-L1/PD-L2 or CTLA-4 inhibitors within 4 weeks prior to day 1 not allowed; Washout: monoclonal antibody within 4 weeks prior to day 1 not allowed; Washout: investigational drug within 2 weeks prior to day 1 not allowed; Washout: chemotherapy within 2 weeks prior to day 1 not allowed; Washout: radiation or radionuclide therapy within 2 weeks prior to day 1 not allowed
reasoning: Disease and stage/setting match (metastatic castration-resistant prostate cancer). However, the trial’s prostate cohort appears to require AVPC molecular criteria (loss/mutation in ≥2 of TP53/RB1/PTEN), which are not documented for the patient, so key eligibility remains uncertain; no explicit exclusions identified.
patient_inclusion_criteria: Age 66 years; Male sex; Metastatic castration-resistant prostate cancer; Progression on enzalutamide; PSMA PET avid liver and bone metastases
patient_prior_therapies: Progression on enzalutamide; Prior abiraterone (Zytiga) with leuprolide (Lupron) for 3 years
judge_comment: No hard exclusions. Disease matches (CRPC cohort exists). Stage/setting matches (metastatic) and prior exposure/line are compatible (AR-targeted therapies allowed; no disallowed exposures). AVPC molecular signature is only required for the AVPC subset, not universally; its absence/unknown should not penalize. With ≥2 core anchors (stage and line) matched and no soft conflicts, rubric dictates A, not B.

question_text: I have a 40 year old patient with non-smallcell lung cancer. Diagnosed de novo metastatic disease (bone, liver) with EGFR exon 19 deletion. He has been on Osimertinib for 2 years with complete response. Unfortunately, began having headaches and recent MRI shows numerous lesions. Otherwise no past medical issues and ECOG 0. Are there any trial options?
trial_title: A Phase 1/2 Dose Escalation/Expansion Study of NGM707 As Monotherapy and in Combination with Pembrolizumab in Advanced or Metastatic Solid Tumor Malignancies
diseases_targeted: Breast Cancer; Cervical Cancer; Cholangiocarcinoma; Colorectal Cancer; Endocervical Cancer; Esophageal Cancer; Gastric Cancer; Glioblastoma; Melanoma; Mesothelioma; Non Small Cell Lung Cancer; Ovarian Cancer; Pancreatic Ductal Adenocarcinoma; Renal Cell Carcinoma; Squamous Cell Carcinoma of Head and Neck
inclusion_criteria: Histologically or cytologically confirmed locally advanced or metastatic solid tumor malignancy. | Progressed on or was intolerant to all available therapies known to confer clinical benefit appropriate for the tumor type, or refused standard-of-care treatments perceived to have marginal clinical benefit. | Adequate bone marrow, kidney, and liver function. | Performance status 0 or 1. | Acute effects of prior therapy resolved to baseline or CTCAE Grade 1 (except AEs not constituting a safety risk by investigator judgment).
exclusion_criteria: Prior treatment targeting ILT2 and/or ILT4 or targeting HLA-G.
prior_therapies: Received and progressed on or were intolerant to prior standard therapies known to confer clinical benefit for their tumor type.; Refusal of standard-of-care treatments perceived to have marginal clinical benefit is allowed.; Acute toxicities from prior therapy resolved to baseline or <= Grade 1 before enrollment.
reasoning: Disease and stage match (metastatic NSCLC), and age/ECOG fit; no exclusion for prior anti-ILT/HLA-G therapy applies. However, eligibility requires progression on or intolerance to all standard therapies for NSCLC, which is unclear since only prior osimertinib is documented, making line-of-therapy status uncertain.
patient_inclusion_criteria: Non-small cell lung cancer; De novo metastatic disease (bone, liver); EGFR exon 19 deletion; ECOG 0; Age 40 years
judge_comment: No hard exclusions. Disease and metastatic setting match. Line/prior-therapy requirement (progressed on all available SOC) is unknown, not a clear mismatch. With exactly one core anchor match and no soft conflicts, B is appropriate per rubric.

question_text: 55 year old male with metastatic urothelial carcinoma, now progressing after second line therapy. Initially diagnosed with MIBC 3 years ago. He received neoadjuvant gemcitabine/cisplatin x 4 cycles and then cystectomy with pCR. 6 months later he presented with new bone metastases. Biopsy confirmed metastatic urothelial cancer. He was started on EV+pembrolizumab and after 6 cycles, scans showed worsening osseous mets and now new liver lesions. He has a hx of T2DM, COPD, and CKD with eGFR 35. What are trial options?
trial_title: A Phase II Clinical Trial to Investigate ARID1A and/or KDM6A Mutation and CXCL13 Expression in the Pre-treatment Tumor Samples as a Combinatorial Predictive Biomarker for Immune Checkpoint Therapy in Metastatic Urothelial Cancer
inclusion_criteria: Tumor harboring ARID1A and/or KDM6A mutation. | Histologic or cytologic evidence of metastatic or surgically unresectable urothelial carcinoma of bladder, urethra, ureter, or renal pelvis; minor variants < 50% allowed. | Progression or recurrence after at least 1 platinum-containing chemotherapy regimen for metastatic or unresectable disease, or ineligible/refused frontline chemotherapy. | Measurable disease by CT or MRI per RECIST 1.1. | Evaluable tumor tissue (archival or new biopsy) available for biomarker analysis. | ECOG performance status 0–1. | Prior palliative radiotherapy completed >= 2 weeks before study drug; progression in previously radiated field allowed. | Adequate hematologic, hepatic, renal function per protocol laboratory thresholds. | Participation in protocol PA13-0291 with consent for biopsy and peripheral blood collection. | Females of childbearing potential: agree to contraception during treatment and for 5 months after last dose; negative pregnancy test within 24 hours prior to start. | Males sexually active with FCBP: agree to contraception during treatment; refrain from sperm donation.
exclusion_criteria: Prior treatment with anti-PD-1, anti-PD-L1, anti-CTLA-4, or other agents targeting T-cell co-stimulation or immune checkpoints. | Active brain or leptomeningeal metastases unless treated and stable >= 4 weeks and off immunosuppressive corticosteroids (> 10 mg/day prednisone equivalents) for >= 2 weeks. | Serious or uncontrolled medical disorder that may increase risk or interfere with study treatment or interpretation. | Active malignancy within 3 years except for locally curable cancers (e.g., basal or squamous cell skin cancer, carcinoma in situ) or prostate cancer without PSA progression. | Active, known, or suspected autoimmune disease except allowed conditions (e.g., vitiligo, type I diabetes, residual hypothyroidism on replacement, psoriasis not requiring systemic therapy). | Systemic corticosteroids > 10 mg/day prednisone equivalents or other immunosuppressive medications within 14 days prior to study drug (except inhaled/topical or adrenal replacement). | Unresolved toxicities from prior therapy > Grade 1 (CTCAE v5) except alopecia, fatigue, and neuropathy (neuropathy must be <= Grade 2). | Chemotherapy, radiation therapy, biologics for cancer, or investigational therapy within 14 days or 5 half-lives (whichever is shorter) before first dose. | Positive test for HBV surface antigen or for HCV RNA/antibody indicating acute or chronic infection. | Known HIV infection or AIDS.
prior_therapies: Progression or recurrence after at least 1 prior platinum-containing chemotherapy regimen for metastatic or unresectable urothelial carcinoma, or ineligible/refused frontline chemotherapy.; Prior palliative radiotherapy allowed if completed >= 2 weeks before study drug.; Washout required: no chemotherapy, radiation, biologics, or investigational therapy within 14 days or 5 half-lives before first dose (whichever is shorter).
reasoning: Disease and metastatic setting match, and age/sex are eligible. However, required ARID1A/KDM6A mutation status, prior platinum exposure, and absence of prior checkpoint inhibitor therapy are not documented, so only one core anchor is confirmed.
patient_inclusion_criteria: (none)
judge_comment: No hard exclusions apply. Disease and metastatic setting match (1 core anchor). Prior platinum, checkpoint-naivety, and required ARID1A/KDM6A mutation are unknown, so other anchors are not confirmed and no soft mismatch is identified. Therefore B is appropriate.

question_text: What are trial options for a 66 year old male with hx hypertension, afib, T2DM and mCRPC, now progressing on enzalutamide? He has been on Lupron+Zytiga for 3 years, with new liver and bone metastases which are all PSMA PET avid. He’s tolerated therapy well overall except for grade 2 fatigue.
trial_title: Phase I/II First-in-Human Study of TT-10 (PORT-6), an Adenosine 2A Receptor Antagonist, and PORT-7, an Adenosine 2B Receptor Antagonist, as Single Agents and in Combination in Participants With Advanced Selected Solid Tumors
diseases_targeted: Castrate-Resistant Prostate Cancer; Colorectal Cancer; Endometrial Cancer; Head and Neck Squamous Cell Carcinoma; Non-Small Cell Lung Cancer; Ovarian Cancer; Renal Cell Carcinoma
inclusion_criteria: Histologically or cytologically confirmed advanced solid tumors per cohort definitions | RCC: locally advanced or metastatic with >=2 prior systemic regimens including VEGF-targeted therapy and checkpoint inhibitor therapy | CRPC: metastatic disease with prior second-generation hormonal agent and a taxane-based chemotherapy | SCCHN: advanced/metastatic, incurable by surgery or radiotherapy, progressed during/after platinum-based chemotherapy and/or checkpoint inhibitor therapy | NSCLC: metastatic, intolerant or resistant to standard therapy or no standard therapy available | CRC: metastatic, intolerant or resistant to standard therapy or no standard therapy available | Endometrial Cancer: metastatic, intolerant or resistant to standard therapy or no standard therapy available | Ovarian Cancer: metastatic, intolerant or resistant to standard therapy or no standard therapy available | ECOG 0–1 | Measurable disease per RECIST 1.1; CRPC may enroll with non-measurable disease if screening PSA >= 2.0 ng/mL with sponsor approval | Adequate hematologic, hepatic, and renal function | Consent to baseline biopsy or provision of recent archival tissue as specified | Able to swallow capsules
exclusion_criteria: Major surgery within 4 weeks prior to screening | Active CNS metastases; treated/stable off corticosteroids allowed; leptomeningeal metastases excluded | Prior radiotherapy within 2 weeks of start; 1-week washout permitted for palliative radiotherapy (<= 2 weeks) to non-CNS disease | Prior anti-cancer therapy within 4 weeks (2 weeks for short-acting TKIs); unresolved treatment-related toxicities > Grade 1 | HIV infection | HBsAg positive unless on antiviral therapy >= 4 weeks with undetectable HBV viral load; must remain on therapy per guidelines | History of HCV infection unless curatively treated with undetectable viral load at screening | Requires immunosuppressive therapy including systemic steroids >= 10 mg prednisone equivalent daily or other immunosuppressants/biologics | Requires strong inhibitors or inducers of CYP3A4, CYP2C9, or CYP2C19 | Requires drugs that modify gastric pH (PPIs or H2 blockers); antacids allowed with dose separation | Ongoing systemic bacterial, fungal, or viral infection | Live vaccine within 6 weeks of first dose (mRNA COVID-19 vaccines permitted) | Baseline QTcF > 470 ms (average of triplicate) | Prior surgery or gastrointestinal dysfunction that may affect drug absorption (e.g., gastric bypass, gastrectomy) | Pregnant or breastfeeding | Concurrent active malignancy other than non-melanoma skin cancer, carcinoma in situ of the cervix, or prostate intraepithelial neoplasia | Past medical history of interstitial lung disease, drug-induced interstitial lung disease, or radiation pneumonitis requiring steroids; or clinically active interstitial lung disease | History of peptic ulcer or gastrointestinal bleed within 6 months | History of stroke, unstable angina, myocardial infarction, or ventricular arrhythmia requiring treatment within 6 months | Unstable or severe uncontrolled medical condition that increases study risk
prior_therapies: RCC: prior >= 2 systemic regimens including VEGF-targeted therapy and checkpoint inhibitor therapy; CRPC: prior second-generation hormonal therapy and taxane-based chemotherapy; SCCHN: prior platinum-based chemotherapy and/or checkpoint inhibitor with progression; NSCLC/CRC/Endometrial/Ovarian Cancer: intolerant or resistant to standard therapy or no standard therapy available; Washout from prior anti-cancer therapy >= 4 weeks (>= 2 weeks for short-acting TKIs) before start; Washout from radiotherapy >= 2 weeks (>= 1 week for short palliative courses <= 2 weeks)
reasoning: Disease and metastatic setting match the CRPC cohort, and sex/age fit. However, the trial requires prior taxane-based chemotherapy for CRPC, which is not documented for this patient, making line-of-therapy eligibility uncertain (other criteria like ECOG, labs, and concomitant meds are also unspecified).
patient_inclusion_criteria: Age 66 years; Male sex; Metastatic castration-resistant prostate cancer; Progression on enzalutamide; PSMA PET avid liver and bone metastases
patient_prior_therapies: Progression on enzalutamide; Prior abiraterone (Zytiga) with leuprolide (Lupron) for 3 years
judge_comment: No hard exclusions. Disease matches CRPC; stage/setting matches (metastatic). Metastatic pattern constraint is satisfied (no CNS mets where active CNS is excluded). Line/prior exposure (taxane) is unknown, not a soft mismatch. Thus ≥2 core anchors match with no soft conflicts → A. The grader’s B undercounts anchors.

question_text: I have a 40 year old patient with non-smallcell lung cancer. Diagnosed de novo metastatic disease (bone, liver) with EGFR exon 19 deletion. He has been on Osimertinib for 2 years with complete response. Unfortunately, began having headaches and recent MRI shows numerous lesions. Otherwise no past medical issues and ECOG 0. Are there any trial options?
trial_title: A PHASE 1, OPEN-LABEL, DOSE ESCALATION AND DOSE EXPANSION STUDY TO EVALUATE THE SAFETY, TOLERABILITY, PHARMACOKINETICS, AND ANTI TUMOR ACTIVITY OF PF-07799933 (ARRY-440) AS A SINGLE AGENT AND IN COMBINATION THERAPY IN PARTICIPANTS 16 YEARS AND OLDER WITH ADVANCED SOLID TUMORS WITH BRAF ALTERATIONS
diseases_targeted: Glioma; Melanoma; Non-Small-Cell Lung Cancer; Thyroid Cancer
inclusion_criteria: Advanced or metastatic solid tumor, including primary brain tumor | Qualifying BRAF alteration: V600 or non-V600 Class II/Class III in tumor tissue and/or ctDNA | Disease progression during or after last prior treatment with no satisfactory alternative options (Parts 1 and 2) | Tumor-specific cohorts (melanoma, colorectal cancer) must have received prior approved therapies
exclusion_criteria: Brain metastasis >4 cm | Ongoing systemic anti-cancer therapy or small molecule therapeutics at start of study treatment | History or current evidence of retinal vein occlusion (for participants who may receive binimetinib) | Concurrent neuromuscular disorder associated with elevated creatine kinase (for participants who may receive binimetinib)
prior_therapies: Progression on or after prior therapy required (Parts 1–2); Prior approved therapies required for melanoma and colorectal cancer cohorts
reasoning: Disease and stage match (metastatic NSCLC; age/sex eligible). However, the trial requires a qualifying BRAF alteration and progression after prior therapy, which are not documented for this patient, so only one core anchor clearly matches.
patient_inclusion_criteria: Non-small cell lung cancer; De novo metastatic disease (bone, liver); EGFR exon 19 deletion; ECOG 0; Age 40 years

exclusion_criteria: Known diabetes mellitus or fasting glucose > 126 mg/dL or random glucose > 140 mg/dL | Current use of metformin, sulfonylureas, thiazolidinediones, or insulin | Use of other investigational agents | Comorbidities with expected survival < 2 years unrelated to ovarian cancer | Concurrent active invasive malignancy or prior malignancy with > 30% risk of recurrence within 2 years | Allergy to metformin or compounds of similar composition | NYHA class III or IV heart failure | History of any acidosis | Alcoholic liver disease | Habitual intake of >= 3 alcoholic beverages per day | Uncontrolled intercurrent illness (e.g., active major infection, unstable angina, symptomatic CHF, significant arrhythmia, psychiatric illness limiting compliance) | Pregnant or nursing | Mucinous adenocarcinoma or borderline tumors | Planned intraperitoneal chemotherapy | Neoadjuvant chemotherapy without planned interval debulking surgery (assuming adequate response) | Planned chemotherapy regimens not specified in the protocol | Participation in other interventional trials to reduce ovarian cancer recurrence or planned off-protocol maintenance therapy (e.g., paclitaxel or bevacizumab)

reasoning: Disease and age/sex match, but the trial is for newly diagnosed stage III–IV patients starting first-line chemotherapy (with gross residual disease or planned interval debulking), whereas this patient has recurrent disease after prior debulking and adjuvant carboplatin/paclitaxel/bevacizumab; thus stage/setting and prior-therapy requirements are not met.
patient_inclusion_criteria: Stage III clear cell ovarian carcinoma; Cytology-positive pleural effusion; BRCA1 positive; Female; Age 36 years
patient_prior_therapies: Optimal debulking surgery; Adjuvant carboplatin plus paclitaxel plus bevacizumab
judge_comment: No hard exclusions apply. Disease, sex, and age match, but there is a clear soft mismatch on stage/setting (trial is for newly diagnosed first-line advanced disease) and line/prior exposure (patient is recurrent post adjuvant chemo ± bevacizumab). Per rubric, any clear soft mismatch on a core anchor → D.

question_text: What are trial options for a 66 year old male with hx hypertension, afib, T2DM and mCRPC, now progressing on enzalutamide? He has been on Lupron+Zytiga for 3 years, with new liver and bone metastases which are all PSMA PET avid. He’s tolerated therapy well overall except for grade 2 fatigue.
trial_title: A Phase 1, Open-Label, Dose-Escalation Study Evaluating the Safety, Pharmacokinetics, and Clinical Effects of Intravenously Administered PT-112 Injection in Subjects With Advanced Solid Tumors and Subsequent Dose Expansion Cohorts
inclusion_criteria: Male >= 18 years of age | Histologically or cytologically confirmed adenocarcinoma of the prostate | Metastatic castration-resistant prostate cancer with documented metastatic lesions on bone scan or CT/MRI | Received at least three prior intended life-prolonging therapies for metastatic disease | ECOG 0-1 | Progressive disease by RECIST v1.1 or PCWG3 or by informative tumor markers | Adequate organ function | If known history of brain metastases, disease must be stable
exclusion_criteria: Cytotoxic chemotherapy within 21 days prior to initiation of study drug | Immunomodulatory drug therapy within 14 days prior to initiation of study drug | Anti-neoplastic hormonal therapy within 14 days prior to initiation of study drug | Immunosuppressive therapy within 14 days prior to initiation of study drug | Corticosteroids within 14 days prior to initiation of study drug | Growth factor treatment within 14 days prior to initiation of study drug | Inadequate bone marrow reserve | Radiotherapy within 14 days prior to baseline | Radiotherapy to >25% of active bone marrow | Major surgery within 28 days prior to initiation of study drug
prior_therapies: At least three prior intended life-prolonging therapies for metastatic disease; Washout: cytotoxic chemotherapy >= 21 days before study drug; Washout: immunomodulatory drugs >= 14 days before study drug; Washout: anti-neoplastic hormonal therapy >= 14 days before study drug; Washout: immunosuppressive therapy >= 14 days before study drug; Washout: corticosteroids >= 14 days before study drug; Washout: growth factors >= 14 days before study drug; Washout: radiotherapy >= 14 days before baseline; Washout: major surgery >= 28 days before study drug
reasoning: Stage and disease match (male, mCRPC with progression), but the trial requires at least three prior life-prolonging therapies for metastatic disease and only enzalutamide and abiraterone are documented. Other criteria (washouts, ECOG, imaging modality) are unknown.
patient_inclusion_criteria: Age 66 years; Male sex; Metastatic castration-resistant prostate cancer; Progression on enzalutamide; PSMA PET avid liver and bone metastases
patient_prior_therapies: Progression on enzalutamide; Prior abiraterone (Zytiga) with leuprolide (Lupron) for 3 years
judge_comment: No hard exclusions. Disease and stage match (mCRPC, male, age OK). Clear soft mismatch on line-of-therapy: trial requires ≥3 prior life-prolonging therapies; patient has only two documented (abiraterone and enzalutamide). Per rubric, a soft mismatch on a core anchor → D.

question_text: 55 year old male with metastatic urothelial carcinoma, now progressing after second line therapy. Initially diagnosed with MIBC 3 years ago. He received neoadjuvant gemcitabine/cisplatin x 4 cycles and then cystectomy with pCR. 6 months later he presented with new bone metastases. Biopsy confirmed metastatic urothelial cancer. He was started on EV+pembrolizumab and after 6 cycles, scans showed worsening osseous mets and now new liver lesions. He has a hx of T2DM, COPD, and CKD with eGFR 35. What are trial options?
trial_title: A Phase 3, Open-label, Randomized Study of Nivolumab Combined With Ipilimumab, or With Standard of Care Chemotherapy, Versus Standard of Care Chemotherapy in Participants With Previously Untreated Unresectable or Metastatic Urothelial Cancer
inclusion_criteria: Histological or cytological evidence of metastatic or surgically inoperable transitional cell carcinoma of the urothelium (renal pelvis, ureter, bladder, or urethra) | No prior systemic chemotherapy for metastatic or surgically inoperable urothelial cancer | ECOG performance status 0 or 1
exclusion_criteria: Disease suitable for local therapy with curative intent | Serious or uncontrolled medical disorder that may increase risk or interfere with study participation or interpretation | Prior treatment with anti-PD-1, anti-PD-L1, anti-PD-L2, anti-CD137, or anti-CTLA-4 antibodies, or other agents targeting T-cell co-stimulation or checkpoint pathways
prior_therapies: (none)
reasoning: While the disease and age/sex match, the trial is for previously untreated metastatic urothelial cancer with no prior systemic therapy, whereas the patient is after second-line therapy, creating a line-of-therapy mismatch.
patient_inclusion_criteria: (none)
judge_comment: No hard exclusions apply (disease/age/sex match; exclusion about prior PD-1 use is unknown). Clear soft mismatch on the line-of-therapy anchor: trial requires previously untreated metastatic disease, while patient is after second-line therapy. Stage matches. Thus D is appropriate per rubric.

prior_therapies: Progression or intolerance to at least one secondary hormonal therapy required; Progression or intolerance to taxane-based chemotherapy required; Prior mTOR inhibitors, TKIs, or biologic therapies allowed; Prior PARP inhibitors permitted; Washout: chemotherapy or radiotherapy within 4 weeks (6 weeks for nitrosoureas or mitomycin C) prior to cycle 1 day 1 not allowed; Washout: oral antineoplastic agents discontinued >= 14 days prior to cycle 1 day 1

patient_inclusion_criteria: Age 66 years; Male sex; Metastatic castration-resistant prostate cancer; Progression on enzalutamide; PSMA PET avid liver and bone metastases
patient_prior_therapies: Progression on enzalutamide; Prior abiraterone (Zytiga) with leuprolide (Lupron) for 3 years

diseases_targeted: Small Cell Bladder Carcinoma; Small Cell Urethral Carcinoma; Small Cell Ureter Carcinoma; Small Cell Prostate Carcinoma; Prostate Neuroendocrine Neoplasm

question_text: I have a 40 year old patient with non-smallcell lung cancer. Diagnosed de novo metastatic disease (bone, liver) with EGFR exon 19 deletion. He has been on Osimertinib for 2 years with complete response. Unfortunately, began having headaches and recent MRI shows numerous lesions. Otherwise no past medical issues and ECOG 0. Are there any trial options?
trial_title: A Biomarker-Driven Protocol for Previously Treated ALK-Positive Non-Squamous NSCLC Patients: The NCI-NRG ALK Protocol
inclusion_criteria: Histologically or cytologically confirmed stage IV ALK-positive non-squamous NSCLC | ALK rearrangement demonstrated by FDA-approved assay (FISH or IHC) or by NGS | Willing and able to undergo a fresh biopsy or provide recent post-progression biopsy with sufficient tissue | Progressive disease per RECIST 1.1 after exactly one second-generation ALK inhibitor (ceritinib, alectinib, ensartinib, or brigatinib) | Prior crizotinib allowed; the second-generation ALK inhibitor must be the last treatment before enrollment | No prior chemotherapy except one prior cycle at initial metastatic diagnosis without progression; adjuvant/neoadjuvant chemotherapy allowed if last dose >12 months before enrollment | ANC >= 1500/µL within 28 days prior to Step 2 | Platelets >= 100000/µL within 28 days prior to Step 2 | Creatinine clearance >= 60 mL/min within 28 days prior to Step 2 | Total bilirubin <= 1.5 x ULN within 28 days prior to Step 2 (except Gilbert's syndrome) | AST <= 2.5 x ULN within 28 days prior to Step 2 (<= 5 x ULN with liver metastases) | ALT <= 2.5 x ULN within 28 days prior to Step 2 (<= 5 x ULN with liver metastases) | Asymptomatic treated or untreated brain metastases allowed; measurable extracranial target lesion required if brain metastases present; stable/decreasing steroids for >= 7 days | ECOG performance status 0-2 | Acute effects of prior therapy resolved to baseline or CTCAE <= 1 (except alopecia, hearing loss) | Able to take oral medications
exclusion_criteria: Prior lorlatinib (third-generation ALK inhibitor) | Major surgery within 2 weeks before study entry | Palliative radiotherapy (< 10 fractions) within 48 hours before study entry | Stereotactic/small field brain irradiation within 1 week before study entry | Whole brain or other palliative radiotherapy within 2 weeks before study entry | Dose of next-generation ALK inhibitor (ceritinib, alectinib, ensartinib, lorlatinib) within 5 days before Step 2; brigatinib within 7 days before Step 2 | History of interstitial lung disease or interstitial fibrosis (including pneumonitis, obliterative bronchiolitis, pulmonary fibrosis) | Active inflammatory gastrointestinal disease or conditions affecting absorption (e.g., Crohn's disease, ulcerative colitis), chronic diarrhea, symptomatic diverticular disease | Clinically significant cardiovascular disease (e.g., uncontrolled hypertension, NYHA class 3 heart failure, unstable angina, poorly controlled arrhythmia, recent MI within 6 months) | Active and clinically significant bacterial, fungal, or viral infection | Active or chronic pancreatitis | Other serious illness or organ dysfunction that could compromise safety or study drug evaluation | Planned receipt of other investigational agents during therapy | Active malignancy other than ALK-positive NSCLC within 2 years, except specified adequately treated cancers | No chemotherapy and/or immunotherapy allowed after Step 1 registration | Pregnant or breastfeeding
prior_therapies: Progression after one second-generation ALK inhibitor required (ceritinib, alectinib, ensartinib, or brigatinib); Prior crizotinib allowed; No prior lorlatinib allowed; No prior chemotherapy except one cycle at initial metastatic diagnosis without progression; Prior adjuvant or neoadjuvant chemotherapy allowed if last dose > 12 months before enrollment; No chemotherapy or immunotherapy permitted after Step 1 registration
reasoning: Disease setting (metastatic NSCLC) matches, but the trial requires ALK-positive disease with progression after exactly one second-generation ALK inhibitor as the most recent therapy. The patient has EGFR exon 19-mutant NSCLC treated with osimertinib and no prior ALK inhibitor exposure documented, making them likely ineligible.
patient_inclusion_criteria: Non-small cell lung cancer; De novo metastatic disease (bone, liver); EGFR exon 19 deletion; ECOG 0; Age 40 years
judge_comment: No hard exclusions apply (ALK status unknown, age/sex OK). Stage/setting matches. There is a clear soft mismatch on line/prior exposure: trial requires progression after a second-generation ALK inhibitor, while patient received osimertinib (EGFR TKI) with no ALK inhibitor. Per rubric, any anchor soft mismatch → D. Grader’s reasoning aligns.

question_text: What are trial options for a 68-year-old male with a two-year history of progressive cognitive decline? His MMSE score is 19, consistent with moderate-stage dementia. An amyloid PET scan was performed and was negative. CSF analysis was also negative for amyloid plaques but showed elevated p-tau. His family is seeking disease-modifying therapies.
trial_title: Effect and Safety of Electroconvulsive Therapy Plus Usual Care for the Acute Management of Severe Agitation in Dementia
diseases_targeted: Alzheimer Dementia; Vascular Dementia; Frontotemporal Dementia; Dementia with Lewy Bodies
inclusion_criteria: Diagnosis of Alzheimer's dementia per NIA-AA criteria | Diagnosis of vascular dementia with MRI evidence of microvascular ischemic disease and no clinical/radiologic evidence of stroke | Diagnosis of frontotemporal dementia | Diagnosis of dementia with Lewy bodies | Mini-Mental State Examination (MMSE) <= 15 | Cohen-Mansfield Agitation Inventory (CMAI) threshold for severe agitation as specified | At least one failed pharmacological intervention to manage behavioral symptoms | Medically stable for safe ECT based on physical exam, urinalysis, and serum chemistries (and brain imaging when indicated) | Comprehension of English | Authorized legal representative able and willing to provide informed consent | Age >= 40 years
exclusion_criteria: Current co-morbid delirium by Confusion Assessment Method (CAM) or clinical diagnosis | Vascular dementia due to stroke (abrupt onset, step-wise decline, MRI evidence of hemorrhagic/embolic stroke, or exam consistent with current/prior stroke) | Schizophrenia | Bipolar disorder | Schizoaffective disorder | Active substance use disorder within the past 6 months | Treatment with ECT, transcranial magnetic stimulation, or vagal nerve stimulation within the past 3 months
prior_therapies: At least one failed pharmacological intervention for behavioral symptoms
reasoning: MMSE 19 exceeds the trial’s inclusion threshold (<=15), and the study requires severe agitation with at least one failed pharmacologic intervention for behavioral symptoms—neither is supported by the provided profile (no prior behavioral therapy, agitation not documented). Age and sex fit, and dementia subtype is unspecified but not an explicit exclusion.
patient_biomarkers: Amyloid PET negative; CSF amyloid negative; Elevated CSF p-tau
patient_inclusion_criteria: Age 68 years; Male; Two-year history of progressive cognitive decline; MMSE score 19; Moderate-stage dementia; Amyloid PET negative; CSF amyloid negative; Elevated CSF p-tau
judge_comment: No hard exclusions apply (age/sex ok; disease subtype unspecified so not an explicit mismatch; exclusions not triggered). There are clear soft mismatches on core anchors: required stage/severity (MMSE <=15 and severe agitation) not met (MMSE 19, agitation not documented) and required prior failed behavioral pharmacotherapy absent. Thus D per rubric.

history of immunotherapy-related colitis, uveitis, myocarditis or pneumonitis; or immunotherapy-related AEs requiring >20 mg/day prednisone equivalent | Uncontrolled diabetes within 3 months (HbA1c >= 8% or 7% to <8% with diabetes symptoms) | Prior treatment with enfortumab vedotin or other MMAE-based ADCs | Second malignancy within 3 years or residual disease from prior malignancy (exceptions apply) | Active systemic infection requiring treatment; active hepatitis B or C; known HIV infection | Recent significant cardiovascular event within 6 months (stroke/TIA, unstable angina, MI, or NYHA III–IV heart failure) | Major surgery within 4 weeks before first dose | Prior radiotherapy, chemotherapy, biologics, investigational agents, or immunotherapy not completed >= 2 weeks before first dose | Known hypersensitivity to enfortumab vedotin or CHO cell products/excipients | Active keratitis or corneal ulcerations (adequately treated superficial punctate keratitis allowed) | Any condition that makes the subject unsuitable for study participation | Cohort 9: Disease progression within 6 months of completing curative systemic therapy for locoregionally advanced HNSCC | Cohort 9: Prior allogeneic tissue/solid organ transplant | Cohort 9: Severe hypersensitivity (>= Grade 3) to pembrolizumab or its excipients | Cohort 9: History of non-infectious pneumonitis/ILD requiring steroids or current pneumonitis/ILD | Cohort 9: Idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis, organizing pneumonia, drug-induced/idiopathic pneumonitis, or active pneumonitis on screening CT | Cohort 9: Life expectancy < 3 months or rapidly progressing disease per investigator | Cohort 9: Active autoimmune disease requiring systemic treatment in past 2 years (specified exceptions allowed) | Cohort 9: Active infection requiring systemic therapy | Cohort 9: Prior anti-PD-1/PD-L1 therapy in the recurrent/metastatic setting (if given as curative therapy, must be >= 1 year since last dose) | Cohort 9: Live vaccine within 30 days before start of therapy | Cohort 9: Active tuberculosis
prior_therapies: Breast cancer (HR+/HER2- or TNBC): Prior taxane or anthracycline in neoadjuvant/adjuvant or advanced setting; Breast cancer HR+: >=1 prior cytotoxic regimen in advanced setting; <=2 prior cytotoxic lines; progression after endocrine therapy and/or CDK inhibitor (CDK inhibitor not required); TNBC: >=1 prior cytotoxic regimen in advanced setting; <=2 prior cytotoxic lines; prior anti-PD-1/PD-L1 with progression/toxicity or contraindicated; Squamous and non-squamous NSCLC: Progressed/relapsed or toxic after 1 platinum-based regimen for advanced disease; <=2 prior cytotoxic lines; prior anti-PD-1/PD-L1 with progression/toxicity or contraindicated; actionable mutations treated with targeted therapy if present; Head and neck cancer (2L+): Progressed/relapsed or toxic after 1 platinum-based regimen; <=2 prior cytotoxic lines; prior anti-PD-1/PD-L1 with progression/toxicity or contraindicated; Gastric/GEJ/esophageal: Progressed/relapsed or toxic after 1 platinum-based regimen; <=2 prior cytotoxic lines; HER2+ must have received HER2-directed therapy; prior anti-PD-1/PD-L1 with progression/toxicity or contraindicated; All cohorts: Prior anti-cancer therapies completed >= 2 weeks before first dose
reasoning: Disease and stage match (metastatic NSCLC, ECOG 0), and EGFR-mutant disease is allowed after targeted therapy, but the NSCLC cohorts require prior platinum-based chemotherapy and prior PD-1/PD-L1 therapy (or documented contraindication), which the patient lacks—making line-of-therapy a soft mismatch.
patient_inclusion_criteria: Non-small cell lung cancer; De novo metastatic disease (bone, liver); EGFR exon 19 deletion; ECOG 0; Age 40 years
judge_comment: No hard exclusions. Disease and metastatic setting match, but the NSCLC cohorts require prior platinum-based chemo and prior PD-1/PD-L1 (or contraindication) with progression, which the patient lacks. This is a clear line-of-therapy soft mismatch → D. The grader’s reasoning aligns with the rubric.

question_text: A 55-year-old female has severe, seropositive rheumatoid arthritis refractory to methotrexate and two prior biologic agents (adalimumab and tocilizumab). She has active disease with a DAS28 score of 5.5. Critically, she has a history of treated Hepatitis B (HBsAg negative, anti-HBc positive) and moderate chronic kidney disease with an eGFR of 45 mL/min/1.73m². What are trial options for her?
trial_title: Global, Multicenter, and Prospective Post-Market Clinical Follow-Up Study of the G7 Acetabular System With Vivacit-E and Longevity Highly Crosslinked Polyethylene (HXLPE) Liners & Instrumentation
diseases_targeted: Hip Avascular Necrosis; Hip Degenerative Joint Disease; Hip Fracture; Hip Osteoarthritis; Hip Rheumatoid Arthritis
inclusion_criteria: Adult with full skeletal maturity | Indicated for noninflammatory degenerative joint disease (including osteoarthritis and avascular necrosis) | Rheumatoid arthritis of the hip | Correction of functional deformity of the hip | Treatment of non-union, femoral neck fracture, or trochanteric fractures of the proximal femur with head involvement unmanageable by other techniques | Revision procedure where other treatment or devices have failed
exclusion_criteria: Osteoporosis that may limit ability to support total hip arthroplasty | Metabolic disorder that may impair bone formation | Osteomalacia | Infection, sepsis, osteomyelitis, or distant foci of infection that may spread to the implant site | Rapid joint destruction, marked bone loss, or bone resorption on imaging | Vascular insufficiency, muscular atrophy, or neuromuscular disease | Current alcohol or drug abuse | Neurologic disorder with inability or unwillingness to follow directions | Pregnancy
prior_therapies: (none)
reasoning: While the patient has rheumatoid arthritis, this device study enrolls adults specifically indicated for total hip arthroplasty (e.g., rheumatoid arthritis of the hip). The patient’s profile does not indicate hip involvement or a surgical indication, creating a stage/setting mismatch; age and sex fit and no explicit exclusions are evident.
patient_inclusion_criteria: Age 55 years; Female; Seropositive rheumatoid arthritis; Active disease (DAS28 5.5)
patient_prior_therapies: Refractory to methotrexate; Prior adalimumab; Prior tocilizumab; Failed two prior biologic agents
judge_comment: No hard exclusions apply (age/sex fit; no explicit exclusions; disease potentially relevant as RA with possible hip involvement). The trial’s setting requires hip involvement/THA indication, which is not contradicted but simply unknown from the patient data. Per rubric, unknowns are neutral, not a soft mismatch. With no clear anchor matches and no soft conflicts, the correct grade is C, not D.

question_text: What are trial options for a 68-year-old male with a two-year history of progressive cognitive decline? His MMSE score is 19, consistent with moderate-stage dementia. An amyloid PET scan was performed and was negative. CSF analysis was also negative for amyloid plaques but showed elevated p-tau. His family is seeking disease-modifying therapies.
trial_title: A Phase 3, Double-Blind, Randomized, Placebo-Controlled, Parallel Group, Multicenter Study to Evaluate the Efficacy, Safety, Tolerability, and Pharmacokinetics of Masupirdine (SUVN-502) for the Treatment of Agitation in Participants With Dementia of the Alzheimer's Type
inclusion_criteria: Diagnosis of dementia of the Alzheimer's type per NIA-AA criteria. | Confirmed agitation per IPA Consensus Provisional Definition of Agitation in Cognitive Disorders. | MMSE score 8 to 24 (inclusive).
exclusion_criteria: Dementia predominantly of the non-Alzheimer's type (e.g., vascular dementia, Parkinson's disease, Lewy body disease, frontotemporal dementia). | Agitation not secondary to Alzheimer's disease (e.g., due to pain, other psychiatric disorder, delirium from metabolic disorder, systemic infection, or substance-induced).
prior_therapies: (none)
reasoning: The trial requires dementia of the Alzheimer's type; the patient’s amyloid PET and CSF amyloid are negative, suggesting a non-AD profile that likely conflicts with this requirement (the trial excludes non-AD dementias). Age (68) and MMSE (19) are within range, but agitation status is not provided.
patient_biomarkers: Amyloid PET negative; CSF amyloid negative; Elevated CSF p-tau
patient_inclusion_criteria: Age 68 years; Male; Two-year history of progressive cognitive decline; MMSE score 19; Moderate-stage dementia; Amyloid PET negative; CSF amyloid negative; Elevated CSF p-tau
judge_comment: No hard exclusions: age/sex within bounds; disease not definitively non-AD (cannot F on disease mismatch). Core anchors: Stage/setting (agitation) unknown; Line/prior N/A; Required subtype (AD) shows a soft mismatch given amyloid PET and CSF amyloid are negative, suggesting non-AD; mets N/A. Presence of a specific soft mismatch on a core anchor → D. Grader’s reasoning aligns with rubric.

question_text: What are trial options for a 68-year-old male with a two-year history of progressive cognitive decline? His MMSE score is 19, consistent with moderate-stage dementia. trial_title: A Phase 3, Randomized, Double-Blind, Placebo-Controlled Relapse Prevention Study to Evaluate the Safety and Efficacy of KarXT for the Treatment of Psychosis Associated With Alzheimer's Disease
inclusion_criteria: Age 55 to 90 years | Possible or probable Alzheimer's disease diagnosis | Brain MRI or CT to rule out other CNS disease (within past 5 years or during screening) | History of psychotic symptoms meeting IPA criteria for >=2 months prior to screening | CGI-S score >=4 (moderate) at screening and baseline | Moderate to severe delusions or hallucinations per NPI-C criteria at screening and baseline | MMSE score 8 to 22, inclusive, at screening | Stable dose of cholinesterase inhibitor and/or memantine for >=6 weeks prior to screening (if taking) | BMI 18 to 40 kg/m2 | Female not pregnant or breastfeeding; effective contraception required for WOCBP and partners as specified
exclusion_criteria: Psychotic symptoms primarily due to a condition other than Alzheimer's disease | Major depressive episode with psychotic features within 12 months prior to screening | History of bipolar disorder, schizophrenia, or schizoaffective disorder | Significant or severe medical conditions that could jeopardize safety or study validity | eGFR <60 mL/min/1.73 m2 (significant or severe renal impairment) | History of ischemic stroke within 12 months prior to screening or any hemorrhagic stroke | History of cerebral amyloid angiopathy, epilepsy, CNS neoplasm, unstable thyroid function, or unexplained syncope | NYHA Class 2 congestive heart failure | Grade 2 or greater angina pectoris | Sustained ventricular tachycardia, ventricular fibrillation, or torsade de pointes | Implantable cardioverter defibrillator | Myocardial infarction within 6 months prior to screening | Personal or family history suggestive of long QT syndrome | HIV infection, cirrhosis, biliary duct abnormalities, hepatobiliary carcinoma, or active hepatic viral infections | High risk of urinary retention, gastric retention, or narrow-angle glaucoma | Males: history of bladder stones | Males: history of recurrent urinary tract infections | Males: PSA >10 ng/mL at screening | Males: IPSS score of 5 (almost always) on items 1, 3, 5, or 6 | Males: sum of IPSS items 1, 3, 5, and 6 >=9 | History of irritable bowel syndrome or serious constipation requiring treatment within last 6 months | Risk of suicidal behavior per clinical assessment and/or C-SSRS | Clinically significant abnormal physical exam, ECG, or clinical laboratory findings at screening | Urine toxicology positive for substances other than permitted cannabis or short-/medium-acting benzodiazepines unless approved by Medical Monitor | Recent use of MAO inhibitors, anticonvulsants (e.g., lamotrigine, divalproex), lithium, or tricyclic antidepressants; SSRIs/SNRIs allowed only if stable >=8 weeks; mirtazapine or trazodone as hypnotic allowed only if started >=8 weeks | Investigator/Sponsor judgment of unsuitability for the study | Positive COVID-19 test within 2 weeks before or at screening | Unable to taper/discontinue prohibited concomitant medications | Prior exposure to KarXT | Known hypersensitivity to trospium or prior significant adverse events due to trospium | Received an investigational drug within 3 months prior to screening or >2 clinical studies in past year
prior_therapies: Stable cholinesterase inhibitor and/or memantine for >=6 weeks prior to screening permitted; SSRIs or SNRIs permitted if on a stable dose for >=8 weeks prior to screening; Mirtazapine or trazodone may be used as hypnotic if started >=8 weeks prior to screening; No investigational drug within 3 months prior to screening
reasoning: Age and MMSE fit, but the trial specifically requires psychosis associated with Alzheimer’s disease and a possible/probable AD diagnosis; the patient has dementia without documented psychotic symptoms and amyloid-negative biomarkers arguing against AD. This creates a likely eligibility mismatch, though not an explicit exclusion.
patient_biomarkers: Amyloid PET negative; CSF amyloid negative; Elevated CSF p-tau
patient_inclusion_criteria: Age 68 years; Male; Two-year history of progressive cognitive decline; MMSE score 19; Moderate-stage dementia; Amyloid PET negative; CSF amyloid negative; Elevated CSF p-tau

prior_therapies: Prior adjuvant or neoadjuvant hormonal therapy allowed if discontinued >= 12 months ago and total duration <= 24 months (last depot injection expired by 24 months); Prior palliative radiotherapy allowed if commenced within 30 days before starting androgen deprivation; Anti-androgen therapy allowed as single agent <= 7 days before medical castration to prevent flare; Concurrent antiandrogen therapy allowed, but not as sole hormonal therapy; At least 4 weeks since prior major surgery and recovered from toxicity; > 30 days (or 6 half-lives, whichever is longer) since prior participation in another clinical trial

judge_comment: Hard exclusion applies: the trial targets metastatic hormone-sensitive prostate cancer and explicitly excludes prior hormone therapy in the metastatic setting. The patient has mCRPC with prior enzalutamide and abiraterone, so F is correct.
